quote.zh-TW: 學而時習之，不亦說乎？有朋自遠方來，不亦樂乎？人不知而不慍，不亦君子乎？
quote.en: Is it not a joy to learn and practice what you have learned? Is it not a joy to have friends come from afar? Is it not a virtue to be unbothered when others do not understand you?

meaning.zh-TW: 學到的新東西，常常去練習和複習，不是很開心嗎？有好朋友從很遠的地方來看你，不是很令人快樂嗎？如果別人不了解你，你也不會生氣，這樣不就是一個很棒的人嗎？
meaning.en: Learning new things and practicing them often brings joy. Isn't it delightful when friends come from afar? And if others do not understand you, remaining unbothered is a sign of being a great person.

quote.zh-TW: 千里之行，始於足下。
quote.en: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

meaning.zh-TW: 就算是非常非常遠的旅行，也是從腳下的第一步開始的。這句話告訴我們，不管多麼困難或多麼大的事情，只要我們勇敢地踏出第一步，然後一步一步地走下去，就一定能夠完成。
meaning.en: Even a very, very long trip starts with the first step you take. This tells us that no matter how hard or big a task is, as long as we bravely take the first step and then keep going, we can definitely finish it.

quote.el: Ἡ δὲ διάνοια...αὐτὴ πρὸς αὑτὴν διάλογος
quote.zh-TW: 思想是靈魂與自己的對話。
quote.en: Thinking is the soul talking to itself.

meaning.zh-TW: 你有沒有在心裡默默地跟自己說話呢？柏拉圖認為，這就是「思考」。當我們在思考的時候，就像是我們的內心深處，也就是「靈魂」，正在跟自己聊天、問問題和尋找答案。這是一個很奇妙的內心小旅行！
meaning.en: Have you ever quietly talked to yourself in your head? Plato believed that this is what 'thinking' is. When we think, it's like our deepest inner self, or 'soul,' is chatting with itself, asking questions, and finding answers. It's a wonderful little journey inside your mind!

quote.el: Μία χελιδὼν ἔαρ οὐ ποιεῖ.
quote.zh-TW: 一燕不成春。
quote.en: One swallow does not make a spring.

meaning.zh-TW: 看到一隻燕子，不代表整個春天就來了。這句話告訴我們，不要只憑一件事情就太快下結論。就像做好事一樣，只做一次是不夠的，要持續不斷地做好事，才能真正帶來美好的結果。成功和快樂都需要時間和努力，不是一瞬間就能得到的。
meaning.en: Seeing one swallow doesn't mean that spring has arrived. This quote tells us not to jump to conclusions based on a single event. Just like doing good deeds, doing it once isn't enough. We need to consistently do good things to bring about truly wonderful results. Success and happiness require time and effort; they don't happen in an instant.

quote.la: Ubicumque homo est, ibi beneficii locus est.
quote.zh-TW: 只要有人類的地方，就有機會展現善意。
quote.en: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for a kindness.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位哲學家提醒我們，無論我們在哪裡，無論我們遇到誰，我們隨時都有機會對別人好。一個微笑、一句謝謝，或是在別人需要的時候幫他一下，都是善意的表現。我們的世界因為這些小小的善意而變得更溫暖。
meaning.en: This philosopher reminds us that no matter where we are or who we meet, we always have a chance to be kind to others. A smile, a 'thank you,' or helping someone when they need it are all acts of kindness. Our world becomes a warmer place because of these small, kind actions.

quote.el: Ἄριστος τρόπος τοῦ ἀμύνεσθαι, τὸ μὴ ἐξομοιοῦσθαι.
quote.zh-TW: 最好的報復，就是不要成為像他那樣的人。
quote.en: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果有人對你做了不好的事，最好的「報仇」方法，不是也用壞方法對待他，而是讓自己變得更好，絕對不要變成像他一樣的人。與其生氣報復，不如專心讓自己成為一個善良、有品格的人。
meaning.en: If someone does something bad to you, the best 'revenge' is not to treat them badly in return, but to make yourself better and never become like them. Instead of getting angry and seeking revenge, focus on being a kind and good person.

quote.fa: دیروز که عاقل بودم، میخواستم دنیا را تغییر دهم. امروز که خردمندم، خود را تغییر می دهم.
quote.zh-TW: 昨日我聰明，所以我想改變世界。今日我智慧，所以我正改變自己。
quote.en: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話告訴我們，當我們年輕時，可能總想著要改變這個世界，讓一切都變得很完美。但當我們長大，變得更有智慧時，會發現真正能改變的其實是自己。與其要求別人改變，不如先從改變自己、讓自己進步開始，這才是最有力量的喔！
meaning.en: This quote tells us that when we're young, we might always think about changing the world and making everything perfect. But as we grow wiser, we realize that the one thing we can truly change is ourselves. Instead of demanding that others change, it's more powerful to start by changing and improving ourselves!

quote.la: Non exiguum temporis habemus, sed multum perdidimus.
quote.zh-TW: 不是我們擁有的時間太短，而是我們浪費的時間太多。
quote.en: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.

meaning.zh-TW: 想像一下時間就像是你的零用錢。塞內卡告訴我們，問題不是零用錢太少，而是我們常常亂花錢，買了一些不需要的東西。時間也是一樣，我們擁有的時間並不少，但我們常常把它浪費在沒意義的事情上。所以，要好好珍惜時間，把它花在學習、玩耍和陪伴家人朋友這些開心又有意義的事情上喔！
meaning.en: Imagine time is like your allowance. Seneca tells us that the problem isn't that your allowance is too small, but that we often spend it carelessly on things we don't need. Time is the same way. We have plenty of time, but we often waste it on unimportant things. So, we should cherish our time and spend it on fun and meaningful things like learning, playing, and being with family and friends!

quote.el: Ἀρχὴ παντὸς ἔργου μέγιστον.
quote.zh-TW: 凡事起頭最重要。
quote.en: The beginning is the most important part of the work.

meaning.zh-TW: 柏拉圖認為，不管做什麼事，剛開始的那一步是最重要的。就像蓋一座樂高城堡，第一塊積木如果放歪了，整個城堡可能都會不穩。所以，無論是寫作業、畫畫還是學新的才藝，只要我們一開始就認真、專心地打好基礎，後面的事情就會變得更順利喔！
meaning.en: Plato believed that no matter what you are doing, the very first step is the most important. It's like building a LEGO castle: if you place the first brick crooked, the whole castle might be unstable. So, whether it's doing homework, drawing a picture, or learning a new skill, if we are serious and focused on building a good foundation at the start, everything that follows will go much more smoothly!

quote.zh-TW: 惻隱之心，人皆有之。
quote.en: The feeling of compassion is common to all human beings.

meaning.zh-TW: 看到小動物受傷，你會不會覺得很心疼，想要幫助牠？孟子說，這種想要幫助別人、不忍心看到別人受苦的心情，是每個人天生就有的喔。這份善良的心，讓我們成為一個溫暖的人。
meaning.en: When you see a small animal get hurt, do you feel sad for it and want to help? Mencius said that this feeling of wanting to help others and not wanting to see them suffer is something everyone is born with. This kind heart is what makes us warm and caring people.

quote.zh-TW: 吾生也有涯，而知也無涯。
quote.en: My life has a limit, but knowledge has no limit.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們的生命是有限的，就像一天只有 24 小時。但是，世界上可以學習的知識是無限的，就像一座永遠也玩不完的巨大遊樂園。所以，每天都抱著好奇心去學習新東西，是一件非常快樂又有趣的事情！
meaning.en: Our life is limited, just like a day only has 24 hours. However, the knowledge in the world is limitless, like a giant amusement park that you can never fully explore. So, being curious and learning new things every day is a very happy and fun adventure!

quote.zh-TW: 知己知彼，百戰不殆。
quote.en: Know your enemy and know yourself, and you will not be imperiled in a hundred battles.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話不只是用在打仗喔！想像一下你要參加一場考試。「知彼」就是了解考試會考什麼，「知己」就是了解自己哪些學會了、哪些還不熟。如果你兩個都清楚，就能做好萬全準備，不管遇到什麼挑戰都不用害怕了！
meaning.en: This isn't just for battles! Imagine you have a test coming up. 'Knowing the enemy' is like understanding what questions will be on the test. 'Knowing yourself' is understanding what you've learned well and what you still need to practice. If you know both, you can be fully prepared and won't have to be afraid of any challenge!

quote.el: Τῶν ὄντων τὰ μέν ἐστιν ἐφ' ἡμῖν, τὰ δὲ οὐκ ἐφ' ἡμῖν.
quote.zh-TW: 有些事情操之在我，有些則不然。
quote.en: Some things are within our control, and some things are not.

meaning.zh-TW: 你沒辦法控制明天下不下雨，對吧？但是，你可以控制自己要不要帶傘，或者就算下雨了，也要保持開心的心情。這句話提醒我們，要把力氣花在我們可以控制的事情上，像是我們的想法和行為，而不是去煩惱那些我們無法改變的事。
meaning.en: You can't control whether it rains tomorrow, right? But you can control whether you bring an umbrella, or decide to stay cheerful even if it does rain. This quote reminds us to focus our energy on things we can control, like our thoughts and actions, instead of worrying about things we cannot change.

quote.el: Πασῶν ὧν ἡ σοφία παρασκευάζεται εἰς τὴν τοῦ βίου παντὸς μακαριότητα, μέγιστόν ἐστιν ἡ τῆς φιλίας κτῆσις.
quote.zh-TW: 在智慧所提供的一切以使人終身幸福之事物中，最重要的是擁有友誼。
quote.en: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make life entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼東西能讓我們得到真正的快樂呢？伊比鳩魯認為，在所有東西裡面，沒有什麼比「朋友」更重要了。有好朋友跟我們一起玩、分享祕密、互相幫忙，這份友誼帶來的快樂，是任何玩具或點心都比不上的無價之寶。
meaning.en: What brings us true happiness? Epicurus believed that out of everything, nothing is more important than 'friends.' Having good friends to play with, share secrets with, and help each other brings a kind of happiness that no toy or snack can compare to. It's a priceless treasure.

quote.la: Amicus est tamquam alter idem.
quote.zh-TW: 朋友彷彿是第二個自己。
quote.en: A friend is, as it were, a second self.

meaning.zh-TW: 你是不是有一個超級好朋友，他懂你的笑話，也知道你什麼時候會難過？西塞羅說，一個真正的好朋友，就像是世界上另一個你。你們非常了解彼此，心意相通，和他在一起就像和自己在一起一樣自在。擁有這樣的朋友是一件很幸運的事！
meaning.en: Do you have a super best friend who gets your jokes and knows when you're sad? Cicero said that a true friend is like another you in the world. You understand each other so well that being with them is as comfortable as being with yourself. It's very lucky to have a friend like that!

quote.zh-TW: 兼相愛，交相利。
quote.en: Love all people universally, and you will mutually benefit one another.

meaning.zh-TW: 墨子希望我們不只愛自己的家人和朋友，而是要愛世界上所有的人。他相信，如果我們每個人都對別人好，不分親疏遠近，那麼大家就能互相幫助，整個世界都會因此變得更和平、更美好，每個人也都能從中得到好處。
meaning.en: Mozi hoped that we would love not only our own family and friends, but everyone in the world. He believed that if every one of us is kind to others, no matter who they are, then we can all help each other. The whole world would become more peaceful and beautiful, and everyone would benefit from it.

quote.ar: لا نستحيي من الحق واقتناء الحق من أين أتى، وإن أتى من الأجناس القاصية عنا والأمم المباينة لنا.
quote.zh-TW: 我們不應為承認真理和吸收真理而感到羞愧，無論它來自何方，即使它來自遙遠的民族和與我們不同的國家。
quote.en: We should not be ashamed to acknowledge truth and to assimilate it from whatever source it comes to us, even if it is brought to us by former generations and foreign peoples.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個好點子或一個對的知識，不管它是誰想出來的，我們都應該開心地學習。就算這個想法來自一個我們不認識的人，或是一個很遙遠國家的人，只要它是「真理」，就值得我們去了解。保持一顆開放的心，能讓我們學到更多東西！
meaning.en: A good idea or a piece of true knowledge should be happily learned, no matter who came up with it. Even if the idea comes from someone we don't know or from a person in a faraway country, as long as it is the 'truth,' it is worth understanding. Keeping an open mind helps us learn so much more!

quote.el: Τῆς παιδείας αἱ μὲν ῥίζαι πικραί, ὁ δὲ καρπὸς γλυκύς.
quote.zh-TW: 教育的根是苦的，但其果實是甜的。
quote.en: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.

meaning.zh-TW: 學習一開始可能會覺得有點辛苦、有點無聊，就像在啃苦澀的樹根一樣。但是，只要你堅持下去，學到的知識和能力，會像樹上結出的甜美果實一樣，讓你的人生變得更棒、更有趣！
meaning.en: Learning might feel a little hard or boring at first, like chewing on bitter tree roots. But if you keep going, the knowledge and skills you gain will be like sweet fruits growing on that tree, making your life better and more interesting!

quote.la: Si hortum in bibliotheca habes, nihil deerit.
quote.zh-TW: 如果你在圖書館旁有個花園，你就不會缺少任何東西了。
quote.en: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話的意思是，如果我們有書可以讀（就像圖書館），還有大自然可以親近（就像花園），那麼我們的心靈和身體就都能得到滿足。書本給我們知識，花園讓我們放鬆，這兩樣東西就能帶來最簡單也最豐富的快樂。
meaning.en: This means that if we have books to read (like a library) and nature to be close to (like a garden), then our minds and bodies can both be happy. Books give us knowledge, and gardens help us relax. These two things can bring us the simplest and richest kind of happiness.

quote.pi: न हि वेरेन वेरानि सम्मन्तीध कुदाचनं । अवेरेन च सम्मन्ति एस धम्μο सनन्तनो ॥
quote.zh-TW: 在這世上，恨絕不能止恨，唯有愛能止恨。此乃永恆的真理。
quote.en: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你對別人生氣，用生氣的方式去回應他，仇恨和不開心只會越來越多。就像火不能滅火一樣。唯一能化解仇恨的，是愛與寬容。當你用善良去對待別人時，才能真正停止爭吵，讓世界更和平。
meaning.en: If you are angry at someone and you respond with more anger, the hatred and unhappiness will only grow, just like fire cannot put out another fire. The only thing that can end hatred is love and forgiveness. When you treat others with kindness, you can truly stop arguments and make the world more peaceful.

quote.el: Εὐδαιμονίη ψυχῆς οἰκητήριον.
quote.zh-TW: 幸福居住在靈魂之中。
quote.en: Happiness dwells in the soul.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的快樂，不是來自於你擁有多少玩具或多少錢，而是來自於你的內心。這位哲學家告訴我們，快樂是一種內心的感覺，只要我們心地善良、知足常樂，就算沒有很多東西，也能感覺到滿滿的幸福。
meaning.en: True happiness doesn't come from how many toys or how much money you have; it comes from within your heart. This philosopher tells us that happiness is a feeling inside you. As long as we are kind and content with what we have, we can feel very happy even without owning a lot of things.

quote.el: ὁ νοῦς οὐ δεῖται, ὥσπερ αὐλὸς ἀγγείου, πλήρωσεως, ἀλλὰ μόνον ὑπεκκαύματος.
quote.zh-TW: 心靈不是一個需要被填滿的容器，而是一把需要被點燃的火焰。
quote.en: The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.

meaning.zh-TW: 學習不只是老師把知識一直倒進你的腦袋裡，直到裝滿為止。真正的學習，是點燃你心中的好奇心，讓你主動想去探索、發問和思考。當你對世界充滿好奇時，你的學習火焰就會越燒越旺！
meaning.en: Learning isn't just about a teacher pouring knowledge into your head until it's full. Real learning is about lighting up the curiosity in your heart, making you want to explore, ask questions, and think on your own. When you are curious about the world, your fire for learning will burn brighter and brighter!

quote.el: Κρεῖσσον σιγᾶν, ἢ λόγους ἀνοήτους λέγειν.
quote.zh-TW: 沉默勝於無意義的空談。
quote.en: Silence is better than unmeaning words.

meaning.zh-TW: 你有沒有遇過有人一直說話，但都沒什麼重點？畢達哥拉斯認為，與其說一些沒有意義的話，還不如保持安靜，好好思考或聆聽。說話要像送禮物一樣，要送出有價值、有幫助的話語。
meaning.en: Have you ever met someone who talks all the time but doesn't say anything important? Pythagoras believed that it's better to be quiet and think or listen, rather than just saying a lot of meaningless things. Our words should be like gifts—valuable and helpful to others.

quote.fa: آدمی که مار گزیده باشد، از ریسمان سیاه و سفید می ترسد.
quote.zh-TW: 被蛇咬過一次的人，會害怕一條看起來像蛇的繩子。
quote.en: A man who has been bitten by a snake is afraid of a black and white rope.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話的意思是，如果我們在某件事情上有過不好的經驗，下一次遇到類似的情況時，就可能會變得很小心，甚至有點害怕。這提醒我們，過去的經驗會影響我們現在的感覺，同時也讓我們理解為什麼別人有時候會感到害怕。
meaning.en: This means that if we've had a bad experience with something, we might become very cautious or even scared the next time we face a similar situation. It reminds us that our past experiences can affect how we feel now, and it also helps us understand why other people might feel afraid sometimes.

quote.zh-TW: 論莫定於有證。
quote.en: A theory is not established without evidence.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你跟朋友說你看過外星人，他一定會問：「真的嗎？你有證據嗎？」王充告訴我們，不管是什麼說法或理論，都需要有證據來支持它，大家才會相信。這也教會我們要多多思考，不要隨便相信沒有證據的事情。
meaning.en: If you told your friend you saw an alien, they would probably ask, 'Really? Do you have proof?' Wang Chong tells us that no matter what someone claims, it needs evidence to support it before people can believe it. This also teaches us to think carefully and not just believe things that have no proof.

quote.el: Σοὶ ἐπὶ τῆς ὑπολήψεως τῆς σῆς ἡ ἐξουσία...γνόντι τοῦτο, εὕρηται κράτος.
quote.zh-TW: 你擁有掌控自己心智的力量，而非掌控外界事物。明白了這一點，你將找到力量。
quote.en: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們無法控制天氣會不會放晴，也無法控制別人說什麼。但我們永遠可以控制自己的想法。當你明白，真正的力量不是去改變世界，而是改變你看待世界的方式時，你就變得非常強大了，沒有什麼能輕易打倒你。
meaning.en: We can't control whether the sun will shine, and we can't control what other people say. But we can always control our own thoughts. When you understand that real power isn't about changing the world, but about changing how you see the world, you become very strong, and nothing can easily defeat you.

quote.zh-TW: 己所不欲，勿施於人。
quote.en: What you do not wish for yourself, do not do to others.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一條很棒的生活規則！意思就是，如果你不喜歡別人對你做某件事情，例如：不喜歡別人嘲笑你，那麼，你就不應該去嘲笑別人。用你希望被對待的方式去對待每一個人，世界會更友善喔！
meaning.en: This is a great rule for life! It means that if you don't like it when someone does something to you—for example, if you don't like being made fun of—then you shouldn't make fun of other people. If you treat everyone the way you want to be treated, the world will be a much kinder place!

quote.zh-TW: 知人者智，自知者明。
quote.en: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.

meaning.zh-TW: 了解別人的想法和個性，是很聰明的表現。但更厲害、更有智慧的，是真正地了解你自己。知道自己的優點和缺點，明白自己真正想要什麼，這會讓你做出最好的選擇，成為更棒的自己。
meaning.en: Understanding other people's thoughts and personalities is a sign of intelligence. But what's even more powerful and wise is to truly understand yourself. Knowing your own strengths and weaknesses, and what you truly want, will help you make the best choices and become a better person.

quote.el: ὁ δὲ ἀνεξέταστος βίος οὐ βιωτὸς ἀνθρώπῳ.
quote.zh-TW: 未經審視的人生不值得活。
quote.en: The unexamined life is not worth living.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果我們每天只是吃飯、睡覺、玩樂，卻從來不花時間想一想「我為什麼這麼做？」或「我今天學到了什麼？」，那就有點可惜了。蘇格拉底鼓勵我們常常問自己問題，思考自己的行為和想法，這樣的人生才會更有意義、更精彩。
meaning.en: If we just eat, sleep, and play every day but never take the time to think, 'Why did I do that?' or 'What did I learn today?', then we are missing out. Socrates encourages us to ask ourselves questions often and think about our actions and thoughts. That's how life becomes more meaningful and exciting.

quote.la: Ignis aurum probat, miseria fortes viros.
quote.zh-TW: 火煉真金，逆境煉勇者。
quote.en: Fire tests gold; adversity tests strong men.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們怎麼知道黃金是不是真的？用火去燒看看就知道了。那要怎麼知道一個人是不是真的很勇敢、很堅強呢？就要看他在遇到困難的時候是怎麼做的。困難就像一場考驗，雖然很辛苦，但每一次的挑戰都會讓我們變得更強大。
meaning.en: How do we know if gold is real? We can test it with fire. And how do we know if a person is truly brave and strong? We look at how they act when they face difficulties. Difficult times are like a test. Even though they are hard, every challenge we overcome makes us stronger.

quote.el: διὰ τοῦτο δύο ὦτα ἔχομεν, στόμα δὲ ἕν, ἵνα πλείω μὲν ἀκούωμεν, ἥττονα δὲ λέγωμεν.
quote.zh-TW: 我們有兩隻耳朵和一張嘴，所以我們應該多聽少說。
quote.en: We have two ears and one mouth, so we should listen more than we say.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個很簡單卻很有趣的觀察！為什麼我們的耳朵是嘴巴的兩倍呢？這位哲學家認為，這是在提醒我們，花在「聽別人說話」的時間，應該要比「自己說話」的時間更多。仔細聆聽可以讓我們學到更多東西，也更了解別人喔。
meaning.en: This is a simple but fun observation! Why do we have twice as many ears as we have mouths? This philosopher believed it's a reminder that we should spend more time listening to others than we spend talking. Listening carefully helps us learn more things and understand people better.

quote.el: Φεῦγε μὴ ποιεῖν, ἃ τοῖς ἄλλοις ἐπιτιμῴης.
quote.zh-TW: 避免去做那些你會指責別人做的事。
quote.en: Avoid doing what you would blame others for doing.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你會因為同學插隊而生氣，那你自己也絕對不可以插隊。這句話提醒我們，在指責別人之前，要先看看自己有沒有犯同樣的錯誤。用要求別人的標準，來要求自己，這就是公平的表現。
meaning.en: If you would get angry at a classmate for cutting in line, then you should never cut in line yourself. This quote reminds us to check if we are making the same mistakes before we blame others. Holding yourself to the same standards that you expect from other people is a sign of fairness.

quote.zh-TW: 事以密成，語以泄敗。
quote.en: Matters are accomplished through secrecy; they are defeated through careless talk.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你有一個很棒的秘密計畫，像是要幫朋友準備生日驚喜，你會到處跟別人說嗎？當然不會！因為說出去，驚喜就不好玩了。這句話告訴我們，保守秘密、謹慎發言很重要，很多事情的成功，都建立在能不能管好自己的嘴巴上。
meaning.en: If you have a great secret plan, like a surprise party for your friend, would you tell everyone about it? Of course not! If you did, the surprise would be ruined. This quote tells us that keeping secrets and speaking carefully is very important. The success of many things depends on whether you can control your mouth.

quote.fa: دانش بی عمل، تباهی است و عمل بی دانش، حماقت است
quote.zh-TW: 沒有行動的知識是浪費，沒有知識的行動是愚蠢。
quote.en: Knowledge without action is wastefulness, and action without knowledge is foolishness.

meaning.zh-TW: 光是知道怎麼游泳的理論，卻從來不下水練習，那又有什麼用呢？反過來，如果根本不知道怎麼游泳就跳進水裡，那也很危險。這句話告訴我們，學習知識和實際去做一樣重要，兩者要結合起來，才能把事情做得又好又安全。
meaning.en: What's the use of only knowing the theory of how to swim if you never get in the water to practice? On the other hand, it's very dangerous to jump into the water without knowing how to swim at all. This quote tells us that learning knowledge and actually doing things are equally important. You need to combine them to do things well and safely.

quote.el: οὔτοι ἀπ᾽ ἀρχῆς πάντα θεοὶ θνητοῖσ᾽ ὑπέδειξαν, ἀλλὰ χρόνῳ ζητοῦντες ἐφευρίσκουσιν ἄμεινον.
quote.zh-TW: 神並沒有從一開始就向凡人揭示一切，但人們透過長時間的探索，找到了更好的東西。
quote.en: The gods did not reveal, from the beginning, all things to us; but in the course of time, through seeking, men find that which is better.

meaning.zh-TW: 人類不是第一天就什麼都會的。我們現在知道的很多事情，像是怎麼用電、怎麼上網，都是靠著許許多多的人，花了很多時間，不斷地尋找和研究才發現的。這句話鼓勵我們要保持好奇心，勇敢地去探索，因為這樣我們才能不斷進步，發現更好的方法來解決問題。
meaning.en: Humans didn't know everything from day one. Many things we know now, like how to use electricity or the internet, were discovered because many, many people spent a long time searching and researching. This quote encourages us to stay curious and explore bravely, because that's how we make progress and find better ways to solve problems.

quote.zh-TW: 天時不如地利，地利不如人和。
quote.en: Opportunities of time are not as good as advantages of situation; advantages of situation are not as good as the harmony of people.

meaning.zh-TW: 就算在最好的時機、最好的地點，如果團隊裡的人不合作，也很難成功。這句話告訴我們，大家團結合作、和睦相處，比任何東西都重要。一個充滿愛與合作的團隊，才是最強大的！
meaning.en: Even with the best timing and in the best place, it's hard to succeed if the people on a team don't work together. This quote tells us that everyone uniting and getting along is more important than anything else. A team full of love and cooperation is the strongest team of all!

quote.zh-TW: 不知周之夢為胡蝶與，胡蝶之夢為周與？
quote.en: Did Zhou dream he was a butterfly, or did the butterfly dream it was Zhou?

meaning.zh-TW: 莊子做了一個夢，夢見自己變成一隻快樂的蝴蝶。醒來後他想：究竟是我夢見了蝴蝶，還是蝴蝶正在做夢，夢見了牠變成了我呢？這句話讓我們思考，什麼是真實的？什麼是想像？世界比我們看到的還要奇妙喔！
meaning.en: Zhuangzi had a dream that he became a happy butterfly. When he woke up, he wondered: Was it me dreaming of being a butterfly, or is a butterfly now dreaming that it has become me? This quote makes us think about what is real and what is imagination. The world is more wonderful than we can see!

quote.la: Carpe diem.
quote.zh-TW: 活在當下 (抓住這一天)。
quote.en: Seize the day.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句有名的話提醒我們，要好好把握「今天」！不要一直擔心明天還沒發生的事，也不要一直後悔昨天做錯的事。把精神集中在現在，去學習、去玩耍、去感受，讓今天過得充實又快樂，這就是最重要的。
meaning.en: This famous phrase reminds us to make the most of 'today'! Don't spend all your time worrying about what might happen tomorrow, and don't regret what went wrong yesterday. Focus your energy on the present moment—learn, play, and experience things. Making today full and happy is what's most important.

quote.el: ταράσσει τοὺς ἀνθρώπους οὐ τὰ πράγματα, ἀλλὰ τὰ περὶ τῶν πραγμάτων δόγματα.
quote.zh-TW: 讓人們困擾的不是事情本身，而是他們對事情的看法。
quote.en: It is not things that trouble us, but our judgements about things.

meaning.zh-TW: 「考試考差了」這件事，本身不會讓你難過。讓你難過的是你覺得「考差了代表我很笨」這個想法。這位哲學家告訴我們，真正影響我們心情的，是我們對事情的想法。只要換個角度想，也許就能找到開心的力量。
meaning.en: The event of 'doing poorly on a test' doesn't, by itself, make you sad. What makes you sad is the thought, 'Doing poorly means I'm not smart.' This philosopher tells us that what truly affects our mood is our thoughts about things. If we can change our perspective, we might find the strength to be happy.

quote.zh-TW: 你只有權利去行動，但無權要求享受行動的成果。
quote.en: You have a right to perform your actions, but you are not entitled to the fruits of the actions.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你在畫畫或做勞作時，就全心全意地去享受那個過程吧！這句話教我們，要把注意力放在「努力的過程」上，而不是一直想著「能不能得第一名」。只要你盡力了，享受了其中的樂趣，這就是最重要的收穫。
meaning.en: When you are drawing or doing a craft project, just focus on enjoying the process! This quote teaches us to put our attention on the 'process of trying our best,' not on constantly thinking about 'Will I get first place?' As long as you did your best and had fun, that is the most important reward.

quote.fa: از کفر و ز اسلام برون صحرائیست، ما را به میان آن فضا سودائیست
quote.zh-TW: 在對與錯的觀念之外，有一片田野。我將在那裡與你相遇。
quote.en: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing, there is a field. I'll meet you there.

meaning.zh-TW: 有時候我們會爭論誰對誰錯，但魯米提醒我們，在這些爭論之外，有一個更寬闊的地方。在那裡，沒有指責，只有理解和愛。當我們和朋友有不同意見時，可以試著找到那個地方，好好地溝通和相處。
meaning.en: Sometimes we argue about who is right and who is wrong. But Rumi reminds us that beyond all these arguments, there is a wide-open space. In that place, there is no blaming, only understanding and love. When we have disagreements with our friends, we can try to find that place to communicate and get along peacefully.

quote.zh-TW: 你就是那個。
quote.en: That Thou Art.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句很短的話，有很深的意思。它告訴我們，你和整個宇宙，和所有的人、事、物，其實都是互相連結的，你就是世界的一部分。當你對一朵花微笑時，你也是在對自己微笑。這提醒我們要愛護萬物，因為我們都是一體的。
meaning.en: These few words have a very deep meaning. They tell us that you, the entire universe, and all people and things are actually connected. You are a part of the world. When you smile at a flower, you are also smiling at yourself. This reminds us to care for all things, because we are all one.

quote.el: ἀνδρὶ σοφῷ πᾶσα γῆ βατή.
quote.zh-TW: 對一個有智慧的人來說，整個地球都是他的家。
quote.en: To a wise man, the whole earth is his home.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個有智慧、內心開放的人，無論走到世界的哪個角落，都能感覺像在家一樣自在。他不會因為語言或文化不同而感到害怕，反而會把每個地方都當成學習和探索的新教室。這鼓勵我們用開放的心胸去認識世界！
meaning.en: A person who is wise and open-minded can feel comfortable and at home no matter where they go in the world. They won't feel scared by different languages or cultures. Instead, they see every new place as a new classroom for learning and exploring. This encourages us to get to know the world with an open heart!

quote.zh-TW: 天行健，君子以自強不息。
quote.en: As Heaven's movement is ever vigorous, so must the superior person ceaselessly strengthen himself.

meaning.zh-TW: 你看，太陽每天升起、星星不停轉動，整個宇宙都充滿活力、從不休息。這句話告訴我們，也要像宇宙一樣，每天都努力讓自己進步，學習新知、鍛鍊身體，永不停止地讓自己變得更強、更好。
meaning.en: Look, the sun rises every day and the stars are always moving; the entire universe is full of energy and never rests. This quote tells us that we should be like the universe, always working hard to improve ourselves every day—learning new things, exercising our bodies, and never stopping our journey to become stronger and better.

quote.zh-TW: 人之性惡，其善者偽也。
quote.en: Human nature is bad; their goodness is the result of conscious activity.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位哲學家認為，人生下來的時候，就像一塊需要雕琢的璞玉，可能會有一些小缺點。但是，透過後天的學習、老師的教導和自己的努力，我們可以學會善良、禮貌和智慧，成為一個品格高尚的人。善良是一種需要用心學習的選擇。
meaning.en: This philosopher believed that when we are born, we are like a rough piece of jade that needs to be carved; we might have some small flaws. However, through learning, the guidance of teachers, and our own hard work, we can learn to be kind, polite, and wise, becoming a person of great character. Goodness is a choice that requires effort to learn.

quote.zh-TW: 瑜珈是讓內心波動止息。
quote.en: Yoga is the stilling of the changing states of the mind.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們的腦袋有時候像一隻靜不下來的猴子，跳來跳去想個不停。瑜珈的目的，就是學習讓這隻猴子慢慢安靜下來。當你的心平靜了，就像清澈無波的湖水，你就能看得更清楚，感覺更平靜、更快樂。
meaning.en: Sometimes our mind is like a restless monkey, jumping from one thought to another without stopping. The purpose of yoga is to learn how to gently calm this monkey down. When your mind becomes still, like a clear, calm lake, you can see more clearly and feel more peaceful and happy.

quote.el: Μὴ τοῦ ἔχειν τὸ ὑπάρχον ἀφανίσῃς, ἀλλὰ λογίσαι ὅτι καὶ ταῦτα τῶν εὐκτῶν ἦν.
quote.zh-TW: 不要因為渴望你沒有的，而毀了你現在所擁有的；要記住，你現在擁有的，也曾是你渴望的東西。
quote.en: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.

meaning.zh-TW: 你是不是常常想要新的玩具，而忘了你手邊已經有很多好玩的玩具了呢？這句話提醒我們要懂得「感謝」。你現在擁有的家人、朋友和玩具，可能都是你曾經很想要的。好好珍惜你已經擁有的，這就是快樂的秘訣。
meaning.en: Do you often want new toys and forget about all the fun ones you already have? This quote reminds us to practice 'gratitude.' The family, friends, and toys you have now might have been things you once wished for. Cherishing what you already possess is a secret to happiness.

quote.zh-TW: 執有命者，此天下之厚害也。
quote.en: To believe in fate is the greatest harm to the world.

meaning.zh-TW: 有些人覺得，所有事情都是命中注定，努力也沒用。但墨子非常反對這種想法！他相信，我們的未來掌握在自己手裡。只要我們努力、動腦筋，就可以改變自己的處境，讓世界變得更好。所以，別相信命運，要相信自己的力量！
meaning.en: Some people feel that everything is destined to happen and that trying hard is useless. But Mozi strongly disagreed! He believed that our future is in our own hands. As long as we work hard and use our brains, we can change our situations and make the world better. So, don't believe in fate—believe in your own power!

quote.el: γένοι' οἷος ἐσσὶ μαθών.
quote.zh-TW: 去學習，並成為你自己。
quote.en: Become what you are, having learned what that is.

meaning.zh-TW: 每個人都是獨一無二的，有自己最特別的才能。這句話鼓勵我們先去學習、去探索，找出自己真正是誰、擅長什麼，然後努力地去成為那個最棒、最真實的自己，而不是去模仿別人。
meaning.en: Everyone is unique and has their own special talents. This quote encourages us to first learn and explore to find out who we truly are and what we are good at. Then, we should strive to become that best, most authentic version of ourselves, instead of trying to be like someone else.

quote.zh-TW: 善戰者，立於不敗之地。
quote.en: The skilled warrior first puts himself beyond the possibility of defeat.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個真正的高手，在想著怎麼贏別人之前，會先確保自己不會輸。這就像玩遊戲，你得先蓋好自己的基地，保護好自己，然後再想辦法進攻。先把自己的功課做好、把身體練強壯，讓自己處於最好的狀態，就是成功的第一步。
meaning.en: A true master, before thinking about how to win against others, first makes sure that they themselves cannot lose. It's like playing a game where you first build a strong base to protect yourself, and only then do you think about attacking. The first step to success is to do your own homework well, build a strong body, and put yourself in the best possible position.

quote.el: Τὰ γὰρ ἔνδον πάθη καὶ τρόποι μετακοσμοῦσι τὰ ἐκτός.
quote.zh-TW: 我們內在的品格會改變外在的現實。
quote.en: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你內心充滿快樂和善良時，你會不會覺得看到的世界也特別美麗？這句話告訴我們，改變內心比改變外在世界更有力量。當我們努力讓自己成為一個更好的人時，我們周圍的世界，以及我們遇到的事情，彷彿也會跟著變好。
meaning.en: When your heart is full of joy and kindness, don't you feel that the world you see is especially beautiful? This quote tells us that changing your inner self is more powerful than changing the outside world. When we strive to become better people, the world around us and the things that happen to us seem to become better too.

quote.zh-TW: 習慣是第二天性。
quote.en: Habit is a second nature.

meaning.zh-TW: 一件事情如果你每天都做，久而久之，做起來就會像呼吸一樣自然，這就是「習慣」。這句話提醒我們，要小心培養好習慣，像是每天閱讀、主動幫忙，因為好習慣會讓我們自然地做出好的行為。同時也要改掉壞習慣，因為它也會不知不覺影響我們喔！
meaning.en: If you do something every day, after a while, it becomes as natural as breathing. This is a 'habit.' This quote reminds us to be careful about building good habits, like reading every day or helping others, because good habits will make us act well automatically. We also need to get rid of bad habits, because they can affect us without us even noticing!

quote.el: ἀνδρεία... ἐπιστήμη τῶν δεινῶν καὶ μὴ δεινῶν.
quote.zh-TW: 勇氣是明白什麼該害怕，什麼不該害怕的知識。
quote.en: Courage is knowing what not to fear.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的勇敢，不是什麼都不怕。而是知道什麼事情是真正危險的（例如：馬路上亂跑），什麼事情只是看起來可怕，但其實可以克服的（例如：上台演講）。勇敢的人會用智慧去分辨，然後勇敢面對該做的事。
meaning.en: True courage isn't about being afraid of nothing. It's about knowing what is actually dangerous (like running into a busy street) and what just seems scary but can be overcome (like giving a speech). A brave person uses wisdom to tell the difference and then bravely faces what needs to be done.

quote.zh-TW: 天下之至柔，馳騁天下之至堅。
quote.en: The softest thing in the universe overcomes the hardest thing in the universe.

meaning.zh-TW: 想想看，水是不是很柔軟？但它可以穿透堅硬的石頭。這句話告訴我們，溫柔和彈性有時候比強硬更有力量。就像與人溝通時，溫和的語氣往往比大聲吼叫更能說服別人。
meaning.en: Think about it, isn't water very soft? But it can carve its way through hard stone. This quote teaches us that gentleness and flexibility are sometimes more powerful than being hard and rigid. Just like when talking with people, a gentle tone of voice is often more persuasive than shouting.

quote.la: Mundus est liber, et qui non peregrinantur, unam tantum paginam legunt.
quote.zh-TW: 世界是一本書，不旅行的人只讀了一頁。
quote.en: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.

meaning.zh-TW: 把世界想像成一本又厚又精彩的書！如果我們一直待在同一個地方，就等於只讀了這本書的第一頁。去不同的地方看看，認識不同的人，就像是翻開新的一頁，會讓我們的視野更開闊，人生故事更豐富。
meaning.en: Imagine the world is a big, exciting book! If we always stay in the same place, it's like we've only read the first page. Visiting different places and meeting different people is like turning to a new page. It broadens our horizons and makes our life story much richer.

quote.el: ἦθος ἀνθρώπῳ δαίμων.
quote.zh-TW: 一個人的品格就是他的命運。
quote.en: A man's character is his fate.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的未來會是什麼樣子，其實是由你現在的「品格」決定的。品格就是你習慣怎麼思考和做事，例如你誠不誠實、努不努力。你做的每一個小選擇，都在塑造你的品格，而好的品格會把你帶往好的未來，就像一個專屬的守護神！
meaning.en: What your future will be like is actually decided by your 'character' now. Character is how you usually think and act—for example, whether you are honest or hardworking. Every small choice you make shapes your character, and a good character will lead you to a good future, just like your very own guardian spirit!

quote.la: Bona opinio hominum tutior pecunia est.
quote.zh-TW: 良好的聲譽比金錢更安全。
quote.en: A good reputation is more valuable than money.

meaning.zh-TW: 錢可能會花完或弄丟，但一個好名聲——也就是大家覺得你是一個誠實、善良、值得信任的人——是別人拿不走的寶藏。當大家信任你的時候，他們會更願意幫助你、跟你合作，這比擁有再多錢都有用。
meaning.en: Money can be spent or lost, but a good reputation—meaning that people think you are honest, kind, and trustworthy—is a treasure that no one can take from you. When people trust you, they are more willing to help you and work with you, and that is more useful than having lots of money.

quote.ta: தீயினாற் சுட்டபுண் உள்ளாறும் ஆறாதே நாவினாற் சுட்ட வடு.
quote.zh-TW: 被火燒傷的傷口會癒合，但被舌頭灼傷的傷痕永不消失。
quote.en: The wound which has been burnt by fire may heal, but a wound burnt in by the tongue will never heal.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你不小心被燙到，皮膚上的傷口會慢慢好起來。但是，如果別人用很傷人的話罵你，那個心裡的傷口可能會記得很久很久。這句話提醒我們，說話要非常小心，因為壞話對別人的傷害，比身體的傷還要嚴重。
meaning.en: If you accidentally get burned, the wound on your skin will slowly get better. But if someone says very mean words to you, the wound in your heart might be remembered for a very, very long time. This quote reminds us to be very careful with our words, because mean words can hurt someone even more than a physical injury.

quote.la: Concordia parvae res crescunt, discordia maximae dilabuntur.
quote.zh-TW: 和諧使微物增長，紛爭使偉業瓦解。
quote.en: Harmony makes small things grow; lack of it makes great things decay.

meaning.zh-TW: 就算一開始只是一個很小的團隊，只要大家和睦相處、同心協力，這個團隊就會越來越強大。相反地，就算是一個很厲害的隊伍，如果成員們整天吵架、互不相讓，最後也只會失敗。團結就是力量！
meaning.en: Even if you start with a very small team, as long as everyone gets along and works together, the team will grow stronger and stronger. On the other hand, even a very powerful team will eventually fail if its members are always fighting and arguing. Unity is strength!

quote.zh-TW: 人之心，其舵也。
quote.en: A person's mind is their rudder.

meaning.zh-TW: 你知道船是靠什麼來控制方向的嗎？是「舵」。這位哲學家說，我們的心智和思想，就像是我們人生的舵。你的想法決定了你要往哪裡去。只要你的心是正直的、目標是明確的，你的人生之船就不會迷路。
meaning.en: Do you know what controls a ship's direction? It's the 'rudder.' This philosopher said that our mind and thoughts are like the rudder of our life. Your thoughts decide where you will go. As long as your mind is upright and your goals are clear, the ship of your life will not get lost.

quote.el: ἐν παντὶ παντὸς μοῖρα ἔνεστι.
quote.zh-TW: 在萬物之中，皆有萬物之分存。
quote.en: In everything, there is a portion of everything.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來很神秘！它的意思是，世界上所有的東西都是互相連結的，你中有我，我中有你。就像做蛋糕，裡面有麵粉、有雞蛋、有糖，每一小口蛋糕都包含了所有的材料。世界也是這樣，每一件小東西，都包含了整個宇宙的一點點訊息喔。
meaning.en: This quote sounds very mysterious! It means that everything in the world is connected to everything else; there's a part of me in you, and a part of you in me. It's like baking a cake, which has flour, eggs, and sugar. Every single bite of the cake contains all of the ingredients. The world is like that too—every little thing contains a tiny piece of information about the whole universe.

quote.el: τὸ δικαιοσύνην μεμαθηκέναι, τοῦ εὐδαιμονεῖν μεμαθηκέναι ἐστί.
quote.zh-TW: 學習成為正直的人，就是學習成為快樂的人。
quote.en: To have learned how to be righteous is to have learned how to be happy.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位哲學家相信，做一個正直、公平、善良的人，和得到真正的快樂，其實是同一件事。當你對別人好，不做壞事，你的心裡會很平靜、很踏實，這種內心的平靜，就是最持久、最棒的快樂。
meaning.en: This philosopher believed that being a righteous, fair, and kind person is the same thing as being truly happy. When you are good to others and don't do bad things, your heart will feel calm and steady. This inner peace is the most lasting and wonderful kind of happiness.

quote.zh-TW: 善思、善言、善行。
quote.en: Good Thoughts, Good Words, Good Deeds.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一位古老先知教導的三個最重要的生活準則。意思很簡單：第一，心裡要有善良的想法；第二，口中要說出友善的話語；第三，手中要做出有益的行為。只要做到這三件事，你就是一個很棒的人，也能讓世界更美好。
meaning.en: These are the three most important rules for life taught by an ancient prophet. The meaning is simple: First, have kind and good thoughts in your mind. Second, speak friendly and good words with your mouth. Third, do helpful and good actions with your hands. If you can do these three things, you will be a wonderful person and make the world a better place.

quote.pi: सेलो यथा एकग्घनो वातेन न समीरति एवं निंदापसंसासु न समिंजंति पंडिता।
quote.zh-TW: 如同堅固的岩石不為風所動，智者也不為毀譽所動。
quote.en: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, so are the wise not moved by praise or blame.

meaning.zh-TW: 想像你是一塊巨大又堅固的岩石，不管風怎麼吹、雨怎麼打，你都穩穩地待在那裡。一個有智慧的人，內心也像這塊岩石。別人稱讚他，他不會驕傲；別人批評他，他也不會難過。他只專注於做對的事情，內心非常平靜和穩定。
meaning.en: Imagine you are a huge, solid rock. No matter how hard the wind blows or the rain beats down, you stand firm. A wise person's heart is like that rock. When people praise them, they don't get arrogant. When people criticize them, they don't get sad. They just focus on doing what is right, with a calm and stable heart.

quote.zh-TW: 大道之行也，天下為公。
quote.en: When the Great Way is practiced, the world is for all.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是在描寫一個最理想、最美好的世界。在那個世界裡，所有東西都是大家共享的，沒有人是自私的，大家會互相幫忙，老人和小孩都會被好好照顧。這句話鼓勵我們要為這樣一個「天下為公」的美好社會而努力。
meaning.en: This describes the most ideal and wonderful world. In that world, everything is shared by everyone, no one is selfish, people help one another, and the elderly and children are well taken care of. This quote encourages us to strive for such a beautiful society where the world belongs to everyone.

quote.el: Ἡ τοῦ παντὸς μεταβολή· ὁ βίος ὑπόληψις.
quote.zh-TW: 宇宙就是變化，人生就是看法。
quote.en: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.

meaning.zh-TW: 世界上唯一不變的事情，就是「一直在變」。而我們的人生好不好，快樂不快樂，關鍵在於我們怎麼「想」、怎麼「看」。你的想法就像一支畫筆，可以把你的人生畫成彩色的，也可以畫成灰色的。
meaning.en: The only thing in the world that never changes is that everything is 'always changing.' And whether our life is good or happy depends on how we 'think' about it and 'see' it. Your thoughts are like a paintbrush: they can paint your life in bright colors, or they can paint it in shades of gray.

quote.pka: सव्वे जीवा वि इच्छंति जीविउं, न मरिजिउं।
quote.zh-TW: 一切眾生皆欲生，不欲死。
quote.en: All living beings desire to live, not to die.

meaning.zh-TW: 不只是人類，就連小貓、小狗、小昆蟲，每一個有生命的東西，都喜歡活著，不喜歡被傷害。這位古老的智者教導我們，要尊重所有生命。因為大家都想好好活著，所以我們不應該去傷害任何生物。
meaning.en: It's not just humans, but also little cats, dogs, and even tiny insects—every living thing loves to be alive and does not like to be harmed. This ancient wise man taught us to respect all life. Because everyone wants to live, we should not harm any living creature.

quote.zh-TW: 不登高山，不知天之高也；不臨深谿，不知地之厚也。
quote.en: If you do not climb a high mountain, you will not know the height of the sky; if you do not look down into a deep valley, you will not know the thickness of the earth.

meaning.zh-TW: 光是看書或聽別人說，你永遠無法真正體會。你一定要親自爬上高山，才能感受到天空有多麼遼闊。這句話告訴我們「體驗」的重要性。很多知識，只有親身去做、去嘗試，才能真正地學會和了解。
meaning.en: You can never truly understand something just by reading books or listening to others. You have to climb a high mountain yourself to feel how vast the sky is. This quote teaches us the importance of 'experience.' Much knowledge can only be truly learned and understood by doing and trying things for yourself.

quote.el: τὸ εὖ ζῆν... ἐκ μικρῶν συνίστασθαι, μὴ μέντοι μικρὸν ὑπάρχειν.
quote.zh-TW: 幸福是由一件件小事累積而成，但幸福本身絕非小事。
quote.en: Well-being is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的幸福快樂，不是突然發生的一件大事，而是由許多小小的、美好的時刻組成的。就像每天一個小小的微笑、一句謝謝、一次小小的幫忙，這些小事累積起來，就變成了巨大而珍貴的幸福。
meaning.en: True well-being and happiness don't come from one big event that happens suddenly. Instead, they are built from many small, wonderful moments. Like a little smile each day, a 'thank you,' a small act of help—all these little things add up to become a huge and precious happiness.

quote.el: χρόνος πολυτελέστατον ἀνάλωμα.
quote.zh-TW: 時間是最珍貴的開銷。
quote.en: Time is the most valuable thing a person can spend.

meaning.zh-TW: 錢花完了可以再賺，但時間用掉了，就永遠不會再回來。這位哲學家提醒我們，時間是你所擁有最寶貴的東西。所以，要把時間花在最重要的事情上，像是學習、陪伴家人和做好事，而不是隨便浪費掉喔！
meaning.en: You can always earn more money if you spend it all, but once time is spent, it never comes back. This philosopher reminds us that time is the most precious thing you have. So, you should spend your time on the most important things, like learning, being with family, and doing good deeds, instead of just wasting it!

quote.zh-TW: 人皆知有用之用，而莫知無用之用也。
quote.en: Everyone knows the usefulness of the useful, but no one knows the usefulness of the useless.

meaning.zh-TW: 大家都知道一把尺子很有用，可以量東西。但你知道「沒用」的東西有什麼用嗎？莊子講了一個故事：一棵長得歪七扭八的樹，因為不能做成木材（沒用），所以沒被砍掉，反而活了很久。這告訴我們，有些看起來沒用的東西或時間，像是發呆、玩耍，其實對我們的成長和快樂非常重要！
meaning.en: Everyone knows a ruler is useful for measuring things. But do you know about the usefulness of 'useless' things? Zhuangzi told a story about a crooked, gnarled tree. Because it couldn't be used for lumber (it was 'useless'), it was never cut down and lived for a very long time. This teaches us that some things that seem useless, like daydreaming or playing, are actually very important for our growth and happiness!

quote.el: ὁ πᾶσι φίλος οὐδενὸς φίλος.
quote.zh-TW: 一個對所有人都稱兄道弟的人，不是任何人的真正朋友。
quote.en: A friend to all is a friend to none.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的友誼需要花時間和真心去經營，就像澆灌一株小樹。如果一個人對所有人都一樣好，那他可能沒有足夠的時間和心力去和任何人建立深刻、特別的友誼。這句話提醒我們，擁有幾個「真正的」好朋友，比擁有一大堆「認識的人」更重要。
meaning.en: True friendship needs time and genuine care to grow, like watering a small tree. If someone is equally friendly with everyone, they might not have enough time and energy to build a deep, special friendship with anyone. This quote reminds us that having a few 'true' friends is more important than having a huge number of 'acquaintances'.

quote.la: Maxima remedium irae mora est.
quote.zh-TW: 對治憤怒，最好的藥方是延遲。
quote.en: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你非常非常生氣的時候，是不是很想立刻大叫或做點什麼？這位哲學家給了我們一個很棒的建議：等一下！先深呼吸，從一數到十。給自己一點時間冷靜下來，你可能會發現事情沒那麼糟，也能做出更聰明的決定，而不是在生氣中犯錯。
meaning.en: When you get very, very angry, do you feel like shouting or doing something right away? This philosopher gives us great advice: wait! Take a deep breath and count to ten. By giving yourself a little time to cool down, you might find that things aren't so bad, and you can make a much smarter decision instead of making a mistake while you're angry.

quote.el: Οὐδεὶς ἐλεύθερός ἐστιν, ὁ μὴ ἑαυτοῦ κρατῶν.
quote.zh-TW: 不能主宰自己的人，就不是自由的人。
quote.en: No one is free who is not master of themselves.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的自由，不是指你可以做任何想做的事。而是指你能「控制」自己，不被壞習慣或壞情緒綁架。例如，如果你能管住自己，不去沉迷電動而先把作業寫完，你就戰勝了自己，這就是一種真正的自由！
meaning.en: True freedom doesn't mean you can do anything you want. It means you can 'control' yourself and are not a slave to bad habits or bad moods. For example, if you can control yourself to finish your homework first instead of getting lost in video games, you have conquered yourself. That is a kind of true freedom!

quote.zh-TW: 誠者，天之道也；誠之者，人之道也。
quote.en: Sincerity is the way of Heaven; making oneself sincere is the way of humanity.

meaning.zh-TW: 你看大自然，太陽每天升起，春夏秋冬照常序輪替，它們都非常「真誠」。這句話說，我們做人也應該學習這種真誠。對待別人、對待自己，都要真心誠意，不說謊、不假裝。努力讓自己成為一個真誠的人，是最重要的功課。
meaning.en: Look at nature—the sun rises every day, and the seasons change in order. They are all very 'sincere.' This quote says that we should also learn to be sincere. In how we treat others and ourselves, we should be truthful and heartfelt, without lying or pretending. Trying to be a sincere person is the most important lesson of all.

quote.la: Hunc igitur terrorem animi tenebrasque necessest non radii solis nec lucida tela diei discutiant, sed naturae species ratioque.
quote.zh-TW: 因此，心靈的恐懼和黑暗，必須由對自然的觀察與理解來驅散，而非陽光或白晝的光芒。
quote.en: This terror of the mind and darkness must be scattered not by the rays of the sun or the bright shafts of day, but by the outward appearance and inner law of nature.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們有時候會害怕打雷、害怕黑暗，或者害怕一些不知道是什麼的東西。這位詩人說，要消除心裡的害怕，不是靠開燈就好，而是要去「理解」它。當你了解打雷只是空氣的震動，了解科學的道理，知識就會像光一樣，照亮你心裡的黑暗，讓你不再害怕。
meaning.en: Sometimes we are afraid of thunder, the dark, or things we don't know. This poet said that to get rid of fear in our minds, just turning on a light isn't enough. We need to 'understand' the thing we fear. When you learn that thunder is just the vibration of air and understand the science behind it, knowledge becomes like a light that shines into the darkness in your mind and makes you brave.

quote.la: Nullum enim officium referenda gratia magis necessarium est.
quote.zh-TW: 沒有任何責任比回報恩惠更重要。
quote.en: No duty is more obligatory than the repayment of kindness.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果有人幫助了你、對你很好，我們心中最重要的責任，就是要記得這份好，並且懂得「感恩」。感恩不只是說謝謝，更是在未來有機會時，也去幫助別人，把這份善意傳遞下去。感恩是一切美好品德的媽媽。
meaning.en: If someone helps you or is kind to you, our most important duty is to remember that kindness and know how to be 'grateful.' Gratitude is more than just saying thank you; it's also about helping others when you have the chance in the future, passing that kindness forward. Gratitude is the mother of all other good qualities.

quote.el: ὅς τε κακὸς γείτων, τόσσον τ᾽ ἀγαθὸς μέγ᾽ ὄνειαρ.
quote.zh-TW: 壞鄰居是多大的災難，好鄰居就是多大的福氣。
quote.en: A bad neighbor is a great calamity, as much as a good one is a great advantage.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的鄰居對你的生活影響很大！有個壞鄰居會帶來很多麻煩，但有個好鄰居，就像多了一個可以互相幫忙的好朋友。這句話提醒我們，要和周圍的人好好相處，努力成為一個好鄰居、好同學、好朋友，這會讓大家的生活都更美好。
meaning.en: Your neighbors have a big impact on your life! Having a bad neighbor can cause a lot of trouble, but having a good neighbor is like having an extra friend who can help you out. This quote reminds us to get along well with the people around us and to try to be a good neighbor, classmate, and friend. This will make life better for everyone.

quote.he: לא עליך המלאכה לגמור, ולא אתה בן חורין לבטל ממנה.
quote.zh-TW: 完成志業非你之責，然亦無權將其棄置。
quote.en: It is not your duty to finish the work, but neither are you at liberty to neglect it.

meaning.zh-TW: 想讓世界變得更美好，是一件非常非常大的工程，你一個人不可能全部完成。但是，這不代表你就可以什麼都不做喔！這句話教我們，每個人都要盡自己的一份力，哪怕只是做一點點好事，像是撿起地上的垃圾。做好你該做的部分，這就是你的責任。
meaning.en: Making the world a better place is a very, very big job, and you can't possibly finish it all by yourself. However, that doesn't mean you can just do nothing! This quote teaches us that everyone must do their part, even if it's just a small good deed like picking up trash. Doing the part that you are responsible for is your duty.

quote.zh-TW: 盡其心者，知其性也。
quote.en: He who exerts his mind to the utmost knows his nature.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你用盡全力去思考、去感受，努力做一個善良的人，你最終會發現自己內心深處最真實、最美好的本性。這就像一場尋寶遊戲，寶藏就藏在你自己的心裡，只要你用心去尋找，就能找到它。
meaning.en: If you use all your effort to think, to feel, and to try to be a kind person, you will eventually discover the truest and best nature deep inside your heart. It's like a treasure hunt where the treasure is hidden in your own heart, and you can find it as long as you search for it with all your might.

quote.el: Ἡ μουσικὴ ψυχὴν δίδωσιν τῷ παντί, πτερὰ τῷ νῷ, πέτασμα τῇ φαντασίᾳ, καὶ ζωὴν παντί.
quote.zh-TW: 音樂賦予宇宙靈魂，賦予心靈翅膀，賦予想像力飛翔的動力，並賦予萬物生命。
quote.en: Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and life to everything.

meaning.zh-TW: 你有沒有聽過一首歌，讓你覺得很開心，或很想跟著跳舞？柏拉圖認為音樂有神奇的魔法。它能讓世界變得更有生命力，讓我們的思想飛得更高，讓我們的想像力盡情遨遊。音樂是給所有東西的生命禮物！
meaning.en: Have you ever heard a song that made you feel really happy or want to dance along? Plato believed that music has a special kind of magic. It can make the world feel more alive, help our thoughts fly higher, and let our imaginations soar. Music is a gift of life to everything!

quote.la: Veritatem dies aperit.
quote.zh-TW: 時間會揭示真相。
quote.en: Time brings truth to light.

meaning.zh-TW: 有時候，我們可能沒辦法馬上知道一件事情的真相是什麼。但是，不用著急。這位歷史學家告訴我們，只要給它一點時間，經過大家的觀察和思考，真相總有一天會像太陽一樣自己升起來，讓所有人都看見。
meaning.en: Sometimes, we might not know the truth about something right away. But there's no need to rush. This historian tells us that if we just give it a little time, after everyone has had a chance to observe and think, the truth will eventually rise on its own like the sun for all to see.

quote.sa: यावन्तो जगति सुखागमाः केचित्। ते सर्वे परसुखकामनातः स्यात्॥ यावन्तो जगति दुःखागमाः केचित्। ते सर्वे स्वसुखकामनातः स्यात्॥
quote.zh-TW: 世間所有安樂，皆由願他樂而生；世間所有痛苦，皆由願自樂而起。
quote.en: All the happiness there is in this world comes from thinking of others; all the suffering there is in this world comes from thinking of oneself.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話給了我們一個快樂的秘訣：多為別人著想！當你真心希望別人快樂，並且去幫助他們時，你自己也會得到最大的快樂。相反地，如果凡事都只想到自己，就很容易陷入煩惱和痛苦之中。分享快樂，快樂會加倍！
meaning.en: This quote gives us a secret to happiness: think more about others! When you genuinely wish for others to be happy and you act to help them, you yourself will find the greatest joy. On the other hand, if you only think about yourself in every situation, you will easily fall into worry and suffering. When you share happiness, it multiplies!

quote.el: Τὴν σχόλην ἄγε περὶ τὴν τῶν λόγων ἀκρόασιν: οὕτω γὰρ καὶ ἃ τοῖς ἄλλοις χαλεπῶς εὕρηται, σοὶ ῥᾳδίως συμβήσεται μανθάνειν.
quote.zh-TW: 花費你的閒暇時間來專心聆聽有益的言談。如此，別人辛苦得來的學問，你將能輕鬆學到。
quote.en: Spend your leisure time in cultivating an ear attentive to discourse, for in this way you will find that you learn with ease what others have found out with difficulty.

meaning.zh-TW: 下課或放假的時候，除了玩樂，還有一件很棒的事可以做，那就是「專心聽別人說話」。聽老師、爸媽或是有智慧的人分享他們的經驗，就像是坐上了學習的特快車，可以讓你輕鬆學到他們花了很多時間才搞懂的道理。
meaning.en: During your free time after school or on vacation, besides playing, there is another great thing you can do: 'listen carefully to what others say.' Listening to teachers, parents, or wise people share their experiences is like taking an express train of learning. It allows you to easily learn the lessons that took them a long time and much difficulty to figure out.

quote.el: Εἰ μὴ ἐλπίζεις, ἀνέλπιστον οὐκ ἐξευρήσεις, ἀνεξερεύνητον ὂν καὶ ἄπορον.
quote.zh-TW: 如果你不懷抱希望，你將找不到那超乎希望之物。
quote.en: If you do not hope, you will not find what is beyond your hopes.

meaning.zh-TW: 「希望」就像是你心中的一盞小燈。就算在黑暗中，只要這盞燈還亮著，你就會繼續往前走，然後可能找到比你想像中更棒的寶藏。所以，永遠不要放棄希望，因為它會帶領我們發現意想不到的驚喜。
meaning.en: 'Hope' is like a small lamp inside your heart. Even in the dark, as long as this lamp is lit, you will keep moving forward and might find treasures even more wonderful than you imagined. So, never give up hope, because it can lead us to discover amazing surprises.

quote.ar: إن العلم بالشيء ما لم يكن علما بأسبابه فليس علما تاما
quote.zh-TW: 對一件事的知識，若不了解其成因，就不是完全的知識。
quote.en: The knowledge of anything, since all things have causes, is not acquired or complete unless it is known by its causes.

meaning.zh-TW: 知道「蘋果會從樹上掉下來」還不夠，更重要的是去問「為什麼它會掉下來呢？」這位愛思考的醫生告訴我們，真正的學習，不只是知道答案，更是要了解答案背後的原因。要永遠保持一顆「愛問為什麼」的好奇心！
meaning.en: Knowing 'that an apple falls from a tree' isn't enough. What's more important is to ask, 'WHY does it fall?' This thoughtful doctor tells us that true learning isn't just about knowing the answer, but about understanding the reasons behind the answer. Always keep a curious heart that loves to ask 'why'!

name.zh-TW: 瓦萊里烏斯·馬克西姆斯

quote.la: Mater artium necessitas.
quote.zh-TW: 需求為發明之母。
quote.en: Necessity is the mother of invention.

meaning.zh-TW: 為什麼人類會發明雨傘？因為有「需要」在下雨天不被淋濕。為什麼會發明電燈？因為有「需要」在晚上也能看見東西。這句話告訴我們，當我們遇到困難、有迫切需要的時候，反而最能激發我們的創造力，想出很棒的解決辦法！
meaning.en: Why did humans invent the umbrella? Because there was a 'need' to stay dry on rainy days. Why was the light bulb invented? Because there was a 'need' to see things at night. This quote tells us that when we face difficulties and have an urgent need, it's often the best time to spark our creativity and come up with amazing solutions!

quote.el: τὸ γὰρ αὐτὸ νοεῖν ἐστίν τε καὶ εἶναι.
quote.zh-TW: 能被思考的和能存在的，是同一回事。
quote.en: For it is the same thing that can be thought and that can be.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話很深奧喔！這位哲學家認為，我們的理智和思想非常強大。一件事情如果可以用清晰的、合乎邏輯的理智去思考它，那它一定是真實存在的。他相信，我們的思想有能力去觸摸到這個世界最真實的樣貌。
meaning.en: This is a very deep thought! This philosopher believed that our reason and thoughts are very powerful. If something can be thought about with clear, logical reason, then it must be something that truly exists. He believed that our minds have the ability to touch the truest form of the world.

quote.zh-TW: 口者，心之門戶也。心者，君之主也。
quote.en: The mouth is the gateway of the heart. The mind is the master of the mouth.

meaning.zh-TW: 你說出來的話，就像打開一扇門，讓別人看見你的心裡在想什麼。而你的心智和思想，就是這扇門的守衛。這句話教導我們，要先好好思考，再開口說話，讓你的思想作主，而不是讓話隨便衝口而出。
meaning.en: The words you speak are like a door that you open, allowing others to see what is in your heart. And your mind and thoughts are the master of that door. This quote teaches us that we should think carefully before we speak, letting our mind be in charge, instead of letting words rush out carelessly.

quote.el: γνήσιοι δ᾽ εἰσ᾽ οἱ φίλοι ἐν τοῖς κακοῖς.
quote.zh-TW: 真正的朋友是在危難時顯現。
quote.en: True friends are revealed in times of trouble.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你開心順利的時候，身邊可能有很多朋友。但當你遇到困難、感到難過時，還願意留下來陪伴你、幫助你的人，才是你真正的朋友。這句話告訴我們，友誼的價值，在於共患難，而不只是同享樂。
meaning.en: When you are happy and everything is going well, you might have many friends around you. But the ones who are willing to stay, comfort, and help you when you are in trouble or feeling sad—those are your real friends. This quote tells us that the value of friendship is shown in sharing difficult times, not just in sharing fun times.

quote.el: τῶν γὰρ ἀνδρῶν τῶν ἐπιφανῶν πᾶσα γῆ τάφος, καὶ οὐ στηλῶν μόνον ἐν τῇ οἰκείᾳ σημαίνει ἐπιγραφή, ἀλλὰ καὶ ἐν τῇ μὴ προσηκούσῃ ἄγραφος μνήμη παρ᾽ ἑκάστῳ τῆς γνώμης μᾶλλον ἢ τοῦ ἔργου ἐνδιαιτᾶται.
quote.zh-TW: 偉人的墓碑遍布世界，他們留下的不是石碑上的銘文，而是編織在他人生命中的事蹟。
quote.en: What you leave behind is not what is engraved in stone monuments, but what is woven into the lives of others.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個人離開世界後，真正能被大家記住的，不是他蓋了多大的房子或擁有多少財產。而是他曾經做過的好事，以及他對別人的生命帶來的正面影響。你對別人的善良和幫助，會像故事一樣，永遠活在大家的心中。
meaning.en: After a person leaves this world, what is truly remembered is not how big a house they built or how much property they owned. It is the good deeds they did and the positive impact they had on the lives of others. Your kindness and help to others will live on forever in people's hearts, just like a story.

quote.pi: यथापि माता नियं पुत्तं आयुसा एकपुत्तमनुरक्खे, एवम्पि सब्बभूतेसु मानसं भावये अपरिमाणं।
quote.zh-TW: 如母護獨子，以命相守護；願於一切眾生，修習無限慈。
quote.en: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, so one should cultivate a boundless love towards all living beings.

meaning.zh-TW: 媽媽保護自己的小孩，是不是會用上全部的愛和力量？這段話教導我們，應該用像媽媽保護小孩一樣的心情，去對待世界上所有的生命。對人類、對動物、對花草樹木，都懷抱著無限的愛心與溫柔。
meaning.en: Doesn't a mother protect her child with all her love and strength? This passage teaches us that we should treat all living things in the world with the same feeling a mother has for her child. We should hold boundless love and gentleness for humans, animals, and even flowers and trees.

quote.el: ὁ μὲν γὰρ κάλος ὄσσον ἴδην πέλεται κάλος, ὁ δὲ κἄγαθος αὔτικα καὶ κάλος ἔσσεται.
quote.zh-TW: 美麗之人，其美在於表；善良之人，終將顯其美。
quote.en: He who is beautiful is beautiful to see, but he who is good will soon be beautiful indeed.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個人長得好不好看，只是我們眼睛看到的。但更重要的是，一個人是不是善良。這位女詩人告訴我們，一個善良的人，他的內心會散發出一種特別的光芒，讓他在別人眼中，變得越來越好看。內心的善良，才是最真實的美麗。
meaning.en: Whether someone looks pretty or not is just what our eyes see. But what's more important is whether a person is good and kind. This poet tells us that a good person's heart shines with a special light that makes them appear more and more beautiful in the eyes of others. Inner goodness is the truest kind of beauty.

quote.zh-TW: 君子以裒多益寡，稱物平施。
quote.en: The superior person diminishes the excessive and supplements the insufficient to create fairness.

meaning.zh-TW: 想像你在分蛋糕，你會不會努力讓每個人拿到的都差不多大？一個品格好的人，也會像這樣追求公平。他會把太多的地方減少一些，拿去補給不夠的地方，讓大家都得到合理的對待。這就是公平與平衡的智慧。
meaning.en: Imagine you are dividing a cake. Wouldn't you try hard to make sure everyone gets a roughly equal slice? A person of good character also pursues fairness like this. They will take a little from where there is too much and give it to where there is not enough, ensuring everyone is treated reasonably. This is the wisdom of fairness and balance.

quote.ar: غاية المدينة الفاضلة هي تحقيق السعادة لمواطنيها.
quote.zh-TW: 一個理想城邦的目標，是為其公民帶來幸福。
quote.en: The goal of a virtuous city is to bring about happiness for its citizens.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個最棒的城市或國家，應該是什麼樣子呢？這位哲學家認為，它的目標不是賺最多錢或蓋最高的大樓，而是要努力讓住在裡面的每一個人，都能過得幸福快樂。一個好的群體，就是要為成員的幸福而存在。
meaning.en: What should the best city or country be like? This philosopher believed its goal isn't to make the most money or build the tallest buildings, but to strive to make sure every single person living inside it can be happy. A good community exists for the happiness of its members.

quote.la: Ratioque in corpusque deum est.
quote.zh-TW: 理性是人內在的神性。
quote.en: Reason is a god in man.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們人類有一樣非常特別、像超能力一樣的東西，那就是「理性」。理性就是我們能夠思考、分析、明辨是非的能力。這位哲學家認為，這份思考的能力，是我們內在最高貴、最神聖的部分，我們要好好運用它來做出正確的決定。
meaning.en: We humans have something very special, almost like a superpower: it's called 'reason.' Reason is our ability to think, analyze, and tell right from wrong. This philosopher believed that this ability to think is the noblest and most divine part of us, and we should use it well to make good decisions.

quote.el: τὸν πάθει μάθος.
quote.zh-TW: 智慧由苦難而生。
quote.en: Wisdom comes through suffering.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們在遇到困難、犯錯或感到難過的時候，其實也是學習得最多的時候。就像跌倒了才知道哪裡有石頭。每一次的挑戰，都會讓我們變得更堅強、更有智慧，更了解該如何面對下一次的困難。
meaning.en: The times when we face difficulties, make mistakes, or feel sad are often the times when we learn the most. It's like how you learn where the rocks are after you've fallen over them. Every challenge makes us stronger, wiser, and better prepared to handle the next one.

quote.el: Εἴ τι ἀγαθὸν διαπονῶν πράξῃς, ὁ μὲν πόνος οἴχεται, τὸ δὲ ἀγαθὸν μένει.
quote.zh-TW: 若你費力做好事，辛苦會過去，但美善會留下。
quote.en: If you accomplish something good with hard work, the work is gone, but the good remains.

meaning.zh-TW: 做一件對的事情，像是努力完成一件很難的勞作，過程可能會很辛苦。但是，當你完成後，辛苦的感覺會消失，而那個很棒的作品和完成它的美好感覺，會永遠留下來。所以，不要害怕為了做好事而付出努力！
meaning.en: Doing something right, like working hard to finish a difficult school project, can be tough. However, once you're done, the feeling of hardship disappears, but the wonderful creation and the great feeling of accomplishment will last forever. So, don't be afraid to put in the effort to do good things!

quote.zh-TW: 夫以一手掩天下人之目，是不可能也。
quote.en: To cover the eyes of all the people in the world with a single hand is impossible.

meaning.zh-TW: 你可以用一隻手遮住自己的眼睛，但你不可能用一隻手遮住天下所有人的眼睛。這句話告訴我們，真相是無法永遠被隱瞞的。做錯事想把它藏起來，最終還是會被大家發現。所以，誠實面對才是最好的方法。
meaning.en: You can cover your own eyes with one hand, but you can't cover everyone else's eyes in the world with just one hand. This quote tells us that the truth cannot be hidden forever. If you do something wrong and try to hide it, it will eventually be discovered by everyone. Therefore, being honest is always the best way.

quote.el: χρειότατον μάθημα, τὸ κακὰ ἀπομαθεῖν.
quote.zh-TW: 最重要的一門學問，是忘掉不真實的東西。
quote.en: The most useful piece of learning is to unlearn what is untrue.

meaning.zh-TW: 學習新的知識很重要，但還有一個更重要的學習，那就是「忘掉」或「改正」我們以前學到的錯誤觀念。這就像電腦需要刪除病毒一樣，我們也要時常檢查自己的想法，把不對的、不好的想法丟掉，這樣才能學得更好、變得更聰明。
meaning.en: Learning new knowledge is important, but there is an even more important kind of learning: to 'unlearn' or 'correct' the wrong ideas we learned in the past. It's like a computer needing to delete a virus. We also need to regularly check our own thoughts and get rid of the ones that are wrong or unhelpful. This is how we can learn better and become wiser.

quote.la: Equidem beatos puto, quibus deorum munere datum est aut facere scribenda aut scribere legenda.
quote.zh-TW: 我認為幸福的人，是那些有幸能做出值得被書寫之事，或寫出值得被閱讀之文的人。
quote.en: I hold those the most fortunate who have been granted by the gods the ability either to do things worthy of being written about, or to write things worthy of being read.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼樣的人生最棒呢？這位作家給了我們兩個方向：第一，去做一些很棒、很偉大、值得被寫成故事的事情。第二，去寫一些很棒、很有趣、值得被大家一讀再讀的文章。簡單來說，就是努力讓自己的人生故事變得精彩，或者用你的能力為世界創造美好的事物。
meaning.en: What kind of life is the best? This writer gives us two ideas: First, do great and wonderful things that are worth being written into stories. Second, write great and interesting things that are worth being read again and again. Simply put, either strive to make your own life story exciting, or use your talents to create wonderful things for the world.

quote.el: ζημίαν αἱροῦ μᾶλλον ἢ κέρδος αἰσχρόν: τὸ μὲν γὰρ ἅπαξ λυπήσει, τὸ δὲ ἀεί.
quote.zh-TW: 寧願選擇損失，也不要不義之財；因為前者只痛苦一次，後者則痛苦一輩子。
quote.en: Prefer a loss to a dishonest gain; for the one is painful but once, but the other for all time.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果有一個選擇，一個是誠實地接受小小的失敗，另一個是用作弊的方法得到好處，你該怎麼選？這位智者說，一定要選誠實。因為失敗的難過一下就過去了，但作弊帶來的羞愧和不安，會跟著你很久很久。誠實才是最安心的選擇。
meaning.en: If you have a choice between honestly accepting a small failure and getting an advantage by cheating, what should you choose? This wise man said you must always choose honesty. The sadness of failure passes quickly, but the shame and unease from cheating will follow you for a very long time. Honesty is always the most peaceful choice.

quote.zh-TW: 能達成繁榮與至善者，即為正法 (Dharma)。
quote.en: That from which accomplishment of exaltation and supreme good results is Dharma (righteous duty).

meaning.zh-TW: 我們要怎麼判斷一件事是不是「對的」呢？這位印度哲學家說，很簡單，就看它會不會帶來好的結果。如果一件事能讓大家過得更好、更快樂、更圓滿，那它就是你該做的「正經事」。做對的事，自然就會有好結果。
meaning.en: How can we judge if something is the 'right' thing to do? This Indian philosopher said it's simple: just see if it leads to good results. If doing something helps everyone live better, happier, and more fulfilled lives, then it is the 'right duty' you should do. When you do the right thing, good results will naturally follow.

quote.he: לעולם יהא אדם רך כקנה ואל יהא קשה כארז.
quote.zh-TW: 人應如蘆葦般柔軟，而非如香柏般剛硬。
quote.en: A person should always be soft like a reed and not be hard like a cedar.

meaning.zh-TW: 你知道蘆葦為什麼在大風中不會被吹斷嗎？因為它很柔軟，會跟著風彎腰。但又高又硬的雪松樹，反而可能會被大風吹斷。這句話教導我們，待人處事要有彈性、要謙虛溫和。固執己見、太過強硬，有時候反而更容易受到傷害。
meaning.en: Do you know why a reed doesn't break in a strong wind? Because it is soft and bends with the wind. But a tall, hard cedar tree might get snapped by the gales. This quote teaches us to be flexible, humble, and gentle in how we deal with things and people. Being stubborn and too rigid can sometimes make you more likely to get hurt.

quote.la: Nemo in adiuvando sit fessus.
quote.zh-TW: 助人永不倦。
quote.en: Let no one be weary of rendering help.

meaning.zh-TW: 幫助別人是一件很棒的事，而且我們永遠不該對此感到疲倦。不管是有機會幫同學一個小忙，或是為家人做點事，每一次的幫助，都是在為世界增加一點溫暖。這位詩人鼓勵我們，要一直保持一顆樂於助人的心。
meaning.en: Helping others is a wonderful thing, and we should never get tired of doing it. Whether it's a chance to help a classmate with something small or do something for your family, every act of help adds a little bit of warmth to the world. This poet encourages us to always keep a heart that is happy to help.

quote.el: τὸ φρονεῖν εὐδαιμονίας πρῶτον ὑπάρχει.
quote.zh-TW: 智慧是幸福的首要部分。
quote.en: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼是快樂最重要的成分呢？這位劇作家認為是「智慧」。有智慧，你才能做出好的選擇，才能分辨是非，才能在困難中找到方向。智慧不是指很會考試，而是指懂得如何好好生活。學會思考，就是學會快樂。
meaning.en: What is the most important ingredient for happiness? This playwright believed it is 'wisdom.' With wisdom, you can make good choices, tell right from wrong, and find your way when things get tough. Wisdom doesn't mean being good at tests; it means knowing how to live life well. Learning to think is learning to be happy.

quote.el: τὸ ἐνιστάμενον τῷ ἔργῳ ἔργον γίνεται, καὶ τὸ ἐμποδὼν τῷ ὁδῷ πρὸς τὴν ὁδόν.
quote.zh-TW: 行動的阻礙，促進行動。路上的障礙，反成道路。
quote.en: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.

meaning.zh-TW: 想像你在路上遇到一顆大石頭擋路，怎麼辦呢？你可以把它當成墊腳石，爬得更高看得更遠。這句話告訴我們，困難和障礙不一定是壞事。它們可以變成我們的機會，讓我們學習、成長，找到一條新的、更好的路。
meaning.en: Imagine you encounter a large rock blocking your path. What do you do? You could use it as a stepping stone to climb higher and see farther. This quote tells us that difficulties and obstacles are not always bad things. They can be turned into our opportunities to learn, grow, and find a new, better path forward.

quote.la: Mens sana in corpore sano.
quote.zh-TW: 健全的心靈，寓於健全的身體。
quote.en: A healthy mind in a healthy body.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的身體和你的心靈是同一個團隊的好夥伴！這句話提醒我們，要同時照顧好身體和心靈。多運動讓身體強壯，多閱讀思考讓心靈敏銳。健康的身體能讓你更有精神去學習和思考，而健康的心靈也會讓你的身體更有活力。
meaning.en: Your body and your mind are teammates in the same great team! This quote reminds us to take care of both our body and our mind at the same time. Exercising keeps your body strong, and reading and thinking keep your mind sharp. A healthy body gives you more energy to learn and think, and a healthy mind makes your body more vibrant.

quote.el: Κοινὰ τὰ φίλων.
quote.zh-TW: 朋友之間，萬物共享。
quote.en: Friends share all things.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的好朋友，不只是會一起分享玩具和點心。他們還會分享彼此的快樂、分擔對方的難過、分享心中的秘密。這句話告訴我們，友誼的核心就是「分享」，樂於和朋友分享一切，這份情誼才會更深厚。
meaning.en: True friends don't just share toys and snacks. They also share each other's happiness, bear each other's sadness, and share secrets from the heart. This quote tells us that the core of friendship is 'sharing.' Being willing to share everything with friends will make the friendship much deeper.

quote.zh-TW: 思者，智之本也。
quote.en: Thinking is the source of all wisdom.

meaning.zh-TW: 所有的智慧，都是從哪裡來的呢？就是從「思考」來的。就像所有的河流都有一個源頭一樣。遇到事情，不要只是接受，要多問「為什麼」，多動腦想一想。勤於思考，就是打開智慧大門的鑰匙。
meaning.en: Where does all wisdom come from? It comes from 'thinking.' Just like all rivers have a source. When you encounter something, don't just accept it. Ask 'why' more often and use your brain to think. Thinking diligently is the key that opens the door to wisdom.

quote.zh-TW: 心是束縛之因，心也是解脫之因。
quote.en: The mind is the cause of bondage, and the mind is the cause of liberation.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的心，有兩種神奇的力量。它可以像繩子一樣，把你綁在煩惱和痛苦裡。但它也可以像一把鑰匙，為你打開通往自由和快樂的大門。一切都取決於你如何運用你的心，如何思考。你的心，是你自己最強大的工具。
meaning.en: Your mind has two magical powers. It can be like a rope that ties you up in worry and sadness. But it can also be like a key that opens the gate to freedom and happiness. It all depends on how you use your mind and how you think. Your mind is your own most powerful tool.

quote.zh-TW: 一切都被預見，但選擇的自由已賦予。
quote.en: Everything is foreseen, yet freedom of choice is given.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來像個謎！它的意思是，就算未來好像有一定的方向，但在每一個當下，你永遠都有「選擇」的權利。你可以選擇做善良的事，也可以選擇做壞壞的事。你的未來，就掌握在你每一次的選擇裡。
meaning.en: This quote sounds like a riddle! It means that even if the future seems to have a certain direction, at every single moment, you always have the power of 'choice.' You can choose to do something kind, or you can choose to do something not so nice. Your future is shaped by every choice you make.

quote.el: τὴν μὲν ζωγραφίαν ποίησιν σιωπῶσαν προσαγορεύει, τὴν δ’ αὖ ποίησιν ζωγραφίαν λαλοῦσαν.
quote.zh-TW: 畫是無聲的詩，詩是會說話的畫。
quote.en: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting that speaks.

meaning.zh-TW: 一幅美麗的畫，雖然沒有聲音，但它就像一首詩，能告訴你一個故事、一種感覺。而一首好詩，雖然沒有畫面，但它用的詞語，能在你的腦海中畫出一幅生動的圖畫。這句話告訴我們，藝術有很多種方式可以觸動我們的心。
meaning.en: A beautiful painting, though it has no sound, is like a poem that can tell you a story or a feeling. And a good poem, though it has no picture, uses words that can paint a vivid image in your mind. This quote tells us that art has many different ways to touch our hearts.

quote.la: Homo sum, humani nihil a me alienum puto.
quote.zh-TW: 我是人，我認為沒有任何與人有關的事是與我無關的。
quote.en: I am human, and I think nothing human is alien to me.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一句充滿同理心的話。它告訴我們，因為我們都是人類，所以別人的快樂、悲傷和經歷，我們都能夠去理解和關心。不論對方來自哪裡、是什麼樣子，我們之間共通的地方，遠比不同的地方更多。我們要對所有人都抱持一份關懷。
meaning.en: This is a sentence full of empathy. It tells us that because we are all human, we can understand and care about the happiness, sadness, and experiences of others. No matter where someone comes from or what they look like, the things we have in common are far greater than our differences. We should show care for everyone.

quote.el: Μικραὶ ἀφορμαὶ μεγάλων πραγμάτων γίγνονται.
quote.zh-TW: 微小的機會，常是宏大事業的開端。
quote.en: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.

meaning.zh-TW: 所有偉大的成就，都不是一瞬間發生的，它們往往是從一個很小、很不起眼的機會開始。就像一棵神木，也是從一顆小小的種子發芽。所以，不要輕忽任何一個小機會，要好好把握它，它可能就是你未來成功的起點！
meaning.en: All great achievements don't just happen in an instant; they often start from a very small and seemingly insignificant opportunity. It's like a giant, sacred tree that grows from a tiny seed. So, don't overlook any small chance. Seize it, because it might just be the starting point of your future success!

quote.zh-TW: 知識是人的第三隻眼。
quote.en: Knowledge is the third eye of man.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們用兩隻眼睛看世界，但還有一隻更厲害的「第三隻眼」，那就是「知識」。眼睛只能看到事物的表面，但知識這隻眼睛，能幫助我們看透事物的內在和真相。它讓我們不只「看見」，更能「看懂」。
meaning.en: We use our two eyes to see the world, but there is an even more powerful 'third eye,' and that is 'knowledge.' Our physical eyes can only see the surface of things, but the eye of knowledge helps us see into the inner nature and truth of things. It allows us not just to 'see,' but to truly 'understand.'

quote.zh-TW: 詩者，志之所之也。在心為志，發言為詩。
quote.en: Poetry is where the heart's intent goes. What is in the heart is intent; when it is expressed in words, it is poetry.

meaning.zh-TW: 你心裡的想法和感覺，就像是還沒說出口的詩。當你把它用美麗的語言表達出來，它就變成了詩。這句話告訴我們，藝術創作，像是寫詩、畫畫、唱歌，都是我們表達內心感受的最好方式。
meaning.en: The thoughts and feelings in your heart are like poems that haven't been spoken yet. When you express them in beautiful language, they become poetry. This quote tells us that creative arts, like writing poems, drawing pictures, or singing songs, are the best ways for us to express our inner feelings.

quote.pi: यस्सज्जने रति होति, विग्गहो तस्स नत्थि कोचि।
quote.zh-TW: 於和合同樂者，無有任何爭執。
quote.en: For one who delights in concord, there is no dispute.

meaning.zh-TW: 你喜不喜歡和大家和和氣氣、開開心心在一起的感覺？佛陀說，當一個人真心喜歡這種和諧的氣氛時，他就不會想跟別人吵架或爭論了。因為和諧本身帶來的快樂，遠比爭贏了任何事都更美好。
meaning.en: Do you like the feeling of being with everyone in peace and harmony? The Buddha said that when a person truly delights in this atmosphere of concord, they will have no desire to argue or dispute with others. This is because the happiness that harmony itself brings is far more wonderful than winning any argument.

quote.la: In rebus asperis et tenui spe, fortissima quaeque consilia tutissima sunt.
quote.zh-TW: 在艱難困頓、希望渺茫之時，最大膽的計策反而是最安全的。
quote.en: In difficult and desperate cases, the boldest counsels are the safest.

meaning.zh-TW: 當情況變得非常非常困難，幾乎看不到希望的時候，與其害怕退縮，不如鼓起最大的勇氣，去嘗試一個最大膽的方法。這位歷史學家提醒我們，在絕境中，勇敢和決心有時候能創造奇蹟，為我們開創一條意想不到的安全之路。
meaning.en: When things get very, very difficult and there seems to be almost no hope, instead of being scared and backing down, it's better to summon your greatest courage and try the boldest approach. This historian reminds us that in desperate situations, bravery and determination can sometimes create miracles and open up an unexpectedly safe path for us.

quote.zh-TW: 智慧使靈魂強大。
quote.en: Wisdom makes the soul strong.

meaning.zh-TW: 智慧就像是我們靈魂的食物和運動。我們學習越多、思考越多，我們的內心就會變得越強壯、越健康。一個有智慧的靈魂，能更好地應對困難，也能感受到更深刻的快樂。所以，要每天努力為你的靈魂增加一點智慧的營養喔！
meaning.en: Wisdom is like food and exercise for our soul. The more we learn and the more we think, the stronger and healthier our inner self becomes. A wise soul can handle difficulties better and can also feel deeper happiness. So, try to add a little bit of wisdom-nutrition to your soul every day!

quote.el: ἀτυχῶν ἐστίν, ὃς ἀτυχίαν μὴ φέρει.
quote.zh-TW: 無法承受不幸的人，才是真正不幸的人。
quote.en: The most unfortunate man is he who cannot bear misfortune.

meaning.zh-TW: 人生中，不如意的事情總是會發生，就像天氣不可能永遠晴天。這位智者說，真正的不幸，不是遇到壞事，而是沒有能力去承受它。學會接受失敗、從困難中站起來，這種內心的力量，比事事順利更重要。
meaning.en: In life, unfortunate things will always happen, just like the weather can't always be sunny. This wise man said that true misfortune isn't about bad things happening to you, but about not having the ability to endure them. Learning to accept failure and get back up from difficulties—this inner strength is more important than having everything always go smoothly.

quote.zh-TW: 國無常強，無常弱。
quote.en: No country is permanently strong, nor is any country permanently weak.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個國家或一個團隊，不會永遠都是最強的，也不會永遠都是最弱的。情況是會改變的！這句話提醒我們，成功的時候不能驕傲，要繼續努力；失敗的時候也不用氣餒，因為只要努力，就有機會變強。一切都在變化之中。
meaning.en: A country or a team will not always be the strongest, nor will it always be the weakest. Situations can change! This quote reminds us that when we are successful, we shouldn't be arrogant and must continue to work hard. And when we fail, we shouldn't be discouraged, because as long as we keep trying, we have a chance to become strong. Everything is in a state of change.

quote.el: Σοφοὶ παρὰ τῶν ἐχθρῶν πολλὰ μανθάνουσιν.
quote.zh-TW: 聰明人能從敵人身上學到很多東西。
quote.en: Wise people learn many things from their enemies.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們不只可以從朋友和老師身上學習，就連跟我們競爭或不喜歡我們的人，也能教我們很多事。觀察他們，可以讓我們看見自己的缺點，或者學到他們厲害的地方。保持一顆開放學習的心，任何經驗都是寶貴的。
meaning.en: We can learn not only from our friends and teachers, but also from those who compete with us or dislike us. By observing them, we can see our own weaknesses or learn from their strengths. If you keep an open mind for learning, every experience is valuable.

quote.la: Rem tene, verba sequentur.
quote.zh-TW: 掌握主旨，言詞自來。
quote.en: Grasp the subject, the words will follow.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你要寫作文或上台報告時，是不是有時候不知道該說什麼？這位政治家給了一個秘訣：先把你要講的內容和主題，在心裡徹底搞懂。只要你真的明白了，要用什麼詞語、怎麼把它說清楚，自然就會變得很容易了。
meaning.en: When you have to write an essay or give a presentation, do you sometimes not know what to say? This statesman gives us a secret tip: First, fully understand the topic and content in your mind. As long as you truly get it, the right words and the way to express it clearly will come to you naturally and easily.

quote.zh-TW: 得意而忘言。
quote.en: Once you have gotten the meaning, you can forget the words.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們用捕魚的網子來抓魚，但抓到魚之後，你就不需要一直提著網子了。語言和文字就像那個網子，它們是幫助我們理解意思的工具。一旦你真正理解了那個意思，你就可以放下工具，用心去體會。重要的是意思，而不是漂亮的詞語。
meaning.en: We use a net to catch fish, but once you've caught the fish, you don't need to carry the net around anymore. Language and words are like that net; they are tools to help us understand meaning. Once you truly grasp the meaning, you can put the tool down and just experience it with your heart. The meaning is what's important, not just the fancy words.

quote.pi: कुल्लूपमं वो, भिक्खवे, धम्मं देसेस्सामि निट्ठरणत्थाय, नो गहणत्थाय।
quote.zh-TW: 我的教法如竹筏，是為了渡河，而非為了緊抓不放。
quote.en: My teaching is a raft for crossing over, not for holding on to.

meaning.zh-TW: 想像你要過一條河，你會坐上木筏。但過了河之後，你應該把木筏放下，繼續前進，而不是把木筏一直背在身上。佛陀說，知識和道理就像那個木筏，它們是幫助我們解決問題的工具。學會了，就要懂得運用，而不是死背著它，變成一種負擔。
meaning.en: Imagine you need to cross a river, so you use a raft. But after you've crossed, you should leave the raft behind and continue your journey, not carry it on your back. The Buddha said that knowledge and teachings are like that raft; they are tools to help us solve problems. Once we've learned something, we should know how to use it, not just carry it around like a burden.

quote.el: Τὸ δ᾽ ὑγιαίνειν καὶ τὸ νοῦν ἔχειν ἀγαθὼ δύο.
quote.zh-TW: 健康與智慧，是人生的兩大福氣。
quote.en: Health and intellect are the two blessings of life.

meaning.zh-TW: 人生中最棒的兩樣禮物是什麼呢？這位劇作家認為，第一是擁有健康的身體，讓你有活力去跑跑跳跳。第二是擁有清楚的頭腦，讓你能學習和思考。有了這兩樣寶貴的祝福，你就能好好享受生命中的一切。
meaning.en: What are the two best gifts in life? This playwright believed the first is having a healthy body, which gives you the energy to run and jump. The second is having a clear mind, which allows you to learn and think. With these two precious blessings, you can fully enjoy everything in life.

quote.zh-TW: 正直、真誠、不怒、放下、平靜、不說閒話，皆是美德。
quote.en: Honesty, sincerity, calmness, relinquishment, peacefulness, and not speaking ill of others are virtues.

meaning.zh-TW: 這段話像一張「好品格清單」，教我們如何成為更好的人。它說，我們要正直、誠實、不亂生氣、不執著、保持內心平靜，還有不說別人的壞話。練習這些好品格，就像在心裡種下美麗的花朵一樣。
meaning.en: This passage is like a 'good character checklist' that teaches us how to become better people. It says we should be upright, sincere, not get angry easily, let go of things, keep our hearts calm, and not speak badly of others. Practicing these good qualities is like planting beautiful flowers in your heart.

name.zh-TW: 維萊伊烏斯·帕特爾庫魯斯

quote.la: Calamitatisque magnae initium est securitas.
quote.zh-TW: 過度的安逸感，是巨大災難的開端。
quote.en: An excess of security is the beginning of a great calamity.

meaning.zh-TW: 當我們覺得一切都很安全、很順利的時候，反而最容易放鬆警惕，變得粗心大意。這位歷史學家提醒我們，越是成功的時候，越要保持謙虛和小心。常常檢查自己有沒有做對，才不會因為太有自信而犯下大錯。
meaning.en: When we feel that everything is very safe and going smoothly, that's often when we are most likely to let our guard down and become careless. This historian reminds us that the more successful we are, the more we need to stay humble and careful. Always double-check your work to avoid making big mistakes because of overconfidence.

quote.zh-TW: 國之所以治者三：一曰法，二曰信，三曰權。
quote.en: There are three things that make a state well-governed: first, law; second, trust; third, authority.

meaning.zh-TW: 要讓一個班級或一個團體運作得很好，需要三樣東西。第一，要有清楚的規則（法）。第二，大家要說話算話，互相相信（信）。第三，要有執行規則的公正力量（權）。這句話告訴我們，清楚的規則和誠實的信用，是所有團體和樂安定的基礎。
meaning.en: To make a classroom or a group work well, you need three things. First, you need clear rules (law). Second, everyone needs to keep their promises and trust each other (trust). Third, you need a fair power to enforce the rules (authority). This quote tells us that clear rules and honesty are the foundation for any group to be peaceful and stable.

quote.el: βασιλεὺς γὰρ ὁ μὴ κρατούμενος ὑφ᾽ ἡδονῆς
quote.zh-TW: 不為逸樂所奴役者，即是君王。
quote.en: He who is not mastered by pleasure is a king.

meaning.zh-TW: 誰是世界上最強大的國王？這位思想家認為，是那個能夠控制自己慾望的人。如果你能做到不貪吃、不貪玩，能管好自己，做自己真正的主人，那你就是一個內心王國的國王，擁有比任何財富都更珍貴的力量。
meaning.en: Who is the most powerful king in the world? This thinker believed it is the person who can control their own desires. If you can manage not to overeat or play too much, and if you can be the true master of yourself, then you are the king of your own inner kingdom, possessing a power more precious than any treasure.

quote.la: omnis tamen nove initi est finis veteris.
quote.zh-TW: 每一個新的開始，都源自於某個舊的結束。
quote.en: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你從國小畢業時，可能會有點難過，因為一個階段結束了。但這同時也是你國中新生活的開始！這句話告訴我們，結束和開始是連在一起的。不要害怕告別，因為每一次的結束，都會為一個嶄新、充滿可能性的開始開路。
meaning.en: When you graduate from elementary school, you might feel a little sad because a chapter is ending. But at the same time, it's the beginning of your new life in junior high! This quote tells us that endings and beginnings are connected. Don't be afraid to say goodbye, because every end paves the way for a brand new beginning full of possibilities.

quote.el: οὐ γὰρ ὁ τὰ ὀλίγα ἔχων πένης ἐστίν, ἀλλ᾽ ὁ τῶν πολλῶν ἐπιθυμῶν.
quote.zh-TW: 貧窮的不是擁有太少的人，而是渴望太多的人。
quote.en: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.

meaning.zh-TW: 誰才是真正的窮人呢？這位哲學家認為，不是那些東西很少的人，而是那些不管有多少，心裡永遠覺得不夠、想要更多的人。如果你能對自己擁有的感到滿足，那你的心靈就是富有的，不會感到匱乏。
meaning.en: Who is the truly poor person? This philosopher believed it's not the person who has very little, but the person who, no matter how much they have, always feels it's not enough and craves more. If you can be content with what you possess, then your spirit is rich and you will not feel a sense of lack.

quote.zh-TW: 少說多做。
quote.en: Say little and do much.

meaning.zh-TW: 與其一直說你「打算」要做什麼，不如直接用行動把它做出來。這位古老的老師教導我們，行動比言語更有力量。與其誇誇其談，不如腳踏實地，用你做出來的成果來證明自己。讓你的行動為你說話！
meaning.en: Instead of always talking about what you 'plan' to do, it's better to just do it with your actions. This ancient teacher taught us that actions are more powerful than words. Rather than making grand speeches, it is better to be down-to-earth and prove yourself with your results. Let your actions speak for you!

quote.sa: विद्या शस्त्रं च शास्त्रं च द्वे विद्ये प्रतिपत्तये।
quote.zh-TW: 知識是無法被偷走的寶藏。
quote.en: Knowledge is a treasure that cannot be stolen.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的玩具可能會不見，你的零用錢可能會花光，但你學到腦袋裡的知識，是任何人都拿不走的寶藏。而且，這個寶藏你用得越多，它不但不會變少，還會變得更有價值。所以，努力學習，就是為自己存下最寶貴的財富。
meaning.en: Your toys might get lost, and your allowance might be spent, but the knowledge you learn in your head is a treasure that no one can ever take away from you. What's more, the more you use this treasure, the more valuable it becomes instead of diminishing. Therefore, studying hard is how you save up the most precious wealth for yourself.

quote.el: Οἷον ἡ ψυχὴ ἡμετέρα, ἀὴρ οὖσα, συγκρατεῖ ἡμᾶς, καὶ ὅλον τὸν κόσμον πνεῦμα καὶ ἀὴρ περιέχει.
quote.zh-TW: 正如我們的靈魂（是空氣）維繫著我們，氣息和空氣也包圍並維繫著整個宇宙。
quote.en: Just as our soul, being air, holds us together, so do breath and air encompass and maintain the whole cosmos.
