meaning.zh-TW: 我們需要呼吸空氣才能活著，這位古老的哲學家覺得，整個宇宙也像一個巨大的生命，靠著空氣和氣息活著。他提醒我們，我們和世界萬物，其實都在呼吸著同樣的氣息，我們是和整個宇宙緊密相連的一部分。
meaning.en: We need to breathe air to live. This ancient philosopher felt that the entire universe is also like a giant living being, kept alive by air and breath. He reminds us that we and everything in the world are actually breathing the same breath; we are all a closely connected part of the entire cosmos.

quote.zh-TW: 且樂今朝，今朝是唯一屬於你的生命。
quote.en: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們的生命，是由一個又一個的「現在」組成的。不要一直為過去後悔，也不要一直為未來擔心。這位詩人提醒我們，要把注意力放在此時此刻，去感受、去體驗、去快樂。因為你真正擁有的，就只有「現在」這一刻。
meaning.en: Our life is made up of one 'now' after another. Don't keep regretting the past or worrying about the future. This poet reminds us to focus our attention on this very moment—to feel, to experience, and to be happy. Because the only thing you truly have is this moment, 'right now.'

quote.la: Tecum habita: noris quam sit tibi curta supellex.
quote.zh-TW: 與自己共處，你才會知道你的行囊多麼貧乏。
quote.en: Live with yourself: get to know how poorly furnished you are.

meaning.zh-TW: 花一些時間安靜地和自己待在一起，好好地審視自己的內心。這句話不是要你覺得自己很差，而是鼓勵我們誠實地看看自己有哪些地方還需要學習和改進。認識自己的不足，是讓自己變得更好的第一步。
meaning.en: Spend some quiet time alone with yourself and take a good look inside your heart. This quote isn't meant to make you feel bad about yourself. Instead, it encourages us to honestly see which areas we still need to learn and improve in. Recognizing our own shortcomings is the first step to becoming better.

quote.zh-TW: 鑑於水者，見面之容；鑑於人者，知治亂也。
quote.en: By looking at a reflection in water, one sees one's own face; by looking at the reflection of the people, one knows the state of governance.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們從鏡子裡可以看到自己的樣子，但要怎麼知道自己做得好不好呢？這位學者說，可以把別人當成鏡子。看看你的行為對別人有什麼影響，聽聽別人的反應，就能知道自己哪些地方做得好，哪些地方需要改進。
meaning.en: We can see what we look like in a mirror, but how do we know if we are doing a good job? This scholar said we can use other people as our mirror. By seeing how your actions affect others and listening to their reactions, you can know what you are doing well and where you need to improve.

quote.el: οὐ γὰρ τὰ τείχη νομίζω πόλιν εἶναι, ἀλλὰ τοὺς ἄνδρας.
quote.zh-TW: 我認為構成城邦的不是圍牆，而是人民。
quote.en: I believe that it is not the walls that make the city, but the men.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個城市、一個學校或一個家，之所以偉大，不是因為它的建築有多漂亮、圍牆有多高大。而是因為住在裡面的「人」。是人們的品格、智慧和互相關愛，才讓一個地方變得真正美好和強大。
meaning.en: What makes a city, a school, or a home great isn't how beautiful its buildings are or how high its walls are. It's the 'people' who live inside. It is the character, wisdom, and mutual love of the people that make a place truly wonderful and strong.

quote.zh-TW: 非知之艱，行之惟艱。
quote.en: It is not knowing that is difficult, but doing.

meaning.zh-TW: 知道該怎麼做，通常不難，例如我們都知道要對人有禮貌。但真正困難的，是「每天都把它做到」。這句話提醒我們，光有知識是不夠的，更重要的是把好的道理，在生活中實際做出來，這才是真正的挑戰與學習。
meaning.en: Knowing what to do is usually not the hard part; for example, we all know we should be polite to people. The truly difficult part is 'actually doing it every day.' This quote reminds us that just having knowledge isn't enough. What's more important is to practice good principles in our daily lives. That is the real challenge and learning.

quote.el: τὸ μὲν ἀδικηθέντα μὴ ἀμύνεσθαι προθυμεῖσθαι μεγαλοφροσύνης ἐστί.
quote.zh-TW: 能承受傷害而不思報復，是偉大靈魂的表現。
quote.en: To accept injury and not wish to take revenge is the mark of a great soul.

meaning.zh-TW: 當別人傷害你的時候，心裡一定很難受，很想「報仇」。但這位哲學家說，一個真正內心強大的人，會選擇承受傷害，並且放下報復的念頭。選擇原諒和寬容，比選擇報復需要更大的勇氣，這也代表你的心胸非常開闊。
meaning.en: When someone hurts you, it must feel terrible, and you might really want to get 'revenge.' But this philosopher says that a person with a truly great soul will choose to endure the injury and let go of the idea of revenge. Choosing forgiveness and tolerance requires much more courage than choosing revenge, and it shows that you have a very big heart.

quote.la: Nam idem velle atque idem nolle, ea demum firma amicitia est.
quote.zh-TW: 渴望同樣的事物，也厭惡同樣的事物，這才是堅固的友誼。
quote.en: To desire the same things and to reject the same things, that is what a firm friendship is.

meaning.zh-TW: 你和最好的朋友是不是都喜歡同樣的遊戲，也討厭同樣的食物呢？這位歷史學家認為，真正的朋友，就是那些和你有著相同價值觀的人。你們都覺得「誠實」很重要，都覺得「欺負別人」是不對的。擁有共同的喜好和標準，友誼才會最牢固。
meaning.en: Do you and your best friend like the same games and dislike the same foods? This historian believed that true friends are people who share the same values as you. You both think 'honesty' is important, and you both think 'bullying' is wrong. Having shared likes and standards is what makes a friendship strong.

quote.he: אל תסתכל בקנקן, אלא במה שיש בו.
quote.zh-TW: 別看容器，要看容器裡裝的東西。
quote.en: Do not look at the flask, but at what is in it.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個瓶子長得漂不漂亮不重要，重要的是裡面裝了什麼好喝的果汁。看人也是一樣！一個人的外表、穿著打扮，就像那個瓶子，而他內心的品格、知識和善良，才是真正重要的東西。這就是「不要以貌取人」。
meaning.en: It doesn't matter if a bottle looks pretty; what matters is the delicious juice inside it. Looking at people is the same way! A person's appearance and clothes are like the bottle, but their inner character, knowledge, and kindness are what is truly important. This is what 'don't judge a book by its cover' means.

quote.la: Veritas filia temporis.
quote.zh-TW: 真相是時間的女兒。
quote.en: Truth is the daughter of time.

meaning.zh-TW: 真相就像一個小嬰兒，需要「時間」這位媽媽，才能慢慢地把她養大，讓大家看見她真正的樣子。這句話用一個很美的比喻告訴我們，不要急著下結論，經過時間的考驗，事情的真相自然會水落石出。
meaning.en: Truth is like a little baby, and it needs 'Time' as its mother to slowly raise it and let everyone see its true face. This quote uses a beautiful metaphor to tell us not to jump to conclusions. After being tested by time, the truth of a matter will naturally be revealed.

quote.la: Primum est sapientiae, falsa sentire; secundum, vera cognoscere.
quote.zh-TW: 智慧的第一要點是分辨虛假，第二是認識真理。
quote.en: The first point of wisdom is to discern what is false; the second is to know what is true.

meaning.zh-TW: 要怎麼成為一個有智慧的人呢？有兩個步驟。第一步，是要有能力看出哪些事情是假的、錯的，就像偵探一樣。第二步，才是去學習和了解哪些事情是真的、對的。先學會分辨，才不會被錯誤的資訊欺騙。
meaning.en: How do you become a wise person? There are two steps. The first step is to have the ability to see which things are false or wrong, just like a detective. The second step is to learn and understand which things are true and right. You must first learn to tell the difference so you won't be fooled by false information.

quote.el: ὅσα ἔμαθον καὶ ἐφρόντισα, καὶ μετὰ Μουσῶν σεμν᾽ ἐδάην, ταῦτ᾽ ἔχω: τὰ δ᾽ ἄλλα πολλὰ καὶ μεγάλα, τῦφος διαρρυέντα.
quote.zh-TW: 我所學、所思，以及繆思女神教我的莊嚴知識，這些我擁有；其他那些驕傲浮誇之物，皆已流逝。
quote.en: What I have learned and thought, and the sublime knowledge the Muses taught me, that I have; but all those other many and great things of pride and pomp have vanished away.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位哲學家把所有的錢都送人了，因為他覺得有比錢更重要的東西。那就是他腦袋裡的知識、他對世界的思考，以及從藝術和學習中得到的快樂。這些東西是永恆的，誰也搶不走。而那些昂貴的、用來炫耀的東西，反而很容易就消失了。
meaning.en: This philosopher gave away all his money because he believed some things were more important than money. Those things were the knowledge in his head, his thoughts about the world, and the joy he got from art and learning. These things are eternal, and no one can take them away. But expensive things used for showing off can disappear very easily.

quote.zh-TW: 正信、正知、正行，是解脫之道。
quote.en: Right faith, right knowledge, and right conduct constitute the path to liberation.

meaning.zh-TW: 要怎麼讓自己的人生走在一條正確的、通往快樂的道路上呢？這本古老的經典給了我們「三個法寶」。第一，要有正確的信念。第二，要有正確的知識。第三，要有正確的行為。把這三樣東西結合起來，就能走在最好的路上了。
meaning.en: How can we make sure our life is on the right path toward happiness? This ancient classic gives us 'three treasures.' First, have the right beliefs. Second, have the right knowledge. Third, have the right conduct. When you combine these three things, you will be walking on the best path.

quote.el: τὸ δίκαιον οὐκ ἄλλο τι ἢ τὸ τοῦ κρείττονος συμφέρον.
quote.zh-TW: 正義不是別的，就是強者的利益。
quote.en: Justice is nothing else than the interest of the stronger.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個很有挑戰性的想法！這位哲學家提出一個問題讓我們思考：會不會在現實世界中，所謂的「公平正義」，常常只是由最有權力的人來決定的呢？他說這句話不是要我們同意他，而是要我們睜大眼睛，去想一想，什麼才是「真正」的公平。
meaning.en: This is a very challenging idea! This philosopher raised a question for us to think about: Could it be that in the real world, what we call 'justice' is often just decided by the most powerful people? He said this not because he wanted us to agree with him, but because he wanted us to open our eyes and think about what 'true' fairness really is.

quote.zh-TW: 萬物皆備於我矣。反身而誠，樂莫大焉。
quote.en: All the ten thousand things are there in me. There is no greater joy for me than to find, on self-examination, that I am true to myself.

meaning.zh-TW: 你心裡其實擁有一個大寶庫，裝著整個世界的美好。孟子說，當我們回過頭來，誠實地面對自己、做最真實的自己時，會得到最大的快樂。快樂不是向外追求，而是向內發現，發現自己本身就是完整的。
meaning.en: You actually have a great treasure chest inside your heart that contains all the wonders of the world. Mencius said that when we turn inward, honestly face ourselves, and are true to who we are, we will find the greatest joy. Happiness is not something to seek outside, but to discover inside, by realizing that you are already complete.

quote.el: οὐ γὰρ ἐκ μιᾶς πράξεως τὸ ἦθος, ἀλλ᾽ ἐκ τοῦ ἔθους ὁρᾶται.
quote.zh-TW: 品格不是由單一行為，而是由習慣來判斷的。
quote.en: Character is not known by a single act, but by habit.

meaning.zh-TW: 偶爾做一件好事，不代表你就是個好人；偶爾犯一個錯，也不代表你就是個壞人。一個人的品格，是看他「平常都怎麼做」。是那些每天重複的小小行為，組成了我們真正的樣子。所以，要努力培養好習慣喔！
meaning.en: Doing one good deed occasionally doesn't make you a good person, and making one mistake occasionally doesn't make you a bad person. A person's character is judged by what they 'usually do.' It's the small actions that we repeat every day that make up who we truly are. So, work hard to cultivate good habits!

quote.zh-TW: 人心之不同，如其面焉。
quote.en: The minds of people are as different as their faces.

meaning.zh-TW: 你看，每個人的長相是不是都不一樣？這本古老的史書告訴我們，每個人的內心和想法，也像我們的臉一樣，是獨一無二的。所以，我們要學會尊重別人和我們有不同的想法，因為這個世界正是因為有各種不同的人，才這麼有趣。
meaning.en: Look, doesn't everyone have a different face? This ancient history book tells us that everyone's heart and mind are just as unique as their face. Therefore, we must learn to respect that others have different ideas from us, because the world is so interesting precisely because it is full of all kinds of different people.

quote.zh-TW: 姿勢應穩定而舒適。
quote.en: The posture (āsana) should be steady and comfortable.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話不只是在說做瑜珈的姿勢喔！它也可以是我們生活的態度。在生活中，我們應該努力找到一個讓自己既「穩定」又「舒服」的狀態。穩定代表我們有原則、不亂晃，舒服代表我們內心很平靜、不焦慮。找到這個平衡點，生活會更美好。
meaning.en: This quote isn't just talking about yoga poses! It can also be an attitude toward life. In our lives, we should strive to find a state where we are both 'steady' and 'comfortable.' Being steady means we have principles and are not easily shaken; being comfortable means our heart is calm and not anxious. Finding this balance makes life better.

quote.la: Spes et columna et firmamentum orbis.
quote.zh-TW: 希望是支撐世界的樑柱。
quote.en: Hope is the pillar that holds up the world.

meaning.zh-TW: 為什麼世界能在經歷這麼多困難後，還能一直進步呢？這位思想家認為，是因為「希望」。希望就像一根看不見的巨大柱子，支撐著我們每一個人。只要心中有希望，我們就有力量去面對挑戰，相信明天會更好。
meaning.en: Why is the world able to keep moving forward after so many difficulties? This thinker believed it is because of 'hope.' Hope is like a giant, invisible pillar that supports every one of us. As long as there is hope in our hearts, we have the strength to face challenges and believe that tomorrow will be better.

quote.el: εὐδαίμων δ᾽, ὃς ἂν ... ὑγιαίνων διάγῃ.
quote.zh-TW: 能健康度日者，即是幸福之人。
quote.en: He is a happy man who passes his days in health.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位古希臘詩人提醒我們一件最簡單，卻也最重要的事：擁有健康的身體，就是一種幸福！能夠自由地跑、跳、玩耍，不會這裡痛、那裡不舒服，這本身就是一份非常珍貴的禮物，我們要好好珍惜它。
meaning.en: This ancient Greek poet reminds us of something very simple, yet very important: having a healthy body is a form of happiness! Being able to run, jump, and play freely, without aches and pains, is itself a very precious gift that we should cherish.

quote.la: Parum est artem nosse, nisi utare.
quote.zh-TW: 只懂一門技藝而不去使用，是沒有用的。
quote.en: It is of little use to know an art without practicing it.

meaning.zh-TW: 你會騎腳踏車，但如果從來不騎，那這項技能又有什麼用呢？這句話告訴我們，學習任何知識或技能，最重要的部分是「練習」和「使用」。學到的東西要常常拿出來用，它才會變成你真正的能力。
meaning.en: You may know how to ride a bicycle, but if you never ride it, what good is that skill? This quote tells us that the most important part of learning any knowledge or skill is 'practice' and 'use.' You must often use what you have learned for it to become your true ability.

quote.el: Ζητεῖν βίον πρῶτον, μετὰ δὲ ἀρετήν.
quote.zh-TW: 首先要謀求生計，然後才追求美德。
quote.en: First seek a livelihood, and then virtue.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位詩人提供了一個很實際的人生建議。他說，我們得先照顧好自己基本的生活，讓自己能吃飽穿暖。在這個基礎上，我們才能更好地去學習、去追求成為一個有品德的好人。先把生活安頓好，是追求更高理想的第一步。
meaning.en: This poet offers a very practical piece of advice for life. He says we must first take care of our basic needs, making sure we have enough to eat and wear. On this foundation, we can then better learn and pursue becoming a person of good character. Settling your basic life is the first step to pursuing higher ideals.

quote.el: ἐν τοῖς γὰρ χαλεποῖσιν, ἀνὴρ ἀγαθὸς παρὰ χρυσὸν καὶ ἄργυρον.
quote.zh-TW: 在困境之中，一個好人比黃金和白銀更貴重。
quote.en: In difficult times, a good man is worth more than gold and silver.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你遇到大麻煩的時候，一堆黃金可能幫不了你，但一個善良、勇敢、值得信賴的好朋友，卻能給你最大的支持。這句話告訴我們，一個人的好品格，是他最珍貴的財產，在關鍵時刻，這種價值遠遠超過任何金錢。
meaning.en: When you are in big trouble, a pile of gold might not be able to help you, but a kind, brave, and trustworthy friend can give you the greatest support. This quote tells us that a person's good character is their most precious possession. At critical moments, this value is far greater than any amount of money.

quote.la: Priusquam incipias, consulto; et ubi consulueris, mature facto opus est.
quote.zh-TW: 開始之前，先仔細計畫；計畫好了，就迅速行動。
quote.en: Before you begin, you must plan. And after you have planned, you must act promptly.

meaning.zh-TW: 要做一件大事，有兩個重要的步驟。第一步是「先想清楚」，就像蓋房子前要畫好設計圖。第二步是「馬上去做」，一旦計畫好了，就不要拖拖拉拉。這位歷史學家告訴我們，深思熟慮和果斷行動，是成功完成任何事情的黃金搭檔。
meaning.en: There are two important steps to accomplishing a big task. The first step is to 'think it through carefully,' just like drawing a blueprint before building a house. The second step is to 'act on it immediately.' Once you have a plan, don't procrastinate. This historian tells us that careful planning and decisive action are the golden partners for successfully completing any task.

quote.zh-TW: 倉廩實而知禮節，衣食足而知榮辱。
quote.en: When the granaries are full, they will know propriety and moderation. When their clothing and food are sufficient, they will know honor and shame.

meaning.zh-TW: 這本古書說，當人們有足夠的食物可以吃、有溫暖的衣服可以穿，生活安定了，才會開始注重禮貌、分辨是非。這提醒我們，幫助別人解決基本的生活困難，是讓社會變得更文明、更有禮的第一步。
meaning.en: This ancient book says that when people have enough food to eat and warm clothes to wear, and their lives are stable, only then will they begin to pay attention to etiquette and distinguish between right and wrong. This reminds us that helping others solve their basic life difficulties is the first step toward making society more civilized and polite.

quote.el: αὐτοὺς ποιεῖν ἑκόντας ἃ οἱ νόμοι ἀναγκάζουσι.
quote.zh-TW: （我的學生學會）出於自願地去做那些法律強迫他們去做的事。
quote.en: (My students learn) to do of their own free will what they are compelled by the laws to do.

meaning.zh-TW: 法律規定我們不能闖紅燈，但一個真正的好學生，不是因為害怕被處罰才不闖紅燈，而是他自己「真心覺得」不該闖紅燈。這位哲學老師說，教育的目標，就是讓我們發自內心地願意去做對的事情，而不只是因為規則的束縛。
meaning.en: The law says we cannot run a red light. But a truly good student doesn't avoid running the red light because they are afraid of being punished, but because they 'genuinely believe' they shouldn't. This philosophy teacher said that the goal of education is to make us want to do the right thing from our hearts, not just because rules force us to.

quote.la: Usus, magister egregius.
quote.zh-TW: 練習，是傑出的導師。
quote.en: Practice is the best of all instructors.

meaning.zh-TW: 誰是最好的老師？這位作家認為，是「練習」本人！不管學什麼，不管是彈鋼琴、畫畫，還是打籃球，聽老師講課很重要，但只有透過一次又一次的親身練習，你才能真正地掌握它。練習會教你所有課本上學不到的訣竅。
meaning.en: Who is the best teacher? This writer believed it is 'practice' itself! No matter what you are learning—whether it's playing the piano, drawing, or basketball—listening to the teacher is important, but only through practicing it yourself over and over can you truly master it. Practice will teach you all the tricks you can't learn from a textbook.

quote.sa: इषुकार इव तेजनं, विद्धं चित्तं रिझुं करोति पण्डितो।
quote.zh-TW: 智者調御其心，如矢師矯正其箭。
quote.en: As a fletcher straightens an arrow, so the wise person directs their crooked thoughts.

meaning.zh-TW: 製作弓箭的師傅，會很仔細地把彎曲的箭桿弄直，這樣箭才能射得又直又遠。我們的思想有時候也會彎來彎去，充滿了不好的念頭。一個有智慧的人，會像這位師傅一樣，時常注意自己的心，把歪掉的想法調整過來，讓自己的心保持正直和專注。
meaning.en: A master arrow-maker will carefully straighten a bent arrow shaft so that the arrow can fly straight and far. Our thoughts can sometimes be crooked too, filled with unhelpful ideas. A wise person, like this master craftsman, constantly pays attention to their own mind, straightening out crooked thoughts to keep their mind upright and focused.

quote.el: ἐγὼ γὰρ οὐδὲ τοῦτο οἶδα, ὅτι οὐδὲν οἶδα.
quote.zh-TW: 我連我一無所知都不知道。
quote.en: I don't even know that I know nothing.

meaning.zh-TW: 有一位哲學家說「我知道我一無所知」，但這位哲學家更進一步！他說，我們連自己「有多麼不知道」都無法確定。這聽起來很繞口，但其實是在提醒我們，要保持極度的謙虛。永遠不要自滿，因為我們不知道的，遠比我們知道的多太多了。
meaning.en: One philosopher said, 'I know that I know nothing,' but this philosopher went even further! He said we can't even be sure 'how much we don't know.' This sounds confusing, but it's actually a reminder to be extremely humble. Never be self-satisfied, because what we don't know is far, far greater than what we know.

quote.zh-TW: 人之言行，善則感動天，惡亦感動天。
quote.en: The words and actions of a person, when good, move Heaven; when evil, they also move Heaven.

meaning.zh-TW: 你做的每一件事，說的每一句話，都像往水裡丟一顆小石頭，會產生一圈一圈的漣漪，影響到周圍的世界。這位學者相信，無論是好事還是壞事，我們的行為都會對整個世界產生影響。所以，要時常注意自己的言行，多做能帶來好漣漪的事。
meaning.en: Every single thing you do and every word you say is like throwing a small pebble into water—it creates ripples that affect the world around you. This scholar believed that whether good or bad, our actions have an impact on the entire world. Therefore, we should always be mindful of our words and deeds, and do more things that create good ripples.

quote.el: μικρὸς γάρ τις κόσμος ἐστίν ὁ ἄνθρωπος.
quote.zh-TW: 人是一個小宇宙。
quote.en: Man is a microcosm.

meaning.zh-TW: 外面的宇宙有太陽、月亮和數不清的星星，非常複雜又奇妙。這位思想家說，其實我們每一個人，也像一個小小的宇宙！我們的身體、思想、感情，也一樣複雜又奇妙。這句話提醒我們，每個人都是非常獨特和珍貴的，要好好認識和愛護自己這個「小宇宙」。
meaning.en: The universe outside has a sun, a moon, and countless stars, and it is very complex and wonderful. This thinker said that actually, every one of us is also like a tiny universe! Our bodies, thoughts, and feelings are just as complex and wonderful. This quote reminds us that every person is very unique and precious, and we should get to know and take good care of our own 'little universe'.

quote.zh-TW: 即使片刻，也不要與惡人為伍。
quote.en: Do not associate with a wicked person, not even for a moment.

meaning.zh-TW: 古老的智慧告訴我們，要非常小心地選擇朋友。因為朋友對我們的影響非常大，就像把一顆乾淨的蘋果和一顆爛掉的蘋果放一起，乾淨的蘋果也很快會壞掉。所以，要多和善良、正直的朋友在一起，遠離那些會帶給你壞影響的人。
meaning.en: Ancient wisdom tells us to be very careful when choosing our friends. This is because friends have a huge influence on us, just like if you put a fresh apple next to a rotten one, the fresh apple will soon spoil. Therefore, you should spend more time with kind and upright friends, and stay away from people who will have a bad influence on you.

quote.zh-TW: 有千金之資，不如有薄技隨身。
quote.en: Having a thousand pieces of gold is not as good as having a simple skill.

meaning.zh-TW: 就算你有很多很多的錢，也比不上學會一項有用的技能。這位學者告訴我們，金錢可能會不見，但你學會的技能，像是游泳、畫畫或修理東西，是永遠跟著你的寶藏。一項好本領，比任何財富都更可靠。
meaning.en: Even if you have lots and lots of money, it's not as good as learning a useful skill. This scholar tells us that money can be lost, but the skills you learn, like swimming, drawing, or fixing things, are treasures that stay with you forever. A good skill is more reliable than any amount of wealth.

quote.el: τὸ συγγνώμην ἔχειν τιμωρίας κρεῖττον.
quote.zh-TW: 寬恕勝於報復。
quote.en: Forgiveness is better than revenge.

meaning.zh-TW: 當別人對你做錯事時，選擇報復可能會讓你暫時覺得出了口氣，但選擇原諒，才是更強大、更有智慧的表現。這位古老的智者教導我們，原諒能讓你的心得到平靜，而報復只會讓仇恨繼續下去。學會原諒，是給自己一份很棒的禮物。
meaning.en: When someone does something wrong to you, taking revenge might make you feel better for a moment, but choosing to forgive is a sign of greater strength and wisdom. This ancient sage taught us that forgiveness brings peace to your heart, while revenge only allows hatred to continue. Learning to forgive is a wonderful gift you give to yourself.

quote.la: Qui desiderat facere, facit.
quote.zh-TW: 真心渴望者，終將成事。
quote.en: He who desires to do something, does it.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話也可以翻譯成「想要尋找珍珠的人，必須潛入深海」。它的意思是，如果你真的、真的很想完成一件事，光是坐在岸邊想是沒用的，你必須勇敢地跳下水，付出努力。真正的渴望會帶來強大的行動力。
meaning.en: This quote can also be translated as 'He who seeks for pearls must dive below.' It means that if you truly, truly want to accomplish something, just sitting on the shore and thinking about it is useless. You must bravely jump into the water and put in the effort. A true desire brings powerful action.

quote.sa: विद्या नाम नरस्य रूपमधिकं प्रच्छन्नगुप्तं धनम्।
quote.zh-TW: 知識是人至高的美，是隱密安全的財富。
quote.en: Knowledge is a man's highest beauty, a treasure securely hidden.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼能讓一個人變得最美呢？這位詩人哲學家認為是「知識」。知識不像衣服會舊、不像容貌會老，它是一種內在的美麗。它也是最安全的寶藏，藏在你的腦海裡，誰也偷不走。所以，讓自己充滿知識，就是最好的打扮。
meaning.en: What makes a person most beautiful? This poet-philosopher believed it is 'knowledge.' Unlike clothes that get old or looks that fade, knowledge is a kind of inner beauty. It is also the safest treasure, hidden in your mind where no one can steal it. Therefore, filling yourself with knowledge is the best way to adorn yourself.

quote.zh-TW: 大道廢，有仁義。
quote.en: When the great Tao is forgotten, goodness and piety appear.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話很特別。老子認為，在最理想的狀態下，大家都很自然地做個好人，根本不需要去談論什麼是「仁慈」、什麼是「正義」。當我們開始一直強調這些品德時，可能就表示大家已經忘記了最自然、最簡單的善良本性了。
meaning.en: This is a very special quote. Laozi believed that in the most ideal state, everyone is naturally a good person, and there's no need to even talk about what 'kindness' or 'justice' is. When we start having to emphasize these virtues all the time, it might mean that people have already forgotten their most natural and simple good nature.

quote.la: Vita enim mortuorum in memoria est posita vivorum.
quote.zh-TW: 逝者的生命，是存放在生者的記憶之中的。
quote.en: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.

meaning.zh-TW: 當一個人或一隻心愛的寵物離開我們時，他們並不是真的消失了。只要我們還記得他們，記得跟他們在一起的快樂時光，他們就永遠活在我們的心中和記憶裡。我們的思念，是他們生命最好的延續。
meaning.en: When a person or a beloved pet leaves us, they don't truly disappear. As long as we still remember them and the happy times we spent together, they live on forever in our hearts and memories. Our remembrance is the best continuation of their lives.

quote.he: עַל־חַטָּאתְךָ אַל־תִּתְבּוֹשָׁשׁ לְהִתְוַדּוֹת וְאֶת־זֶרֶם נָהָר אַל־תְּנַסֶּה לַעֲצֹר
quote.zh-TW: 不要因承認過錯而羞愧，也不要試圖阻擋河水的潮流。
quote.en: Do not be ashamed to confess your sins, and do not try to stop the current of a river.

meaning.zh-TW: 做錯事並不可怕，可怕的是不敢承認。這句話告訴我們兩件事：第一，勇敢承認自己的錯誤，是一種負責任的表現。第二，有些事情就像流動的河水，是我們無法控制的，要學會接受。學會承認和接受，會讓我們更成熟。
meaning.en: Making a mistake isn't scary; what's scary is not daring to admit it. This quote teaches us two things: First, bravely admitting your mistakes is a sign of responsibility. Second, some things are like a flowing river that we cannot control, and we must learn to accept them. Learning to admit and to accept will make us more mature.

quote.ar: الخلق الحسن هو عادة النفس لفعل الخيرات بسهولة ودون روية
quote.zh-TW: 所謂美德，是靈魂不假思索、毫不費力地行善的習慣。
quote.en: Good character is a habit of the soul to do good deeds easily and without deliberation.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你看到有人需要幫忙，想都沒想就立刻伸出援手，這就代表「善良」已經成為你的一部分了。這些哲學家認為，最高級的品格，就是做好事已經變成你的自然反應，像呼吸一樣，根本不需要特別去想。
meaning.en: When you see someone who needs help and you immediately offer your hand without even thinking, it means that 'kindness' has become a part of you. These philosophers believed that the highest form of character is when doing good deeds has become your natural reaction, like breathing, which requires no special thought at all.

quote.el: τὰ νοήματα εἴδωλα πλάττει, μόνον δὲ τὸ θαῦμα καταλαμβάνει τι.
quote.zh-TW: 概念塑造偶像，唯有驚奇能理解事物。
quote.en: Concepts create idols; only wonder comprehends anything.

meaning.zh-TW: 當我們用很多詞語去定義一樣東西時，有時候反而限制了我們的想像。這位思想家認為，真正能幫助我們理解世界的方式，是保持一顆「懂得驚奇」的心。對一朵花、一片雲、一個新知識感到驚奇和讚嘆，在那一刻，我們才能真正地接觸到事物的奧妙。
meaning.en: When we use a lot of words to define something, we sometimes limit our imagination. This thinker believed that the way to truly understand the world is to keep a heart that is 'capable of wonder.' When you feel wonder and awe at a flower, a cloud, or a new piece of knowledge, in that moment, you can truly touch the mystery of things.

quote.el: τὸ εὔδαιμον τὸ ἐλεύθερον, τὸ δ' ἐλεύθερον τὸ εὔψυχον.
quote.zh-TW: 幸福的祕訣是自由，自由的祕訣是勇氣。
quote.en: The secret to happiness is freedom, and the secret to freedom is courage.

meaning.zh-TW: 要怎麼得到真正的快樂呢？首先你需要「自由」。那要怎麼得到自由呢？你需要「勇氣」。這位歷史學家告訴我們，快樂來自於心靈的自由，而自由來自於有勇氣去堅持對的原則、有勇氣去面對挑戰。所以，勇敢，是通往快樂的第一步。
meaning.en: How can we find true happiness? First, you need 'freedom.' And how do you get freedom? You need 'courage.' This historian tells us that happiness comes from freedom of the mind, and freedom comes from having the courage to stand up for what is right and to face challenges. Therefore, being brave is the first step toward happiness.

quote.zh-TW: 心是萬物之源；你怎麼想，就成為什麼。
quote.en: The mind is everything; what you think, you become.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的心，就像一個魔法師。你心裡想著「我能做到」，你就會充滿力量。如果你心裡想著「我好差勁」，你就會感到很沮喪。這句話是佛陀教導的核心，它告訴我們，我們的思想有巨大的力量，它能塑造我們的世界和我們自己。
meaning.en: Your mind is like a magician. If you think 'I can do it,' you will be filled with strength. If you think 'I'm no good,' you will feel down. This is a core teaching of the Buddha. It tells us that our thoughts have immense power to shape our world and ourselves.

quote.la: Audentes fortuna iuvat.
quote.zh-TW: 幸運偏愛勇者。
quote.en: Fortune favors the bold.

meaning.zh-TW: 好運氣比較喜歡去找那些勇敢的人！這位羅馬詩人鼓勵我們，面對機會和挑戰時，不要害怕。那些敢於嘗試、敢於冒險的人，雖然不一定每次都成功，但他們更有可能抓住好運，達成很棒的成就。
meaning.en: Good luck tends to find people who are brave! This Roman poet encourages us not to be afraid when facing opportunities and challenges. Those who dare to try and dare to take risks may not succeed every time, but they are much more likely to catch a lucky break and achieve great things.

quote.zh-TW: 夫孝，德之本也。
quote.en: Filial piety is the root of all virtue.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼是所有美好品德的根源呢？這本儒家經典認為是「孝」。孝順父母、尊敬長輩，是我們學習愛與感恩的第一課。當你學會了如何去愛自己的家人，你就更容易把這份愛擴展出去，去關心朋友、社會和整個世界。
meaning.en: What is the root of all good virtues? This Confucian classic believes it is 'filial piety' (respect for one's parents). Being good to your parents and respecting your elders is the very first lesson in learning how to love and be grateful. When you learn how to love your own family, it becomes easier to extend that love to your friends, society, and the whole world.

quote.zh-TW: 知足是至上的幸福。
quote.en: Contentment is the root of happiness.

meaning.zh-TW: 快樂的根長在哪裡呢？這本古老的法典告訴我們，它長在「知足」的土壤裡。當你對自己擁有的東西，無論多少，都感到滿足和感謝時，快樂就會像大樹一樣，從你的心裡長出來，而且永遠不會枯萎。
meaning.en: Where do the roots of happiness grow? This ancient law book tells us they grow in the soil of 'contentment.' When you feel satisfied and thankful for what you have, no matter how much or how little, happiness will grow out of your heart like a big tree, and it will never wither.

quote.el: τὸ τέλος ἐστὶ τὸ ὁμολογουμένως τῇ φύσει ζῆν.
quote.zh-TW: 人生的目標，是與自然和諧共存。
quote.en: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們人生的最終目標是什麼？這位斯多噶學派的創始人認為，就是讓我們的生活方式，和整個大自然的規律和諧一致。順應事物的自然發展，接受我們不能改變的事，專注於我們能控制的品德，這樣就能達到內心的平靜與和諧。
meaning.en: What is the ultimate goal of our lives? The founder of the Stoic school believed it is to live in a way that is in harmony with the laws of the entire natural world. This means accepting the natural flow of things, accepting what we cannot change, and focusing on our character, which we can control. By doing this, we can achieve inner peace and harmony.

quote.el: Οὐχ ὁ πολλὰ κεκτημένος, ἀλλ’ ὁ πολλὰ διδοὺς πλούσιος.
quote.zh-TW: 富有的不是擁有許多的人，而是給予許多的人。
quote.en: The rich man is not one who is in possession of much, but one who gives much.

meaning.zh-TW: 他重新定義了什麼是「富有」。真正的富有，不是看你的銀行戶頭或你擁有的玩具數量，而是看你有多麼願意和別人「分享」。一個樂於付出、樂於幫助別人的人，他的心靈才是最富足的。
meaning.en: He redefined what it means to be 'rich.' True wealth is not measured by your bank account or the number of toys you own, but by how willing you are to 'share' with others. A person who loves to give and enjoys helping others has the richest spirit of all.

quote.el: Ἡ ἄμπελος φέρει τρεῖς βότρυας· τὸν πρῶτον ἡδονῆς, τὸν δεύτερον μέθης, τὸν τρίτον ἀηδίας.
quote.zh-TW: 葡萄藤結出三串葡萄：第一串帶來快樂，第二串帶來沉醉，第三串帶來厭惡。
quote.en: The vine bears three kinds of grapes: the first of pleasure, the second of intoxication, and the third of disgust.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位來自遠方的智者用葡萄來比喻：做一件開心的事，淺嚐即止會很快樂。如果做得太多，就有點過頭了。如果做得太過火，最後反而會覺得很討厭。這是在提醒我們，凡事都要適可而止，懂得節制，才能一直享受到它的美好。
meaning.en: This wise man from a faraway land used grapes as a metaphor: doing something fun is very pleasurable if you just have a little taste. If you do too much, it becomes excessive. And if you overdo it completely, you will end up disliking it. This is a reminder that we should do everything in moderation and practice self-control to continue enjoying its beauty.

quote.zh-TW: 除了理性，別無指引。
quote.en: There is no guide but reason.

meaning.zh-TW: 當我們迷路時，需要地圖或指南針來指引方向。那在人生的路上，該聽誰的指引呢？這位思想家非常相信「理性」的力量。他認為，我們應該依靠自己的思考、邏輯和判斷，來為自己的人生做出最好的決定，而不是盲目地聽從別人。
meaning.en: When we are lost, we need a map or a compass to guide us. But on the road of life, whose guidance should we follow? This thinker had great faith in the power of 'reason.' He believed that we should rely on our own thinking, logic, and judgment to make the best decisions for our lives, rather than blindly following others.

quote.el: ἡ δ' εὐδαιμονία τῶν δι' αὑτοὺς δοκούντων εἶναι.
quote.zh-TW: 幸福，看來是取決於我們自身。
quote.en: Happiness depends upon ourselves.

meaning.zh-TW: 你的快樂按鈕，其實是掌握在自己手上的！這位偉大的哲學家告訴我們，真正的快樂，不是等著別人給你，也不是靠著買新玩具得到。而是來自於你自己的好品格、好習慣和好選擇。你可以做自己快樂的創造者。
meaning.en: The button for your happiness is actually in your own hands! This great philosopher tells us that true happiness isn't something you wait for others to give you, nor is it something you get from buying new toys. It comes from your own good character, good habits, and good choices. You can be the creator of your own happiness.

quote.la: Ira furor brevis est.
quote.zh-TW: 憤怒是一種短暫的瘋狂。
quote.en: Anger is a short madness.

meaning.zh-TW: 你有沒有在非常生氣的時候，做出一些後來很後悔的事？塞內卡說，人在生氣的時候，就像是暫時「發瘋」了，會失去理智，無法好好思考。所以，當你感覺到憤怒來臨時，要提醒自己，先冷靜下來，不要讓這短暫的瘋狂控制你。
meaning.en: Have you ever done something you later regretted when you were very angry? Seneca said that when people are angry, it's as if they have temporarily 'gone mad.' They lose their reason and can't think clearly. So, when you feel anger coming on, remind yourself to cool down first and don't let this short madness take control of you.

quote.zh-TW: 知者不言，言者不知。
quote.en: He who knows does not speak. He who speaks does not know.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來有點矛盾，但很有意思。老子認為，那些真正有大智慧的人，往往很謙虛、不多話，因為他們知道自己懂得還不夠多。反而是那些一知半解的人，最喜歡到處說、到處炫耀。這提醒我們，要保持謙虛，多聽多學，而不是急著表現。
meaning.en: This quote sounds a bit contradictory, but it's very interesting. Laozi believed that those who have great wisdom are often very humble and don't talk much, because they know there is still much they don't understand. On the other hand, it's often the people who only know a little who love to talk and show off everywhere. This reminds us to stay humble, listen and learn more, and not be in a rush to show off.

quote.el: τῆς μὲν ἱστορίας ἀφαιρεθείσης τῆς ἀληθείας, τὸ καταλειπόμενον αὐτῆς ἀνωφελὲς γίνεται διήγημα.
quote.zh-TW: 歷史若抽離了真相，剩下的就只是無益的故事。
quote.en: If you take truth from history, what is left is but an idle tale.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位歷史學家說，學習歷史最重要的就是要「求真」。如果歷史故事不是真實的，那它就跟隨便編出來的童話故事沒兩樣，沒有太大用處。他提醒我們，無論是讀書還是待人處事，追求和尊重「事實」，都是非常重要的。
meaning.en: This historian said that the most important thing in studying history is to 'seek the truth.' If a historical account is not true, then it's no different from a made-up fairy tale and isn't very useful. He reminds us that whether we are studying or dealing with people and events, pursuing and respecting the 'facts' is always very important.

quote.sa: असतो मा सद्गमय। तमसो मा ज्योतिर्गमय। मृत्योर्माऽमृतं गमय।
quote.zh-TW: 引領我，從虛幻到真實，從黑暗到光明，從死亡到永恆。
quote.en: Lead me from the unreal to the real. Lead me from darkness to light. Lead me from death to immortality.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是ㄧ個非常古老的祈禱。它表達了人類內心最深的渴望：希望能分辨真假，希望能得到智慧、擺脫無知，希望能超越生命的短暫，找到永恆的價值。這是在鼓勵我們，要永遠追求更真實、更光明、更有意義的人生。
meaning.en: This is a very ancient prayer. It expresses the deepest desire of the human heart: to be able to tell the difference between what is false and what is true, to gain wisdom and escape ignorance, and to go beyond the shortness of life to find eternal value. This encourages us to always pursue a life that is more real, more bright, and more meaningful.

quote.zh-TW: 凡音之起，由人心生也。人心之動，物使之然也。
quote.en: All music arises from the human heart. The movement of the human heart is caused by external things.

meaning.zh-TW: 音樂是怎麼來的呢？這本古書說，音樂是從我們的心裡來的。當我們看到美麗的風景、經歷了開心的事，我們的心被觸動了，就產生了音樂的靈感。所以，音樂是我們內心對這個世界感受的一種表達。
meaning.en: Where does music come from? This ancient book says that music comes from our hearts. When we see beautiful scenery or experience happy events, our hearts are touched, and this creates the inspiration for music. Therefore, music is an expression of our heart's feelings about the world.

quote.el: Ὁ ἄρτος, ὃν σὺ κατέχεις, τοῦ πεινῶντός ἐστιν.
quote.zh-TW: 你留著不用的麵包，是屬於飢餓之人的。
quote.en: The bread in your cupboard belongs to the hungry.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你有很多很多的麵包，多到自己吃不完，那麼那些多出來的麵包，其實是屬於那些正在挨餓的人的。這位充滿愛心的智者提醒我們，當我們擁有的比需要的多時，應該要和有需要的人分享。分享不是一種選擇，而是一種責任。
meaning.en: If you have lots and lots of bread, so much that you can't possibly eat it all, then that extra bread actually belongs to those who are starving. This wise and loving man reminds us that when we have more than we need, we should share it with those in need. Sharing is not just a choice; it is a responsibility.

quote.el: τὴν εὐδαιμονίαν εἶναι τὴν τῶν κατὰ φύσιν ἐχόντων τελείαν ἕξιν.
quote.zh-TW: 幸福，是合乎自然事物的圓滿狀態。
quote.en: Happiness is the state of perfect functioning in things that are in accordance with nature.

meaning.zh-TW: 幸福是什麼呢？這位哲學家認為，幸福就像一株植物，當它得到陽光、空氣和水，很自然地成長、開花、結果時，它就處於最完美的狀態。我們人類也一樣，當我們順應自然，讓自己善良的本性好好發展時，就達到了最圓滿的幸福。
meaning.en: What is happiness? This philosopher believed that happiness is like a plant. When it gets sunshine, air, and water, and grows, flowers, and bears fruit naturally, it is in its most perfect state. We humans are the same. When we follow our nature and allow our good inner qualities to develop well, we reach the most complete state of happiness.

quote.zh-TW: 正義是靈魂的健康。
quote.en: Justice is the health of the soul.

meaning.zh-TW: 就像我們的身體需要健康一樣，我們的靈魂也需要健康。那要怎麼讓靈魂健康呢？這位哲學家說，答案是「正義」。當我們待人公平、做事正直，我們的內心（也就是靈魂）就會處於一種平衡又健康的狀態。
meaning.en: Just as our bodies need to be healthy, our souls also need to be healthy. So how can we keep our souls healthy? This philosopher said the answer is 'justice.' When we treat people fairly and act with integrity, our inner self (our soul) will be in a balanced and healthy state.

quote.la: Lapis qui volvitur algam non generat.
quote.zh-TW: 滾石不生苔。
quote.en: A rolling stone gathers no moss.

meaning.zh-TW: 一顆不停滾來滾去的石頭，上面長不出青苔。這句古老的諺語有很多意思。其中一個是提醒我們，如果一個人一直換工作、換地方，沒有安定下來，就很難累積經驗和財富。它告訴我們，專注和穩定也是很重要的。
meaning.en: A stone that is always rolling around won't grow any moss on it. This ancient proverb has many meanings. One of them is to remind us that if a person keeps changing jobs or places and never settles down, it's hard to accumulate experience and wealth. It tells us that focus and stability are also very important.

quote.el: ὁδὸς ἄνω κάτω μία καὶ ὡυτή.
quote.zh-TW: 向上和向下的路，是同一條路。
quote.en: The way up and the way down are one and the same.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來很奇怪，但其實很有道理。它告訴我們，很多看起來完全相反的事情，其實是互相連結的。就像上坡很累，但風景很好；下坡很輕鬆，但可能會錯過風景。成功和失敗、快樂和悲傷，都是人生這條路上的一部分，它們共同組成了完整的旅程。
meaning.en: This quote sounds strange, but it's actually very wise. It tells us that many things that seem like complete opposites are actually connected. For example, walking uphill is tiring, but the view is great; walking downhill is easy, but you might miss the scenery. Success and failure, happiness and sadness, are all parts of the same road of life, and together they make up the complete journey.

quote.la: Salus populi suprema lex esto.
quote.zh-TW: 人民的福祉應是最高的法律。
quote.en: The welfare of the people shall be the supreme law.

meaning.zh-TW: 所有規則和法律中，哪一條應該是最重要的呢？這位羅馬政治家認為，最重要的法律，就是要讓所有的人民過得幸福安康。所有規定都應該為這個最高的目標服務。這提醒我們，一個好的團體，應該要把成員的幸福放在第一位。
meaning.en: Of all the rules and laws, which one should be the most important? This Roman statesman believed that the most important law is to ensure that all people live happy and well. All regulations should serve this highest goal. This reminds us that a good community should always put the well-being of its members first.

quote.zh-TW: 民惟邦本，本固邦寧。
quote.en: The people are the root of a country; when the root is firm, the country is tranquil.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個國家就像一棵大樹，而所有的人民，就是這棵樹的樹根。只有樹根健康、穩固了，這棵大樹才能長得又高又壯，國家才能安定。這句話告訴我們，人民才是一個國家最重要的基礎。
meaning.en: A country is like a big tree, and all of its people are the roots of that tree. Only when the roots are healthy and strong can the tree grow tall and mighty, and only then can the country be peaceful and stable. This quote tells us that the people are the most important foundation of a nation.

quote.el: ποτὲ γὰρ καὶ ἐγὼ γενόμην κοῦρός τε κόρη τε θάμνος τ' οἰωνός τε καὶ ἔξαλος ἔλλοπος ἰχθύς.
quote.zh-TW: 我曾一度是男孩和女孩，是灌木、是飛鳥，也是海中無言的魚。
quote.en: For I have been in the past a boy and a girl, a bush and a bird and a silent fish in the sea.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位哲學家相信，所有的生命都是互相連結的，我們的靈魂可能會在不同的生命形式中旅行。他用這句詩意的語言告訴我們，我們和男孩、女孩、花草樹木、鳥兒和魚兒，其實都是一體的。這是在提醒我們要愛護和尊重地球上所有的生命。
meaning.en: This philosopher believed that all life is interconnected and that our souls might travel through different forms of life. He used this poetic language to tell us that we, along with boys, girls, plants, birds, and fish, are actually all one. This is a reminder to love and respect all life on Earth.

quote.el: ἀλλ᾽ εἰ χεῖρας ἔχον βόες ἵπποι τ᾽ ἠὲ λέοντες... γράψαν καὶ θεῶν ἰδέας καὶ σώματ᾽ ἐποίουν τοιαῦθ᾽ οἷόν περ καὐτοὶ δέμας εἶχον.
quote.zh-TW: 倘若牛、馬和獅子有手……牠們也會畫出和自己形象一樣的神。
quote.en: But if cattle and horses and lions had hands... they would draw the forms of the gods in their own likeness.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們常常會用自己的樣子去想像其他事物。這位愛思考的哲學家說，如果牛會畫畫，牠畫出來的神，一定也是一頭牛的樣子。他用這個有趣的比喻提醒我們，我們的看法常常是從自己的角度出發的，要學會跳出自己的框框，去想想別人是怎麼看的。
meaning.en: We often imagine other things based on what we ourselves are like. This thoughtful philosopher said that if a cow could draw, the god it drew would definitely look like a cow. He used this fun metaphor to remind us that our perspective is often based on our own point of view. We should learn to step outside of our own box and think about how others see things.

quote.ar: لا تستخدم في يوم واحد كل ما لديك، فالغد قد يكون طويلاً.
quote.zh-TW: 不要在一天之內用盡你所有，因為明天可能很長。
quote.en: Do not use in one day all that you have, for tomorrow may be long.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你有一大包糖果，你會不會一天就把它全部吃完？這位智者建議我們不要這麼做。無論是我們的零用錢、我們的精力，還是我們的時間，都要學會有計畫地使用，為明天留一些。這就是「深謀遠慮」的智慧。
meaning.en: If you had a big bag of candy, would you eat it all in one day? This wise man advises us not to do that. Whether it's our allowance, our energy, or our time, we should learn to use it with a plan and save some for tomorrow. This is the wisdom of 'thinking ahead.'

quote.la: Pax Romana maior victoriae fuit.
quote.zh-TW: 羅馬的和平是比其勝利更偉大的福祉。
quote.en: The Roman Peace was a greater blessing than victory.

meaning.zh-TW: 贏得一場比賽或戰爭，好像很厲害。但這位歷史學家認為，能讓大家過上長久的和平生活，其實是更了不起、更困難的成就。這句話告訴我們，和平與安定，遠比任何勝利都來得更珍貴。
meaning.en: Winning a game or a war seems very impressive. But this historian believed that enabling everyone to live a long and peaceful life is actually a much greater and more difficult achievement. This quote tells us that peace and stability are far more precious than any victory.

quote.ta: கேடில் விழுச்செல்வம் கல்வி யொருவற்கு மாடல்ல மற்றை யவை.
quote.zh-TW: 學習是真正不朽的財富，其他事物皆非真財富。
quote.en: Learning is the true imperishable wealth; all other things are not real wealth.

meaning.zh-TW: 這世界上有一種財富，永遠不會不見，也不會被偷走，那就是「學習」。這位印度聖人告訴我們，你學到的知識和智慧，是你身上最寶貴的財產，其他的東西，像是玩具或金錢，總有一天會消失。所以，投資在自己的學習上，是最聰明的選擇。
meaning.en: There is one kind of wealth in this world that will never disappear and can never be stolen, and that is 'learning.' This Indian sage tells us that the knowledge and wisdom you acquire are your most precious assets. Other things, like toys or money, will one day be gone. Therefore, investing in your own learning is the smartest choice.

name.zh-TW: 龐迪可的伊瓦格里烏斯

quote.el: μοναχός ἐστιν ὁ πάντων χωριζόμενος καὶ πᾶσι συνηρμοσμένος.
quote.zh-TW: 隱修者，是離群索居之人，亦是與萬物和諧之人。
quote.en: A monk is one who is separated from all and who is in harmony with all.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話描述了一種很特別的境界。一個人雖然獨自生活，看起來和大家分開了，但他的內心卻能和整個世界、所有的人都連結在一起，達到一種和諧的狀態。這告訴我們，真正的連結，是來自內心的平靜與愛，而不是身體上的靠近。
meaning.en: This quote describes a very special state of being. Although a person may live alone and seem separate from everyone, their heart can be connected to the entire world and all people, achieving a state of harmony. This tells us that true connection comes from inner peace and love, not just from being physically close to others.

quote.el: χρηστοῖς μὲν θαρσῶν, πονηροῖς δ᾽ εὐλαβούμενος.
quote.zh-TW: 順境時要沉著，逆境時要審慎。
quote.en: Be moderate in prosperity, prudent in adversity.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位智者給了我們在不同情況下的行為建議。當你一切順利、很成功的時候，要保持平常心，不要太驕傲。而當你遇到困難、運氣不好的時候，則要特別小心謹慎地做決定。在人生的順流和逆流中，保持智慧的平衡很重要。
meaning.en: This wise man gives us advice on how to act in different situations. When everything is going well and you are very successful, you should maintain a calm mind and not become too proud. And when you encounter difficulties and are having bad luck, you should be especially careful and prudent in making decisions. It is important to maintain a wise balance in the ebbs and flows of life.

quote.el: πάντων χρημάτων μέτρον ἐστὶν ἄνθρωπος.
quote.zh-TW: 人是萬物的尺度。
quote.en: Man is the measure of all things.

meaning.zh-TW: 一件東西是好是壞、是冷是熱，都是由「人」的感覺來決定的。這句話告訴我們，每個人的感受和看法都是從自己的角度出發的。這提醒我們要理解，不同的人對同一件事，可能會產生完全不同的看法，沒有絕對的對錯。
meaning.en: Whether a thing is good or bad, hot or cold, is determined by a 'person's' feeling. This quote tells us that everyone's feelings and perspectives come from their own point of view. This reminds us to understand that different people can have completely different views on the same thing, and there isn't always an absolute right or wrong.

quote.zh-TW: 君子之學也，入乎耳，箸乎心，布乎四體，形乎動靜。
quote.en: The learning of the superior person enters his ear, clings to his mind, spreads through his four limbs, and manifests itself in his actions.

meaning.zh-TW: 真正的學習是什麼樣子呢？這位哲學家形容得好美！他說，學到的知識，會先進到你的耳朵裡，然後牢牢記在心裡，接著會充滿你的全身，最後，會在你的一舉一動中自然地表現出來。學習不只是記東西，而是要把它變成你的一部分。
meaning.en: What does true learning look like? This philosopher described it beautifully! He said that knowledge first enters your ears, then sticks firmly in your mind, then fills your whole body, and finally, it shows naturally in your every move. Learning isn't just about memorizing things; it's about making it a part of who you are.

quote.la: Ipsa quidem virtus pretium sibi.
quote.zh-TW: 美德本身就是對自己的回報。
quote.en: Virtue is its own reward.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們為什麼要做一個善良、誠實的人？不是為了得到別人的稱讚或獎品。這句話告訴我們，做一件對的事情，它本身帶給我們的內心平靜和快樂，就是最好的獎勵。品德的光芒，本身就足以照亮我們自己。
meaning.en: Why should we be kind and honest people? It's not to get praise or prizes from others. This quote tells us that when you do the right thing, the inner peace and happiness it brings you is the best reward of all. The light of virtue is enough to illuminate ourselves.

quote.la: Itaque certum nihil est, nisi id, quod certum est nihil esse.
quote.zh-TW: 因此，沒有什麼是確定的，除了「沒有什麼是確定的」這件事本身。
quote.en: Therefore, the only certainty is that nothing is certain.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位熱愛研究大自然的學者發現，世界一直在變化，充滿了未知。他說，唯一可以確定的事，就是「凡事都充滿不確定」。這不是要我們沮喪，而是提醒我們要對世界保持好奇心和謙虛，因為永遠有新的事物等著我們去發現。
meaning.en: This scholar who loved to study nature discovered that the world is always changing and is full of unknowns. He said the only thing we can be certain about is that 'everything is uncertain.' This isn't meant to make us sad, but to remind us to stay curious and humble about the world, because there are always new things waiting for us to discover.

quote.pi: सेय्यथापि, भिक्खवे, महासमुद्दो एकरसो लोणरसो, एवमेवं खो, भिक्खवे, अयं धम्मविनयो एकरसो विमुत्तिरसो।
quote.zh-TW: 猶如大海唯有一味，即是鹹味；我的教法也唯有一味，即是解脫味。
quote.en: Just as the great ocean has one taste, the taste of salt, so this teaching has one taste, the taste of freedom.

meaning.zh-TW: 不管你從大海的哪個地方舀起一勺水，它的味道都是鹹的。佛陀說，他所有的教導，也像大海一樣，只有一種味道，那就是「自由的味道」。這個自由，是指讓我們的心靈從煩惱和痛苦中解脫出來，得到真正的平靜。
meaning.en: No matter where you scoop up a spoonful of water from the great ocean, it always tastes salty. The Buddha said that all of his teachings, just like the ocean, have only one taste: 'the taste of freedom.' This freedom means liberating our minds from worries and suffering to achieve true peace.

quote.zh-TW: 謙遜者如沃土，能吸收雨水，亦能回饋豐收。
quote.en: A humble person is like fertile ground that drinks the rain and gives back a harvest.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位詩人用一個很美的比喻來形容「謙虛」。他說，謙虛的人就像一片肥沃的土地，樂於吸收別人的教導（就像土地吸收雨水），然後會把學到的東西，變成很好的成果（就像長出豐盛的莊稼）分享給大家。謙虛讓我們學得更多，也貢獻得更多。
meaning.en: This poet used a beautiful metaphor to describe 'humility.' He said that a humble person is like a piece of fertile land, happy to absorb the teachings of others (like the land absorbing rain), and then they will turn what they've learned into wonderful results (like growing an abundant harvest) to share with everyone. Humility helps us learn more and contribute more.

quote.zh-TW: 君子欲訥於言而敏於行。
quote.en: The superior man wishes to be slow in his speech and earnest in his conduct.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個品格好的人，在說話的時候會很謹慎，不會隨便誇口；但在做事情的時候，卻非常勤快、認真。這句話教導我們，要少說空話，多做實事。行動，永遠是最好的證明。
meaning.en: A person of good character is very careful when they speak and doesn't make empty boasts. But when it comes to getting things done, they are very diligent and serious. This quote teaches us to talk less and do more. Action is always the best proof.

quote.zh-TW: 玉不琢，不成器。
quote.en: If jade is not carved, it cannot become a useful vessel.

meaning.zh-TW: 一塊未經雕琢的美玉，只是一塊石頭，沒辦法成為有用的器皿。人也是一樣！我們每個人都像一塊有潛力的玉，需要經過學習、努力和磨練，才能把自己的才能發揮出來，成為一個對社會有用的人。
meaning.en: An uncarved piece of beautiful jade is just a stone; it can't become a useful utensil. People are the same way! Every one of us is like a piece of jade with great potential. We need to go through learning, hard work, and training to bring out our talents and become useful members of society.

quote.el: πόλλ' οἶδ' ἀλώπηξ, ἀλλ' ἐχῖνος ἓν μέγα.
quote.zh-TW: 狐狸知道很多事，但刺蝟只知道一件大事。
quote.en: The fox knows many things, but the hedgehog knows one big thing.

meaning.zh-TW: 狐狸很狡猾，會很多小技巧來躲避敵人。但刺蝟只會一招：縮成一顆長滿刺的球，這一招卻非常有效。這句話告訴我們，解決問題的方法有兩種：一種是像狐狸一樣，靈活運用各種小方法；另一種是像刺蝟一樣，專心守住一個最重要的原則。兩種智慧都很有用喔！
meaning.en: The fox is very cunning and knows many little tricks to escape enemies. But the hedgehog only knows one trick: rolling up into a spiky ball, and this one trick is very effective. This quote tells us there are two ways to solve problems: one is to be like the fox, flexibly using many different methods; the other is to be like the hedgehog, focusing on one single, most important principle. Both kinds of wisdom are very useful!

quote.la: Amici, diem perdidi.
quote.zh-TW: 朋友們，我浪費了一天。
quote.en: Friends, I have lost a day.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位羅馬皇帝，據說每天晚上都會回想自己今天做了什麼。如果他發現這一天當中，沒有幫助過任何人，他就會難過地說出這句話。這是在提醒我們，每一天都要努力去做一件對別人有幫助的好事，哪怕只是件小事，這樣這一天才沒有白白浪費掉。
meaning.en: It is said that this Roman emperor would reflect on his day every evening. If he found that he had not helped anyone during the day, he would sadly say these words. This is a reminder to us that every day, we should strive to do something good to help others, even if it's just a small thing. That way, the day will not have been wasted.

quote.zh-TW: 三界唯心所現。
quote.en: The three realms are mind-only.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位佛教哲學家提出一個很酷的想法：我們所看到、所感受到的整個世界，其實都是我們「心」的投射。就像放電影一樣，心是放映機，世界是螢幕上的影像。這告訴我們，改變自己的心態和看法，就能改變我們所看到的世界。
meaning.en: This Buddhist philosopher proposed a very cool idea: the entire world that we see and feel is actually a projection of our 'mind.' It's like showing a movie: the mind is the projector, and the world is the image on the screen. This tells us that by changing our mindset and perspective, we can change the world we see.

quote.la: Non ut intellegere possit, sed ne omnino possit non intellegere.
quote.zh-TW: （寫作的目標）不是讓人有可能聽懂，而是讓人不可能聽不懂。
quote.en: (The goal of writing is) not that the reader may understand, but that they cannot possibly misunderstand.

meaning.zh-TW: 當我們跟別人溝通時，不只要把話說清楚，還要努力說到「不可能被誤會」的程度。這位修辭學老師提醒我們，要站在聽眾的角度思考，用最簡單、最明白的方式去表達，確保我們想傳達的意思，能準確地被對方接收。
meaning.en: When we communicate with others, we should not only speak clearly, but strive to speak so clearly that we 'cannot possibly be misunderstood.' This teacher of rhetoric reminds us to think from the listener's perspective and use the simplest, most understandable way to express ourselves, ensuring that the meaning we want to convey is received accurately.

quote.he: כל ימי גדלתי בין החכמים ולא מצאתי לגוף טוב משתיקה.
quote.zh-TW: 我一生在智者間長大，發現對人而言，沒有比沉默更好的事了。
quote.en: All my days I have grown up among the Sages, and I have found nothing better for a person than silence.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位智者從小就跟很多聰明人在一起，他發現了一個大秘密：比起說很多話，「沉默」有時候是更好的選擇。在開口前先聆聽、先思考，不說沒意義的話，也不隨便批評。學會適時的沉默，是一種大智慧。
meaning.en: This wise man grew up among many smart people and discovered a great secret: compared to talking a lot, 'silence' is sometimes the better choice. Listen and think before you speak, don't say meaningless things, and don't criticize casually. Learning the value of timely silence is a great form of wisdom.

quote.el: τὸ τῆς φύσεως ἀγαθὸν μεῖζόν ἐστι τοῦ τῆς παιδείας.
quote.zh-TW: 良好的天性比良好的教育更重要。
quote.en: A good nature is more important than a good education.

meaning.zh-TW: 學習很多知識很重要，但這位演說家認為，有一樣東西比知識更重要，那就是天生善良的品格。一個心地好的人，就算懂得道理不多，也比一個滿肚子學問卻心術不正的人好得多。善良，是所有學習的基礎。
meaning.en: Learning a lot of knowledge is important, but this orator believed one thing is even more important than knowledge: a naturally good character. A person with a kind heart, even if they don't know many theories, is much better than someone who is full of knowledge but has bad intentions. Kindness is the foundation of all learning.

quote.el: μᾶλλον ἂν ἐγὼ ἐθέλοιμι ἀδικεῖσθαι ἢ ἀδικεῖν.
quote.zh-TW: 我寧願承受不義，也不願行不義之事。
quote.en: I would rather suffer wrong than do it.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果要在「被別人欺負」和「欺負別人」之間選一個，你會怎麼選？這位偉大的哲學家說，他寧願選擇被欺負。因為去傷害別人，會污染我們自己的內心，讓我們變成不好的人，這才是最糟的。保持自己內心的善良與乾淨，比任何事都重要。
meaning.en: If you had to choose between 'being wronged by others' and 'wronging others,' which would you choose? This great philosopher said he would rather choose to be wronged. This is because harming others pollutes our own hearts and turns us into bad people, which is the worst outcome of all. Keeping your own heart good and clean is more important than anything else.

quote.el: ἡ φιλία κοινωνία τις ἐστίν.
quote.zh-TW: 友誼是一種夥伴關係。
quote.en: Friendship is a partnership.

meaning.zh-TW: 朋友是什麼？亞里斯多德給了一個很棒的定義：朋友就是「夥伴」。你們不只是一起玩樂，更是一起學習、一起成長、一起朝著共同目標前進的隊友。好的夥伴會互相支持、互相鼓勵，讓彼此都變得更棒。
meaning.en: What is a friend? Aristotle gave a great definition: a friend is a 'partner.' You don't just have fun together; you are teammates who learn together, grow together, and move toward common goals together. Good partners support and encourage each other, making each other better.

quote.el: Πρῶτον εἰπὲ σεαυτῷ, ποῖός τις εἶναι θέλεις· εἶθ' οὕτως ποίει, ἃ ποιεῖς.
quote.zh-TW: 首先，告訴自己你想成為什麼樣的人；然後，就去做你該做的事。
quote.en: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個實現夢想的兩步驟計畫！第一步，先在心裡清楚地想好，你未來想成為一個什麼樣的人？（例如：一個勇敢的消防員）。第二步，就朝著這個目標，去做每天該做的練習和準備。先有目標，再有行動，你就能一步步靠近理想的自己。
meaning.en: This is a two-step plan for achieving your dreams! Step one: First, think clearly in your mind what kind of person you want to become in the future (for example, a brave firefighter). Step two: With that goal in mind, do the practice and preparation you need to do every day. Have a goal first, then take action, and you can get closer to your ideal self step by step.

name.en: Yellow Emperor's Classic of Internal Medicine

quote.zh-TW: 上工治未病，不治已病。
quote.en: The superior physician treats that which is not yet ill.

meaning.zh-TW: 最高明的醫生，不是等到你生病了才來幫你治病，而是在你還沒生病的時候，就教你如何保持健康，預防疾病的發生。這句話告訴我們「預防勝於治療」。無論是健康還是處理問題，能在壞事前發生前就先阻止它，才是最高明的做法。
meaning.en: The most brilliant doctor doesn't wait until you are sick to treat you; they teach you how to stay healthy and prevent illness before it even happens. This quote teaches us that 'prevention is better than cure.' Whether it's with our health or with solving problems, the smartest approach is to stop bad things from happening before they start.

quote.el: ἁ φύσις δ’ ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ ἅρμοχθη ἐξ ἀπείρων τε καὶ περαινόντων.
quote.zh-TW: 宇宙中的自然，是由無限與限定的元素和諧地構成。
quote.en: Nature in the cosmos was harmonized from unlimited and limiting elements.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位畢達哥拉斯學派的哲學家，對宇宙有很美的看法。他覺得，宇宙是由兩種東西組成的：一種是「無限的」，像是空間和時間；另一種是「有限的」，像是一顆石頭或一張桌子。而把這兩種完全不同的東西，完美地結合在一起，靠的就是「和諧」，就像音樂一樣。世界就是一首和諧的交響樂。
meaning.en: This Pythagorean philosopher had a beautiful view of the universe. He felt that the cosmos is made of two kinds of things: one is 'unlimited,' like space and time, and the other is 'limited,' like a rock or a table. And the thing that perfectly combines these two different things is 'harmony,' just like in music. The world is a harmonious symphony.

quote.zh-TW: 所以，現在，讓我們開始探究正法(Dharma)。
quote.en: Now, therefore, the inquiry into Dharma (righteous duty).

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一本重要古書的第一句話。它沒有給我們答案，而是邀請我們開始一場探索。它說：「好了，現在，我們一起來探索『什麼是該做的對的事』吧！」這句話告訴我們，人生最重要的事，就是抱持好奇心，主動開始去尋找什麼是正確、有意義的道路。
meaning.en: This is the very first sentence of an important ancient book. It doesn't give us an answer, but invites us to start an exploration. It says, 'Okay, now, let's begin our inquiry into 'what is the right thing to do'!' This quote tells us that the most important thing in life is to stay curious and proactively start searching for the path that is right and meaningful.

quote.el: τὸ μὲν γὰρ ἀντειπεῖν οὐ χαλεπόν, τὸ δὲ κρεῖττον ἀντεισηγήσασθαι παγχάλεπον.
quote.zh-TW: 反對一個提議不難，但提出一個更好的方案卻非常困難。
quote.en: It is a thing of no great difficulty to raise objections against a proposition, but a matter of great cleverness to establish a better.

meaning.zh-TW: 當別人提出一個想法時，挑毛病、說「這個不好、那個不行」很容易。但真正困難、也更有幫助的，是自己動腦筋，想出一個「更好的」方法。這位歷史學家提醒我們，不要只做一個批評家，要努力成為一個能解決問題的建設者。
meaning.en: When someone proposes an idea, it's easy to find fault and say, 'This is no good, that won't work.' But what's truly difficult, and much more helpful, is to use your own brain to come up with a 'better' solution. This historian reminds us not to just be a critic, but to strive to be a constructive problem-solver.

quote.el: πῶς ἐγγύς ἐστιν καὶ ὅτι οὐδὲν λέληθεν αὐτὸν τῶν ἐννοιῶν ἡμῶν οὐδὲ τῶν διαλογισμῶν, οὓς ποιοῦμεθα.
quote.zh-TW: 祂何其之近，我們內心的思慮或推理，無一能對祂隱藏。
quote.en: How near He is, and how that nothing of our thoughts or of our reasonings is hid from Him.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位早期的基督教作家提醒信徒，上帝無所不在，就連我們心裡偷偷想的事情，祂也都知道。這句話也可以提醒我們，要學會「誠實面對自己」。因為就算我們能騙得了別人，也騙不了自己的內心。做一個表裡如一的人最安心。
meaning.en: This early Christian writer reminded believers that God is everywhere and knows even the secret thoughts in our hearts. This quote can also remind us to learn to be 'honest with ourselves.' Because even if we can fool other people, we can never fool our own hearts. Being a person whose inside matches their outside is the most peaceful way to be.

quote.el: Μήτε κακῷ παρὰ κωφὸν ἵζευ μήτ' ἀποδείπνει.
quote.zh-TW: 不要與壞人同坐，也不要與他共餐。
quote.en: Neither sit nor dine with a bad man.

meaning.zh-TW: 俗話說「近朱者赤，近墨者黑」。這位詩人用很直接的方式告訴我們，要小心選擇你的朋友和同伴。不要花時間和品格不好的人在一起，因為他們的壞習慣和壞想法，可能會像感冒一樣傳染給你。要多和能讓你變得更好的人在一起。
meaning.en: As the saying goes, 'He who touches pitch shall be defiled therewith.' This poet tells us in a very direct way that we must be careful when choosing our friends and companions. Don't spend time with people of bad character, because their bad habits and bad ideas might spread to you like a cold. You should spend more time with people who make you better.

quote.la: Vita, si uti scias, longa est.
quote.zh-TW: 生命，如果你懂得如何運用它，其實是很長的。
quote.en: Life, if you know how to use it, is long.

meaning.zh-TW: 很多人常常抱怨時間不夠用，但這位哲學家說，問題不在時間的長短，而在我們怎麼使用它。如果你把時間都花在有意義、能讓自己成長的事情上，你會發現生命其實很充實、很長。所以，要做時間的好管家，而不是被時間追著跑。
meaning.en: Many people complain that they don't have enough time, but this philosopher said the problem isn't the length of time, but how we use it. If you spend your time on meaningful things that help you grow, you will find that life is actually very full and long. So, be a good manager of your time, instead of being chased by it.

quote.el: ἣν ᾖς φιλομαθής, ἔσει πολυμαθής.
quote.zh-TW: 如果你是個愛學習的人，你就會博學多聞。
quote.en: If you are a lover of learning, you will be a master of much.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話的道理很直接，卻非常重要。它告訴我們，通往「學問淵博」的唯一道路，就是「熱愛學習」。只要你保持一顆好奇的心，對世界充滿熱情，享受學習新事物的樂趣，你自然而然就會懂得越來越多。
meaning.en: The logic of this quote is very direct, yet very important. It tells us that the only road to becoming 'knowledgeable' is to 'love learning.' As long as you maintain a curious heart, are passionate about the world, and enjoy the fun of learning new things, you will naturally come to know more and more.

quote.pi: मा अनुस्सवेन, मा परम्पराय... यदा तुम्हे अत्तनाव जानेय्याथ: इमे धम्मा अकुसला... अथ तुम्हे पजहेय्याथ।
quote.zh-TW: 不要輕信傳統…但當你們自己確知：『這些事是不好的』，那時就應斷然捨棄。
quote.en: Do not go by tradition... but when you know for yourselves that these things are unwholesome, then you should abandon them.

meaning.zh-TW: 佛陀在這段話裡，給了我們一把思想的鑰匙。他教導我們，不要因為「大家都這麼說」或「一直以來都這樣」就隨便相信。要用你自己的智慧去判斷，親身體驗和思考。當你確定一件事是不好的，就要勇敢地拋棄它。要做自己思想的主人。
meaning.en: In this passage, the Buddha gives us a key for our minds. He teaches us not to blindly believe something just because 'everyone says so' or 'it has always been this way.' You must use your own wisdom to judge, and experience and think for yourself. When you are certain that something is not good, you must have the courage to abandon it. Be the master of your own mind.

quote.fa: وظیفه تو این نیست که به دنبال عشق بگردی، بلکه تنها وظیفه تو این است که در درون خودت، تمام موانعی را که در برابر آن ساخته‌ای، پیدا کنی و از میان برداری.
quote.zh-TW: 你的任務不是去尋找愛，而是去尋找並拆除內心所有對愛的藩籬。
quote.en: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位詩人說，愛，其實一直都在。我們不需要到外面去尋找它。我們真正的功課，是向內看，看看自己心裡是不是築起了一些牆壁，像是嫉妒、生氣或偏見，讓愛進不來。把這些牆壁拆掉，愛自然就會充滿你的心。
meaning.en: This poet said that love is, in fact, always present. We don't need to go searching for it outside. Our real task is to look inward and see if we have built any walls in our hearts—like jealousy, anger, or prejudice—that are keeping love out. Tear down these walls, and love will naturally fill your heart.

quote.la: nemo mortalium omnibus horis sapit.
quote.zh-TW: 沒有凡人能在所有時刻都保持智慧。
quote.en: No mortal is wise at all times.

meaning.zh-TW: 再怎麼聰明的人，也有可能會犯錯或做傻事。這句話是在安慰我們，也是在提醒我們。安慰我們，犯錯是正常的，不必太苛責自己。提醒我們，要隨時保持謙虛，不要因為自己很聰明就驕傲，因為沒有人是永遠不會錯的。
meaning.en: Even the smartest person can sometimes make mistakes or do foolish things. This quote is meant to comfort us and also to remind us. It comforts us by telling us that making mistakes is normal, so we don't need to be too hard on ourselves. It reminds us to always stay humble and not to be arrogant just because we are smart, because no one is perfect all the time.

quote.el: καλὸν γὰρ εἶναί τε ἀγαθὸν καὶ λέγεσθαι.
quote.zh-TW: 成為一個好人，並被如此稱呼，是件高尚的事。
quote.en: It is a noble thing to be a good person and to be called one.

meaning.zh-TW: 努力做一個善良、正直的好人，這本身就是一件很棒的事。而如果你的好品格，能被大家看見並且稱讚，那更是錦上添花。這句話鼓勵我們，不但要「裡子」好（真心做個好人），也要讓「面子」好（行為能得到大家的認可）。
meaning.en: Striving to be a kind, upright, and good person is in itself a wonderful thing. And if your good character can be seen and praised by others, that's even better. This quote encourages us to not only have good 'substance' (to genuinely be a good person) but also to have a good 'appearance' (to have our actions recognized by others).

name.zh-TW: 阿米阿努斯·馬爾切利努斯

quote.la: Veritas simplex oratio est.
quote.zh-TW: 真理的語言是單純的。
quote.en: The language of truth is simple.

meaning.zh-TW: 一件真實的事情，通常用最簡單、最直接的話就能說明白。反而是在說謊或掩飾的時候，才需要用很多複雜、華麗的詞語來包裝。這位歷史學家提醒我們，誠實和單純，往往是連在一起的。說真話，不需要繞圈子。
meaning.en: A true matter can usually be explained with the simplest and most direct words. On the contrary, it is when people are lying or covering something up that they need to use many complicated and fancy words to wrap their speech. This historian reminds us that honesty and simplicity often go together. When you tell the truth, you don't need to beat around the bush.

quote.zh-TW: 懷疑，是深思熟慮的開端。
quote.en: Doubt is the beginning of deliberation.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你對一件事情感到「懷疑」，覺得「奇怪，真的是這樣嗎？」的時候，恭喜你，這代表你的大腦已經開始「深度思考」了！懷疑不是壞事，它是我們發現問題、尋找真相的第一步。要勇敢地提出你的疑問！
meaning.en: When you feel 'doubtful' about something and think, 'Hmm, is that really true?', congratulations! This means your brain has started 'thinking deeply.' Doubt is not a bad thing; it is the first step we take toward discovering problems and searching for the truth. Be brave and ask your questions!

quote.el: νίκη δὲ πρώτη μὲν καὶ ἀρίστη τῶν νικῶν ἡ περὶ αὑτὸν αὑτοῦ.
quote.zh-TW: 勝利之中，第一且最偉大的勝利，是戰勝自己。
quote.en: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself.

meaning.zh-TW: 贏得比賽、考第一名，這些都很棒，但柏拉圖認為，有一種勝利比這些都更厲害，那就是「戰勝自己」。能夠克服自己的懶惰、管好自己的脾氣、戰勝自己的害怕，這才是最了不起的勝利，因為你成為了自己內心真正的主人。
meaning.en: Winning a game or getting first place are great, but Plato believed there is a victory even greater than those: 'to conquer yourself.' Being able to overcome your own laziness, control your temper, and conquer your fears—that is the most amazing victory of all, because you have become the true master of your own inner world.

quote.el: οὐ τὸ τὰ πράγματα ἀναπαριστᾶναι, ἀλλὰ τὸ τὴν ἐσωτερικὴν σημασίαν αὐτῶν.
quote.zh-TW: 藝術的目標，不是呈現事物的外觀，而是其內在的意義。
quote.en: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

meaning.zh-TW: 一幅畫不只是把風景畫得像不像而已。亞里斯多德說，藝術更重要的目的，是表達出事物內在的感覺和意義。一幅畫可以表達出「寧靜」，一首歌可以表達出「勇氣」。藝術讓我們看見事物外表之下的靈魂。
meaning.en: A painting isn't just about making the scenery look realistic. Aristotle said that the more important goal of art is to express the inner feeling and meaning of things. A painting can express 'calmness,' and a song can express 'courage.' Art allows us to see the soul that lies beneath the outward appearance of things.

quote.zh-TW: 君子恥其言而過其行。
quote.en: The superior man is ashamed if his words are better than his deeds.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個有品格的人，如果說得比做得好聽，他會覺得很不好意思。這位春秋時代的政治家提醒我們，做比說更重要。我們應該要努力讓我們做出來的事情，比我們說出口的話，還要更棒、更厲害。
meaning.en: A person of character would feel ashamed if their words sounded better than their actions. This statesman from the Spring and Autumn period reminds us that doing is more important than saying. We should strive to make the things we do even better and more impressive than the words we say.

quote.el: μία ἡμέρα τῶν ἐμφρόνων πλείω δύναται τῆς μακροτάτης τῶν ἀμαθῶν ζωῆς.
quote.zh-TW: 有學問者的一天，勝過無知者的一生。
quote.en: A single day for a learned person is more powerful than the longest life of an ignorant person.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個充滿好奇心、熱愛學習的人，他的一天可以過得非常充實和精彩，學到很多東西，感受到很多樂趣。但一個對世界毫無興趣的人，就算活得很久，生命可能也很空洞。這句話告訴我們，生命的價值不在長短，而在於它的深度和廣度。
meaning.en: A person who is full of curiosity and loves to learn can live a very full and exciting day, learning many things and experiencing much joy. But a person who has no interest in the world might live a very long but empty life. This quote tells us that the value of life is not in its length, but in its depth and breadth.

quote.zh-TW: 白日苦短，而工作繁多。
quote.en: The day is short and the work is great.

meaning.zh-TW: 時間過得很快，但世界上需要我們去做的好事、去學習的知識，卻非常非常多。這位猶太智者用這句話提醒我們，要珍惜時間，不要懶惰。因為時間有限，我們更應該抓緊時間，努力去做有意義的事。
meaning.en: Time passes quickly, but the number of good deeds we need to do and the amount of knowledge we need to learn in this world are very, very large. This Jewish sage uses this quote to remind us to cherish our time and not be lazy. Because time is limited, we should seize it and strive to do meaningful things.

quote.el: πάντων γὰρ τάχιστον νοῦς.
quote.zh-TW: 心智是所有事物中最迅速的。
quote.en: The mind is the swiftest of all things.

meaning.zh-TW: 世界上什麼東西跑得最快？不是飛機，也不是火箭，而是我們的「心智」！只要你念頭一轉，你的思想就可以立刻從地球飛到月球，再從現在回到恐龍時代。我們的思想有無限的力量，可以穿越任何時間和空間。
meaning.en: What is the fastest thing in the world? It's not an airplane or a rocket; it's our 'mind'! With just a single thought, your mind can instantly travel from Earth to the moon, and from the present day back to the age of the dinosaurs. Our minds have limitless power to travel through any time and space.

quote.el: τόν τε μηδὲν τῶνδε μετέχοντα οὐκ ἀπράγμονα, ἀλλ᾽ ἀχρεῖον νομίζομεν.
quote.zh-TW: 一個對公共事務不感興趣的人，我們不說他只顧自己，而說他一無是處。
quote.en: We do not say that a man who takes no interest in public affairs is a man who minds his own business; we say that he has no business here at all.

meaning.zh-TW: 作為團體的一份子，關心大家的事務是很重要的。這位歷史學家藉由雅典政治家伯里克利之口說，如果你只關心自己，對班上或社會上的事漠不關心，那你就沒有盡到自己做為成員的責任。關心和參與，是讓團體更好的第一步。
meaning.en: As a member of a group, it is very important to care about public affairs. This historian, speaking through the Athenian statesman Pericles, said that if you only care about yourself and are indifferent to what happens in your class or society, then you are not fulfilling your responsibility as a member. Caring and participating are the first steps to making the group better.

quote.zh-TW: 人生的至高目標，是獲取知識。
quote.en: The highest purpose of man is the acquisition of knowledge.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們活在世界上，最重要、最有價值的目標是什麼呢？這位既是醫生也是哲學家的人認為，答案就是「學習知識」。透過學習，我們能更了解自己、了解世界，也能更好地生活。把學習當成人生最重要的事，會讓生命充滿意義。
meaning.en: What is the most important and valuable goal for us in this world? This man, who was both a doctor and a philosopher, believed the answer is 'to acquire knowledge.' Through learning, we can better understand ourselves and the world, and we can also live better lives. Making learning the most important thing in your life will fill it with meaning.

quote.el: ἡ ἀρετὴ μεσότης τις, στοχαστικὴ οὖσα τοῦ μέσου.
quote.zh-TW: 美德是介於兩種惡習之間的中道，一種是過度，另一種是不足。
quote.en: Virtue is the mean between two vices, the one of excess and the other of deficiency.

meaning.zh-TW: 「勇敢」是什麼？亞里斯多德說，它是在「太超過」（魯莽）和「太不足」（膽小）之間，最剛剛好的那個點。所有好的品德都是這樣，在兩個極端之間找到最完美的平衡點。這就是「中庸之道」的智慧。
meaning.en: What is 'courage'? Aristotle said it is the perfect point right in the middle of 'too much' (recklessness) and 'not enough' (cowardice). All good virtues are like this: finding the perfect balance between two extremes. This is the wisdom of the 'golden mean.'

quote.el: τὸ δὲ μέγιστον τῶν ζημιῶν, ἐὰν αὐτὸς μὴ ἐθέλῃ ἄρχειν, ὑπὸ πονηροτέρου ἄρχεσθαι.
quote.zh-TW: 拒絕去統治的最大懲罰，就是被比自己差的人統治。
quote.en: The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你有能力，卻不願意出來為大家服務、擔任幹部，那最大的壞處是什麼？柏拉圖說，就是你可能會被一個比你差的人來管理。這句話鼓勵有能力的好人，要勇敢地承擔責任，為團體做出貢獻，這樣才能讓大家一起變得更好。
meaning.en: If you have the ability but are unwilling to step up to serve everyone and be a leader, what is the biggest penalty? Plato said it is that you might end up being governed by someone inferior to you. This quote encourages good and capable people to bravely take on responsibility and contribute to the group, so that everyone can become better together.

quote.pi: यथापि भमरो पुप्फं वण्णगन्धं अपेठयं पलेति रसमादाय एवं गामे मुनि चरे।
quote.zh-TW: 如蜂採蜜，不損花色與花香，僅取其蜜而去；聖者亦應如是遊走於村莊。
quote.en: As a bee gathers nectar and departs without harming the flower, or its color or scent, so let a sage live in a village.

meaning.zh-TW: 蜜蜂在花叢中採蜜，牠只取走自己需要的花蜜，卻不會傷害花朵的美麗和芬芳。佛陀說，我們在生活中，也應該像這隻聰明的蜜蜂一樣。從這個世界獲取我們需要的東西，但同時也要溫柔，不要去傷害或破壞這個世界。
meaning.en: When a bee collects nectar from flowers, it only takes the nectar it needs and does not harm the flower's beauty or fragrance. The Buddha said that we, in our lives, should be like this wise bee. We should take what we need from the world, but at the same time, we must be gentle and not harm or destroy it.

quote.el: Λόγος δυνάστης μέγας ἐστίν.
quote.zh-TW: 言語是強大的統治者。
quote.en: Speech is a powerful lord.

meaning.zh-TW: 語言和文字，有著非常強大的力量，就像一個國王一樣。它可以帶來安慰，也可以造成傷害；它可以啟發人心，也可以欺騙別人。這位哲學家提醒我們，要敬畏語言的力量，並且要努力學習如何負責任地使用它。
meaning.en: Language and words hold immense power, just like a king. They can bring comfort or cause harm; they can inspire people or deceive them. This philosopher reminds us to respect the power of language and to strive to learn how to use it responsibly.

quote.he: עשה לך רב, וקנה לך חבר, והוי דן את כל האדם לכף זכות.
quote.zh-TW: 為自己找一位老師，為自己交一位朋友，並善意地判斷每一個人。
quote.en: Provide for yourself a teacher, acquire for yourself a companion, and judge every person favorably.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位智者給了我們三個讓生活更美好的建議。第一，找一個能教導你的好老師。第二，交一個能陪伴你的好朋友。第三，看別人的時候，多往好的方面想，善意地對待每個人。做到這三點，你的生活會充滿智慧、溫暖與和諧。
meaning.en: This wise man gave us three pieces of advice to make life better. First, find a good teacher who can guide you. Second, make a good friend who can accompany you. Third, when you look at others, try to see their good side and treat everyone with kindness. If you do these three things, your life will be full of wisdom, warmth, and harmony.

quote.la: degeneres animos timor arguit.
quote.zh-TW: 恐懼，證明了靈魂的墮落。
quote.en: Fear is the proof of a degenerate mind.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位羅馬詩人認為，一個高貴、健康的靈魂，是不會輕易被恐懼佔據的。當我們的內心充滿了不必要的害怕和擔憂，就表示我們的靈魂可能有點「生病」了。他鼓勵我們要培養勇氣，用理性和信念來戰勝恐懼。
meaning.en: This Roman poet believed that a noble and healthy soul will not be easily overcome by fear. When our hearts are filled with unnecessary fear and worry, it might mean our soul is a bit 'sick.' He encourages us to cultivate courage and to conquer fear with reason and belief.

quote.zh-TW: 飛龍乘雲，騰蛇遊霧，雲罷霧霽，而龍蛇與螾蟻同矣。
quote.en: A flying dragon rides on the clouds and a soaring serpent roams in the mists. But when the clouds disperse and the mists clear, the dragon and the serpent are no different from an earthworm or an ant.

meaning.zh-TW: 會飛的龍，是因為有雲的幫助才能飛上天。一旦雲霧散去，牠就跟地上的小蟲沒兩樣。這位哲學家告訴我們，一個人的成功，常常不只是靠自己的能力，更是靠著他所處的「位置」和「時機」。所以，成功時要懂得感恩，也要保持謙虛。
meaning.en: A flying dragon can soar in the sky only with the help of the clouds. Once the clouds and mists are gone, it is no different from a small worm on the ground. This philosopher tells us that a person's success often depends not just on their own ability, but also on their 'position' and 'timing.' Therefore, when you are successful, you should be grateful and stay humble.

quote.fa: دانش سپر است و حکمت قلعه
quote.zh-TW: 知識是盾牌，智慧是堡壘。
quote.en: Knowledge is a shield and wisdom is a fortress.

meaning.zh-TW: 面對生活中的困難和挑戰，我們要怎麼保護自己呢？這位詩人哲學家說，我們有兩樣最好的武器。第一樣是「知識」，它像一面盾牌，能幫我們擋掉危險。第二樣是「智慧」，它像一座堅固的城堡，能讓我們的心靈安全又平靜。
meaning.en: How can we protect ourselves when facing difficulties and challenges in life? This poet-philosopher said we have two of the best weapons. The first is 'knowledge,' which is like a shield that can help us block danger. The second is 'wisdom,' which is like a strong fortress that can keep our minds safe and peaceful.

quote.el: φύσις κρύπτεσθαι φιλεῖ.
quote.zh-TW: 自然，熱愛隱藏。
quote.en: Nature loves to hide.

meaning.zh-TW: 世界上很多最美、最奇妙的道理，都不是擺在明面上的。它們就像害羞的小動物，喜歡把自己藏起來。這位哲學家鼓勵我們，要像個探險家一樣，抱持著好奇心，去探索、去發掘，才能發現大自然和生命中，那些隱藏起來的祕密與驚喜。
meaning.en: Many of the most beautiful and wonderful truths in the world are not laid out in plain sight. They are like shy little animals that love to hide. This philosopher encourages us to be like explorers, to maintain our curiosity, and to seek and discover, so that we can find the hidden secrets and surprises in nature and in life.

quote.el: τὸ δ' ἐφ' ᾧ δεῖ καὶ ὅσοις καὶ ὅτε καὶ οὗ ἕνεκα καὶ ὥς, οὐκέτι παντὸς οὐδὲ ῥᾴδιον.
quote.zh-TW: 對該生氣的人，在該生氣的場合，以該有的程度，為了該有的目的，用該有的方式去生氣，這並非人人都能做到，也非易事。
quote.en: To be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way — that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.

meaning.zh-TW: 生氣很簡單，但「好好地生氣」卻是一門大學問！亞里斯多德說，要在對的時間、對的地點，對著對的人，用剛剛好的程度去生氣，這非常困難。這是在教我們學習「情緒管理」，要理智地表達自己的情緒，而不是被情緒控制。
meaning.en: Getting angry is easy, but getting angry 'in the right way' is a great skill! Aristotle said that being angry at the right time, in the right place, with the right person, and to just the right degree is very difficult. This teaches us about 'emotional management'—that we should express our emotions rationally, instead of being controlled by them.

quote.el: οὐδὲν γὰρ ἄλλο ἔχουσα εἰς Ἅιδου ἡ ψυχὴ ἔρχεται πλὴν τῆς παιδείας τε καὶ τροφῆς.
quote.zh-TW: 人的靈魂去到另一個世界時，除了自身的教育與修養，什麼也帶不走。
quote.en: The soul takes nothing with it to the next world but its education and culture.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果我們要去一個很遠的地方旅行，只能帶一件行李，該帶什麼呢？柏拉圖認為，我們能帶走的，不是玩具或財富，而是我們所受的「教育」和「品德修養」。你學到的知識、你善良的品格，是永遠屬於你的，誰也拿不走的真正寶藏。
meaning.en: If we were going on a long journey and could only bring one piece of luggage, what should we bring? Plato believed that what we can truly take with us is not our toys or wealth, but our 'education' and 'character.' The knowledge you have learned and the good character you have built are treasures that belong to you forever and can never be taken away.

quote.la: Inter initia amicitiae est, ut et intellegere et intellegi velis.
quote.zh-TW: 真摯友誼最美的特質之一，是去理解與被理解。
quote.en: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.

meaning.zh-TW: 好朋友之間最棒的感覺是什麼？這位哲學家說，是「互相了解」。你不只努力去了解朋友心裡在想什麼，你也會感覺到，朋友也同樣努力地在了解你。這種心意相通的感覺，是友誼中最溫暖、最美好的部分。
meaning.en: What is the best feeling between good friends? This philosopher said it is 'mutual understanding.' Not only do you try hard to understand what your friend is thinking, but you also feel that your friend is trying just as hard to understand you. This feeling of being on the same wavelength is the warmest and most beautiful part of friendship.

quote.zh-TW: 我只教導那些為了解脫痛苦所必需之事，而非僅為滿足好奇之事。
quote.en: I teach only what is necessary for liberation from suffering, not what is merely for curiosity.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果有人被毒箭射中了，最緊急的事是馬上把箭拔出來治療，而不是先去研究箭是誰射的、用什麼木頭做的。佛陀用這個比喻告訴我們，要專注在解決人生最根本的「痛苦」問題上，不要把時間浪費在無關緊要的好奇問題上。要抓住重點！
meaning.en: If someone is shot by a poisoned arrow, the most urgent thing is to pull the arrow out and treat the wound immediately, not to first investigate who shot it or what kind of wood it's made from. The Buddha used this parable to teach us to focus on solving the fundamental problem of 'suffering' in life, and not to waste time on unimportant, curious questions. We must focus on what's important!

quote.el: Μὴ ἀρκεσθῇς τῷ μαθεῖν μόνον, ἀλλὰ καὶ μελέτην καὶ ἄσκησιν πρόσθες.
quote.zh-TW: 不要只滿足於理解，要加上練習與實踐。
quote.en: Do not be satisfied with just understanding; add to it practice and application.

meaning.zh-TW: 光是聽懂老師上課的內容，還不夠喔！這位斯多噶老師說，你還得加上「練習」和「實踐」。就像學游泳，光是看懂游泳教學影片是不會讓你學會的，你必須跳下水，親自去練習。把懂的道理實際做出來，它才會變成你的超能力。
meaning.en: Just understanding what the teacher says in class is not enough! This Stoic teacher said you must also add 'practice' and 'application.' It's like learning to swim: just watching instructional videos won't teach you how. You have to jump into the water and practice yourself. When you actually do what you understand, it will become your superpower.

quote.ar: غاية الفلسفة هي تهذيب النفس الإنسانية.
quote.zh-TW: 哲學的目標，是完善人的靈魂。
quote.en: The goal of philosophy is to perfect the human soul.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們為什麼要學習哲學、要思考呢？這位在阿拉伯世界很有影響力的基督徒哲學家說，哲學的最終目的，就是讓我們的靈魂、我們的內心，變得更完美。透過思考，我們可以成為更善良、更有智慧、更完整的人。
meaning.en: Why should we study philosophy and think? This influential Christian philosopher in the Arab world said that the ultimate purpose of philosophy is to make our souls, our inner selves, more perfect. Through thinking, we can become kinder, wiser, and more complete human beings.

quote.zh-TW: 明主之視，如鏡之照，無所私匿。
quote.en: The sight of an enlightened ruler is like the reflection of a mirror; it hides nothing personal.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個好的領導者，他的心應該像一面鏡子。鏡子只會誠實地反映出照到的東西，不會自己加上顏色，也不會偏心。這位法家思想家告訴我們，做判斷的時候，要盡量客觀、公正，不被自己的喜好影響，這樣才能看清事實。
meaning.en: The mind of a good leader should be like a mirror. A mirror only honestly reflects what is in front of it; it doesn't add its own colors or have favorites. This Legalist thinker tells us that when we make judgments, we should try to be as objective and fair as possible, and not be influenced by our own preferences. This is the only way to see the truth clearly.

quote.el: Ἐάν τίς σοι ἀπαγγείλῃ, ὅτι ὁ δεῖνά σε κακῶς λέγει, μὴ ἀπολογοῦ πρὸς τὰ λεχθέντα, ἀλλὰ ἀποκρίνου, ὅτι Ἠγνόει γὰρ τὰ ἄλλα τὰ προσόντα μοι κακά, ἐπεὶ οὐκ ἂν ταῦτα μόνα ἔλεγεν.
quote.zh-TW: 如果有人告訴你某人說你壞話，不要為那些話辯解，而是回答：『他想必是不知道我其他的缺點，否則他不會只提這幾個。』
quote.en: If anyone tells you that a certain person speaks ill of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you but answer, 'He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone.'

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個充滿智慧和幽默的建議！當別人批評你的時候，不要急著生氣或辯解。這位斯多噶哲學家教我們，可以開玩笑地想：「他只說對了這一點，還沒發現我其他的缺點呢！」這種想法能幫助我們保持內心平靜，用更輕鬆的態度面對批評，甚至還能提醒自己要保持謙虛。
meaning.en: This is a piece of advice full of wisdom and humor! When someone criticizes you, don't rush to get angry or make excuses. This Stoic philosopher teaches us that we can playfully think, 'He only got this one thing right; he hasn't even discovered my other flaws yet!' This way of thinking can help us maintain inner peace, face criticism with a lighter attitude, and even remind ourselves to stay humble.

quote.el: ἀγαθὸς ἦν, ἀγαθῷ δὲ οὐδεὶς περὶ οὐδενὸς οὐδέποτε ἐγγίγνεται φθόνος.
quote.zh-TW: 祂是善的，而善者對任何事物，永不懷有任何嫉妒。
quote.en: He was good, and the good can never have any jealousy of anything.

meaning.zh-TW: 柏拉圖在思考宇宙是怎麼來的時候，他認為，創造宇宙的神一定是個完美的「善」。而一個真正善良的存在，是不會嫉妒任何人的。因為祂擁有一切，所以祂只會想要分享、想要創造。這提醒我們，嫉妒來自於匱乏感，而真正的善良，來自於豐盛與分享的心。
meaning.en: When Plato was thinking about how the universe came to be, he believed that the God who created it must be a perfect 'Good.' And a truly good being would never be jealous of anyone. Because He has everything, He only wants to share and to create. This reminds us that jealousy comes from a feeling of lack, while true goodness comes from a heart of abundance and sharing.

quote.zh-TW: 大方無隅。
quote.en: The great square has no corners.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話是一個很美的謎語。想像一個巨大無比、大到沒有邊際的正方形，你看得到它的角落嗎？看不到了。老子用這個比喻告訴我們，最完美的、最偉大的東西，往往是沒有固定形狀、沒有限制的。它包容一切，無法被定義。
meaning.en: This quote is a beautiful riddle. Imagine a square that is so huge, so boundless, that it has no edges. Can you see its corners? No, you can't. Laozi used this metaphor to tell us that the most perfect and greatest things often have no fixed shape and no limits. They embrace everything and cannot be defined.

quote.el: τελειοῖ δὲ τὴν ἐνέργειαν ἡ ἡδονὴ ... οἷον τοῖς ἀκμαίοις ἡ ὥρα.
quote.zh-TW: 快樂使活動圓滿……就像青春之美在年華正好之時。
quote.en: Pleasure completes the activity... like the bloom of youth on those in their prime.

meaning.zh-TW: 快樂不是一件獨立的事情，它是我們在做好一件事時，自然產生的美好感覺。亞里斯多德形容，它就像年輕人臉上自然煥發的光彩一樣。當你全心投入做一件你喜歡又擅長的事，那種隨之而來的快樂，就是對你努力的最好獎賞。
meaning.en: Happiness isn't a separate thing; it's the wonderful feeling that naturally arises when we are doing something well. Aristotle described it as being like the natural glow on the face of a young person. When you are fully engaged in doing something you love and are good at, the pleasure that comes with it is the best reward for your efforts.

quote.zh-TW: 滄浪之水清兮，可以濯我纓；滄浪之水濁兮，可以濯我足。
quote.en: When the waters of the Canglang are clear, I can wash my hat strings; when the waters of the Canglang are muddy, I can wash my feet.

meaning.zh-TW: 這段話的意思是，當大環境很好、很清明的時候，我們可以出來一展抱負。但如果環境變得混亂、不好的時候，我們也可以退回來，潔身自好。它教導我們一種生活的智慧：要懂得適應環境，無論在順境還是逆境，都能找到自處的方式。
meaning.en: This passage means that when the general environment is good and clear, we can go out and realize our ambitions. But if the environment becomes chaotic and bad, we can also retreat and maintain our own integrity.
