It teaches us a form of life wisdom: we must learn to adapt to our surroundings and find a way to conduct ourselves well, whether in good times or in bad.

quote.el: Αὐτὸς γὰρ ἐνηνθρώπησεν, ἵνα ἡμεῖς θεοποιηθῶμεν.
quote.zh-TW: 祂成為人，是為讓我們能成為神。
quote.en: He became man so that we might become God.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話是基督教一個很核心、很美的思想。它的意思是，神以耶穌的形象來到世界上，變成人的樣子，是為了做一個榜樣，讓我們學習如何活出神聖、善良、充滿愛的生命。祂拉近了和我們的距離，是為了讓我們能更靠近祂的美好。
meaning.en: This is a very core and beautiful idea in Christianity. It means that God came to the world in the form of Jesus, becoming a man, in order to set an example and teach us how to live a divine, good, and loving life. He closed the distance between Himself and us so that we could get closer to His goodness.

quote.el: Παιδιὰν γὰρ δεῖ ζῆν.
quote.zh-TW: 人生必須活得像一場遊戲。
quote.en: Life must be lived as play.

meaning.zh-TW: 柏拉圖這位嚴肅的哲學家，竟然說人生要像玩遊戲一樣！他的意思是，我們應該用一種輕鬆、投入、享受過程的態度來面對人生。就像玩遊戲一樣，有挑戰、有規則，但最重要的是在其中找到樂趣，而不是只在乎輸贏。用玩樂的心，過好每一天！
meaning.en: It's surprising that Plato, a serious philosopher, said life should be lived like a game! What he meant is that we should face life with a relaxed, engaged, and process-oriented attitude. Just like in a game, there are challenges and rules, but the most important thing is to find joy in it, not just to care about winning or losing. Live every day with a playful heart!

quote.la: Animum debes mutare, non caelum.
quote.zh-TW: 你該改變的是心境，而非天空。
quote.en: You must change your mind, not the sky.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你覺得不快樂，換一個新環境、去旅行，真的能解決問題嗎？這位哲學家認為，問題的根源在我們的心裡。如果我們的心情沒有改變，那就算換到再美的天空下，煩惱還是會跟著你。所以，真正的旅行，是內心的改變與成長。
meaning.en: If you feel unhappy, can changing your environment or going on a trip really solve the problem? This philosopher believed that the root of the problem lies within our minds. If our mood doesn't change, then even under the most beautiful sky, our worries will still follow us. Therefore, the real journey is the change and growth within our own minds.

quote.el: ὁ πλοῦτος οὐκ ἐν κτήμασιν, ἀλλ᾽ ἐν τῷ ὀλίγων δεῖσθαι.
quote.zh-TW: 財富不在於擁有許多，而在於需求很少。
quote.en: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話和我們平常想的很不一樣！它說，真正的有錢，不是你擁有多少東西，而是你「想要」的東西很少。當你不一直想著要買新東西，對自己已經擁有的感到很滿足時，你的心就是最富有的，不會感到匱乏，這就是心靈的財富。
meaning.en: This idea is very different from how we usually think! It says that true wealth is not about how many things you own, but about how few things you 'want.' When you stop constantly thinking about buying new things and feel content with what you already have, your heart is the richest of all, and you won't feel a sense of lack. This is spiritual wealth.

quote.el: Πόλεμος πάντων μὲν πατήρ ἐστι, πάντων δὲ βασιλεύς.
quote.zh-TW: 戰爭是萬物之父，也是萬物之王。
quote.en: War is the father of all and king of all.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來有點嚇人，但這位哲學家不是在讚美戰爭。他的意思是，世界上所有事物的產生和改變，都來自於「衝突」和「對立」。就像正電和負電碰撞會產生火花一樣。困難和挑戰，雖然看起來像戰爭，卻是推動我們進步和改變的最大力量。
meaning.en: This quote sounds a bit scary, but this philosopher was not praising war. What he meant is that the creation and change of all things in the world come from 'conflict' and 'opposition.' It's like how positive and negative electricity collide to create a spark. Difficulties and challenges, although they may seem like a war, are the greatest forces that push us to progress and change.

quote.el: ἡ ψυχὴ ἀρχὴ τῶν ζῴων.
quote.zh-TW: 靈魂是生命的本原。
quote.en: The soul is the first principle of life.

meaning.zh-TW: 是什麼讓我們活著，讓我們能思考、能感受呢？亞里斯多德認為，答案是「靈魂」。他覺得靈魂就像是我們身體的「驅動程式」，是它讓我們的身體動起來，是一切生命的起點。所以，照顧好我們的內心和靈魂，就是照顧好生命的根本。
meaning.en: What is it that makes us alive, allows us to think and to feel? Aristotle believed the answer is the 'soul.' He felt that the soul is like the 'driver' for our body; it's what makes our body move and is the starting point of all life. Therefore, taking care of our inner heart and soul is taking care of the very foundation of life.

quote.el: ἄνευ γὰρ φίλων οὐδεὶs ἕλοιτ' ἂν ζῆν, ἔχων τὰ λοιπὰ ἀγαθὰ πάντα.
quote.zh-TW: 因為沒有朋友，沒有人會選擇活下去，即使他擁有一切其他美好的事物。
quote.en: Without friends, no one would choose to live, though he had all other goods.

meaning.zh-TW: 想像一下，就算你擁有了世界上所有的玩具和糖果，但卻沒有半個朋友可以跟你分享，你會快樂嗎？亞里斯多德認為，朋友是我們生命中最不可或缺的寶藏。友誼帶來的溫暖和快樂，是任何其他東西都無法取代的。
meaning.en: Imagine if you had all the toys and candy in the world, but not a single friend to share them with. Would you be happy? Aristotle believed that friends are the most essential treasure in our lives. The warmth and joy that friendship brings cannot be replaced by anything else.

quote.pi: अक्कोधेन जिने कोधं, असाधुं साधुना जिने। जिने कदरियं दानेन, सच्चेन अलिकवादिनं॥
quote.zh-TW: 以不怒勝怒，以善勝惡；以布施勝吝嗇，以真實勝虛妄。
quote.en: Conquer anger with non-anger; conquer evil with good; conquer the stingy with a gift; conquer the liar with truth.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話教了我們戰勝壞東西的四個神奇法寶。要戰勝別人的「憤怒」，你就要用「不生氣」來回應。要戰勝「邪惡」，你就要用「善良」來面對。要戰勝「小氣」，你就要用「分享」。要戰勝「謊言」，你就要用「誠實」。用好的力量，才能真正地化解不好的力量。
meaning.en: This quote teaches us four magical tools to overcome bad things. To conquer someone's 'anger,' you must respond with 'non-anger.' To conquer 'evil,' you must face it with 'goodness.' To conquer 'stinginess,' you must use 'giving.' And to conquer 'lies,' you must use 'truth.' Only by using good forces can you truly dissolve negative forces.

quote.he: אם אין אני לי, מי לי? וכשאני לעצמי, מה אני? ואם לא עכשיו, אימתי?
quote.zh-TW: 如果我不為自己，誰會為我？但如果我只為自己，那我又是什麼？倘若不是現在，更待何時？
quote.en: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? But if I am only for myself, what am I? And if not now, when?

meaning.zh-TW: 這位智者連續問了三個很棒的問題。第一，我們要先照顧好自己。第二，但不能只想到自己，也要關心別人。第三，想做對的事，不要等，現在就去做！這提醒我們要找到「愛自己」和「愛別人」的平衡，並且要把握當下，馬上行動。
meaning.en: This wise man asked three great questions in a row. First, we must take care of ourselves. Second, we cannot only think of ourselves; we must also care for others. Third, if you want to do the right thing, don't wait—do it now! This reminds us to find a balance between 'loving ourselves' and 'loving others,' and to seize the moment and take action right away.

quote.zh-TW: 善行無轍迹。
quote.en: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個最厲害的旅行家，他走路不會留下痕跡。這句話的意思是，一個真正懂得生活的人，他做事不會死板板地照計畫走。他會保持彈性，享受過程中的每一個風景和意外。人生的重點是「旅程」本身，而不只是「到達目的地」。
meaning.en: The best traveler leaves no tracks. This means that a person who truly knows how to live doesn't rigidly stick to a plan. They stay flexible and enjoy every scene and surprise along the way. The point of life is the 'journey' itself, not just 'reaching the destination.'

quote.la: Perfer et obdura; dolor hic tibi proderit olim.
quote.zh-TW: 要忍耐並堅持下去，這份痛苦有朝一日將對你有益。
quote.en: Be patient and tough; this pain will serve you one day.

meaning.zh-TW: 練習樂器、學習新科目，有時候會覺得很辛苦、很痛苦。但這位羅馬詩人鼓勵我們，要堅持下去！現在經歷的這些辛苦，就像在為你的未來儲存能量。總有一天，你會發現，這些曾經的痛苦，都變成了讓你更強壯、更厲害的養分。
meaning.en: Practicing an instrument or learning a new subject can sometimes feel very hard and painful. But this Roman poet encourages us to persevere! The hardship you are going through now is like storing up energy for your future. One day, you will discover that all this past pain has turned into nourishment that makes you stronger and more capable.

quote.el: τὸ γὰρ φοβεῖσθαι τὸν θάνατον οὐδὲν ἄλλο ἐστὶν ἢ δοκεῖν σοφὸν εἶναι μὴ ὄντα.
quote.zh-TW: 害怕死亡，不過就是自以為知道自己其實並不知道的事。
quote.en: To fear death is nothing other than to think oneself wise when one is not.

meaning.zh-TW: 沒有人真正知道死後會發生什麼事，對吧？柏拉圖（藉由蘇格拉底的口）說，既然我們對死亡一無所知，那又有什麼好害怕的呢？害怕一件我們根本不知道是好是壞的事，就像是假裝自己很有智慧一樣。對於未知的事，我們應該保持謙虛和開放的心。
meaning.en: No one really knows what happens after death, right? Plato (speaking through Socrates) said that since we know nothing about death, what is there to be afraid of? Being afraid of something when we don't even know if it's good or bad is like pretending to be wise when we're not. We should maintain a humble and open mind about things we do not know.

quote.el: ἐφ' ἑκάστου τῶν προσπιπτόντων μέμνησο ἐπιστρεφόμενος ἐπὶ σεαυτὸν ζητεῖν, τίνα δύναμιν ἔχεις πρὸς τὴν χρῆσιν αὐτοῦ.
quote.zh-TW: 每當意外發生時，要記得反觀自身，探尋你有何種力量能善加利用此一情境。
quote.en: On the occasion of every accident that befalls you, remember to turn to yourself and inquire what power you have for turning it to use.

meaning.zh-TW: 當不好的事情發生時，例如你不小心打翻了牛奶，先不要慌張。這位斯多噶老師教我們，要馬上問自己：「我現在有什麼能力可以把這件事變好？」你可以選擇哭鬧，但你更有能力去拿抹布把它擦乾淨。專注於你能做的事，而不是問題本身。
meaning.en: When something bad happens, like you accidentally spill your milk, don't panic first. This Stoic teacher taught us to immediately ask ourselves, 'What power do I have right now to make this situation better?' You could choose to cry, but you have an even greater power to get a cloth and clean it up. Focus on what you can do, not on the problem itself.

quote.ar: ما كل ما يتمنى المرء يدركه تجري الرياح بما لا تشتهي السفن
quote.zh-TW: 人無法實現所有願望，正如風不總順著船帆的方向吹。
quote.en: Not all that a man desires can he attain; the winds do not always blow as the ships wish.

meaning.zh-TW: 帆船出海，總希望一路順風，但風不一定會聽話。人生也是一樣，我們沒辦法得到所有想要的東西。這位阿拉伯詩人提醒我們，要學會接受，事情不總會照著我們的計畫走。學會適應風向，也是一種智慧。
meaning.en: When a sailboat goes out to sea, it always hopes for a favorable wind, but the wind doesn't always listen. Life is the same way; we can't always get everything we want. This Arab poet reminds us that we must learn to accept that things don't always go according to our plans. Learning to adjust to the direction of the wind is also a form of wisdom.

quote.zh-TW: 何害？人之愛憎，豈能盡如我意？譽之不喜，毀之不怒，亦君子也。
quote.en: What harm is there? How can we expect everyone to like and dislike the same things as we do? The people's voices are a good medicine.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位春秋時代的政治家，不禁止人民批評他。他說，大家的批評就像是治病的良藥，可以幫助我發現自己的錯誤。這句話教導我們，要用開放的胸襟去聽取不同的意見，即使是批評的聲音，也能幫助我們成長。
meaning.en: This statesman from the Spring and Autumn period did not forbid people from criticizing him. He said that everyone's criticism is like good medicine that can help him find his own mistakes. This quote teaches us to listen to different opinions with an open mind. Even critical voices can help us grow.

quote.la: Fundamentum autem est iustitiae fides.
quote.zh-TW: 正義的基礎是信實。
quote.en: The foundation of justice is good faith.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼是「正義」和「公平」最重要的基礎呢？這位哲學家認為是「信用」和「誠實」。只有當人與人之間能夠互相信任，說話算話，不做欺騙的事，一個公平的社會才有可能建立起來。信用，是一切的基石。
meaning.en: What is the most important foundation for 'justice' and 'fairness'? This philosopher believed it is 'good faith' and 'honesty.' Only when people can trust each other, keep their promises, and not deceive one another can a fair society be built. Good faith is the cornerstone of everything.

quote.el: Πρῶτον μάθε, τίνα ἐστὶν ἃ λέγεις, εἶτα οὕτως εἰπέ.
quote.zh-TW: 首先，學會你所說之事的意義，然後再說。
quote.en: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.

meaning.zh-TW: 在你開口說話之前，要先確定自己是不是真的了解你要說的內容。這位老師提醒我們，不要人云亦云，或者說一些自己也搞不懂的話。先學習、先思考，讓自己成為一個真正了解自己話語重量的人，這是一種責任。
meaning.en: Before you open your mouth to speak, first make sure you truly understand the meaning of what you are about to say. This teacher reminds us not to just repeat what others say or to say things we don't understand ourselves. Learn first, think first, and become someone who truly understands the weight of their own words. This is a responsibility.

quote.el: τὸ μὲν γὰρ λέγειν τὸ ὂν μὴ εἶναι ἢ τὸ μὴ ὂν εἶναι ψεῦδος, τὸ δὲ τὸ ὂν εἶναι καὶ τὸ μὴ ὂν μὴ εἶναι ἀληθές.
quote.zh-TW: 說「是」為「非」，或說「非」為「是」，是假的；說「是」為「是」，說「非」為「非」，是真的。
quote.en: To say of what is that it is not, or of what is not that it is, is false, while to say of what is that it is, and of what is not that it is not, is true.

meaning.zh-TW: 「真相」是什麼？亞里斯多德給了我們一個最根本的定義。他說，如果一件事情「是」這樣，你就說它「是」這樣，那這就是真話。如果一件事情「不是」這樣，你就說它「不是」這樣，這也是真話。誠實地反映事實，就是通往真理最簡單的路。
meaning.en: What is 'truth'? Aristotle gave us the most fundamental definition. He said that if something 'is' a certain way, and you say that it 'is' that way, then that is the truth. If something 'is not' a certain way, and you say that it 'is not' that way, that is also the truth. Honestly reflecting reality is the simplest path to truth.

quote.zh-TW: 五色令人目盲；五音令人耳聾；五味令人口爽。
quote.en: The five colors blind the eye. The five tones deafen the ear. The five flavors dull the taste.

meaning.zh-TW: 太過鮮豔的顏色，會讓我們的眼睛看不清。太過嘈雜的聲音，會讓我們的耳朵聽不見。太過刺激的味道，會讓我們的舌頭失去味覺。老子提醒我們，過多的感官刺激，反而會麻痺我們的感受能力。簡單、樸素的生活，才能讓我們保持敏銳，體會到事物真正的美好。
meaning.en: Too many dazzling colors will make our eyes unable to see clearly. Too much loud noise will make our ears unable to hear properly. Too many strong flavors will make our tongue lose its sense of taste. Laozi reminds us that too much sensory stimulation will actually numb our ability to feel. A simple and plain life is what allows us to stay sharp and appreciate the true beauty of things.

quote.el: οἱ ὀρθῶς φιλοσοφοῦντες ἀποθνῄσκειν μελετῶσι.
quote.zh-TW: 真正的哲學家，一生都在練習死亡。
quote.en: True philosophers are always studying death.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來很嚴肅，但柏拉圖不是要我們害怕。他的意思是，學習哲學，就是學習如何好好地死去。當我們常常思考生命的意義、什麼是真正重要的事，我們就比較不會害怕失去。這種練習，其實是在教我們如何「好好地活著」，珍惜每一天。
meaning.en: This quote sounds very serious, but Plato didn't mean for us to be scared. He meant that studying philosophy is learning how to die well. When we constantly think about the meaning of life and what is truly important, we become less afraid of loss. This practice is actually teaching us how to 'live well' and to cherish every day.

quote.zh-TW: 應如犀牛，獨自遊行。
quote.en: One should wander alone like a rhinoceros.

meaning.zh-TW: 有時候，我們需要像強壯的犀牛一樣，享受一個人獨處的時光。這不是說不要朋友，而是說我們要培養獨立思考的能力。在安靜的獨處中，我們能更清楚地聽見自己內心的聲音，不被外界的嘈雜所影響，找到自己真正的方向。
meaning.en: Sometimes, we need to be like a strong rhinoceros and enjoy our time alone. This doesn't mean we shouldn't have friends; it means we need to develop the ability to think independently. In quiet solitude, we can hear our own inner voice more clearly, without being influenced by the noise of the outside world, and find our true direction.

quote.zh-TW: 沉默是智慧的圍籬。
quote.en: A fence for wisdom is silence.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們要怎麼保護自己腦中的智慧，不讓它隨便跑掉呢？這位智者說，最好的方法，就是蓋一道「沉默」的圍牆。這不是說都不要說話，而是要學會「慎言」，不說沒有意義的話，也不輕易炫耀。在開口前先思考，能讓你的智慧更安全、更有價值。
meaning.en: How can we protect the wisdom in our minds and keep it from running away? This wise man said the best way is to build a fence of 'silence.' This doesn't mean you should never talk, but that you should learn to 'speak prudently'—don't say meaningless things and don't show off casually. Thinking before you speak makes your wisdom safer and more valuable.

quote.el: οὔτε ἀνταδικεῖν δεῖ οὔτε κακῶς ποιεῖν οὐδένα ἀνθρώπων, οὐδ' ἂν ὁτιοῦν πάσχῃ ὑπ' αὐτῶν.
quote.zh-TW: 人絕不應報復，亦不應傷害任何人，無論曾受過對方何等的傷害。
quote.en: One should never do wrong in return, nor mistreat any man, no matter how one has been mistreated by him.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是來自蘇格拉底在監獄中的教導。他說，就算別人對我們做了再壞的事，我們也絕對不能用同樣壞的方式去報復。因為做壞事本身，就會傷害我們自己的靈魂。保持善良，比「討回公道」更重要。
meaning.en: This is a teaching from Socrates while he was in prison. He said that no matter how badly others have treated us, we must never retaliate in the same bad way. This is because doing wrong itself harms our own souls. Maintaining our own goodness is more important than 'getting even.'

quote.el: Μὴ ζήτει τὰ γινόμενα γίνεσθαι ὡς θέλεις, ἀλλὰ θέλε τὰ γινόμενα γίνεσθαι ὡς γίνεται, καὶ εὐροήσεις.
quote.zh-TW: 莫強求事如己願，但願事如其本然，則汝將順遂。
quote.en: Do not seek for things to happen the way you want them to; rather, wish for things to happen the way they do happen, and your life will go smoothly.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們沒辦法控制所有事情都照我們的希望發生，對吧？這位斯多噶大師說，與其這樣，不如反過來，真心希望事情就照它本來的樣子發生。學會接受現實，順應自然的流動，你的心就不會常常失望，生活也就能過得更平順安寧。
meaning.en: We can't control everything to make it happen exactly as we wish, right? This Stoic master said that instead of trying to do that, we should do the opposite: sincerely wish for things to happen just as they do. When you learn to accept reality and flow with the course of nature, your heart won't be constantly disappointed, and your life will be much smoother and more peaceful.

quote.zh-TW: 信言不美，美言不信。
quote.en: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful.

meaning.zh-TW: 說真話，有時候可能不太好聽。而那些說得天花亂墜、非常動聽的話，反而常常不是真話。老子提醒我們，要懂得分辨，不要被華麗的言詞迷惑。真誠的話語，往往是樸實無華的。
meaning.en: Telling the truth can sometimes be unpleasant to hear. And words that are flowery and sound very beautiful are often not the truth. Laozi reminds us to learn to tell the difference and not to be fooled by fancy language. Sincere words are often simple and unadorned.

quote.el: Ἄρχεσθαι μαθὼν ἄρχειν ἐπιστήσει.
quote.zh-TW: 學會服從，你才知道如何統御。
quote.en: Learn to obey, and you will know how to command.

meaning.zh-TW: 在學會如何當一個好的領導者之前，要先學會如何當一個好的被領導者。這位雅典的立法者告訴我們，只有親身體會過服從的滋味，了解團隊合作的重要，你未來才能成為一個懂得體恤別人、受人尊敬的領導。
meaning.en: Before you can learn how to be a good leader, you must first learn how to be a good follower. This Athenian lawmaker tells us that only by personally experiencing what it's like to obey and understanding the importance of teamwork can you become a compassionate and respected leader in the future.

quote.el: περὶ ἡδονὰς γὰρ καὶ λύπας ἐστὶν ἡ ἀρετή.
quote.zh-TW: 美德，是關乎在正確的事物上感受快樂與痛苦。
quote.en: Virtue is concerned with feeling pleasure and pain at the right things.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個有品德的人，是怎麼樣的呢？亞里斯多德說，他會因為「做了對的事」而感到快樂，會因為「做了壞的事」而感到難過。你的情感，就像一個指南針。如果你能為善行感到快樂，為惡行感到痛苦，那你的品德指南針就指對了方向。
meaning.en: What is a virtuous person like? Aristotle said that they are someone who feels happy for 'doing the right thing' and feels pain for 'doing the wrong thing.' Your emotions are like a compass. If you can feel joy for good deeds and pain for bad deeds, then your moral compass is pointing in the right direction.

quote.ar: الشَّهْوَةُ تَجْعَلُ الْمُلُوكَ عَبِيدًا، وَالصَّبْرُ يَجْعَلُ الْعَبِيدَ مُلُوكًا.
quote.zh-TW: 慾望使國王淪為奴隸，耐心使奴隸成為國王。
quote.en: Desire makes slaves out of kings, and patience makes kings out of slaves.

meaning.zh-TW: 慾望就像一個壞主人，如果你被它控制，就算你是國王，也會變成它的奴隸。相反地，「耐心」和「自制力」卻像一種神奇的力量，就算你現在的處境不好，只要你擁有它，它就能讓你成為自己內心真正的主人，就像國王一樣尊貴。
meaning.en: Desire is like a bad master. If you are controlled by it, even if you are a king, you will become its slave. On the other hand, 'patience' and 'self-control' are like a magical power. Even if your situation is not good right now, as long as you have them, they can make you the true master of your own heart, as noble as a king.

quote.la: Nullum magnum ingenium sine mixtura dementiae fuit.
quote.zh-TW: 沒有哪個偉大的天才，能不帶有一絲瘋狂。
quote.en: There has been no great genius without a touch of madness.

meaning.zh-TW: 那些最有創造力、最與眾不同的人，他們的想法常常看起來有點「瘋狂」。這句話不是說瘋狂是壞事，而是說，偉大的創意和突破，往往來自於敢於跳出常規、用不一樣的方式去思考。所以，不要害怕自己的想法有點怪，那可能正是你天才的火花！
meaning.en: The ideas of the most creative and unique people often seem a little 'mad.' This quote doesn't mean that madness is a bad thing. It means that great creativity and breakthroughs often come from daring to think outside the box and in a different way. So, don't be afraid if your ideas are a bit strange; that might just be the spark of your genius!

quote.he: במקום שאין אנשים, השתדל להיות איש.
quote.zh-TW: 在沒有人挺身而出之處，要努力成為那個人。
quote.en: In a place where there are no men, strive to be a man.

meaning.zh-TW: 當有事情需要有人去做，卻沒有任何人站出來的時候，你該怎麼辦？這位智者說：「努力讓自己成為那個挺身而出的人！」這句話鼓勵我們，在需要的時候，要勇敢地承擔責任、發揮領導力，不要等著別人來做。
meaning.en: When something needs to be done, but no one is stepping up, what should you do? This wise man said, 'Strive to be the one who steps up!' This quote encourages us to bravely take responsibility and show leadership when it is needed, instead of waiting for someone else to do it.

quote.el: τὰ γὰρ πρήγματα τῶν ἀνθρώπων ἄρχει, ἀλλ᾽ οὐκ οἱ ἄνθρωποι τῶν πρηγμάτων.
quote.zh-TW: 是環境支配人，而非人支配環境。
quote.en: Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們常常覺得自己可以控制一切，但這位「歷史之父」提醒我們，很多時候，是我們無法控制的「大環境」在決定事情的走向。這不是要我們放棄努力，而是要我們學會謙虛，明白自己的渺小，並且在順應大勢的同時，盡自己最大的努力。
meaning.en: We often feel like we can control everything, but this 'Father of History' reminds us that, in many cases, it is the 'greater circumstances' beyond our control that determine the course of events. This is not to say we should give up trying, but that we should learn to be humble, understand our own smallness, and do our best while adapting to the larger flow of events.

quote.zh-TW: 一年之計，莫如樹穀；十年之計，莫如樹木；終身之計，莫如樹人。
quote.en: For a one-year plan, there is nothing better than planting grain. For a ten-year plan, there is nothing better than planting trees. For a lifelong plan, there is nothing better than educating people.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你只為明年打算，那就種稻米。如果為十年後打算，那就種樹。但如果你是為了一輩子、甚至更長遠的未來打算，那最好的投資，就是「教育下一代」。這位政治家告訴我們，教育是最有價值、影響最深遠的工作。
meaning.en: If you are only planning for next year, plant rice. If you are planning for ten years from now, plant trees. But if you are planning for a lifetime and beyond, the best investment is to 'educate the next generation.' This statesman tells us that education is the most valuable and far-reaching work of all.

quote.ar: النفس جوهر بسيط غير داثر ولا فاسد
quote.zh-TW: 靈魂是單純的實體，不會生成，也不會毀滅。
quote.en: The soul is a simple substance, not subject to generation or corruption.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們的身體會長大、會變老，但我們內心的「靈魂」呢？這位阿拉伯哲學家認為，我們的靈魂是一個很單純、很純粹的存在，它不會像身體一樣出生或死亡。它是一種永恆的存在。所以，照顧好我們永恆的靈魂，比照顧短暫的身體更重要。
meaning.en: Our bodies grow up and get old, but what about our inner 'soul'? This Arab philosopher believed that our soul is a very simple and pure substance; it is not born and does not die like our physical body. It is an eternal existence. Therefore, taking care of our eternal soul is more important than taking care of our temporary body.

quote.el: οὔτε γὰρ ἂν γνοίης τό γε μὴ ἐὸν ... οὔτε φράσαις.
quote.zh-TW: 你既無法認識那「不存在者」，也無法將其指出。
quote.en: For you could not know that which is not... nor could you point it out.

meaning.zh-TW: 你能想像出一個「完全不存在」的東西嗎？這位哲學家說，這是不可能的！因為當你開始「想」它的時候，它就在你的思想裡「存在」了。他用這個很酷的邏輯告訴我們，我們的思想和真實的世界，有著非常奇妙的深刻連結。
meaning.en: Can you imagine something that 'absolutely does not exist'? This philosopher said it's impossible! Because the moment you start to 'think' about it, it already 'exists' in your thoughts. He used this cool logic to tell us that our minds and the real world have a very wonderful and deep connection.

quote.el: κρεῖσσόν ἐστιν σιωπῶντα εἶναι, ἢ λαλοῦντα μὴ εἶναι.
quote.zh-TW: 沉默而「是」，勝於言談而「不是」。
quote.en: It is better to be silent and be, than to talk and not to be.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話的意思是，做一個安靜的實踐者，勝過一個只會說空話的人。與其一直說自己有多棒、多善良，不如用實際行動，默默地把這些好事做出來。真正的價值在於你的「所是」，而不是你的「所言」。
meaning.en: This quote means it is better to be a quiet doer than a person who only speaks empty words. Instead of constantly talking about how great or kind you are, it is better to use your actions to quietly do good things. True value lies in what you 'are,' not in what you 'say.'

name.zh-TW: 昆圖斯·庫爾提烏斯·魯福斯

quote.la: Nihil est tam mobile quam rumor.
quote.zh-TW: 沒有什麼比謠言更易變。
quote.en: There is nothing so uncertain as rumor.

meaning.zh-TW: 謠言就像一陣風，吹來吹去，變來變去，非常不穩定，也非常不可靠。這位歷史學家提醒我們，不要輕易相信那些沒有根據的八卦或傳聞。要相信自己親眼所見、親耳所聞，並且經過思考判斷的事實。
meaning.en: Rumors are like a gust of wind; they blow here and there, change constantly, and are very unstable and unreliable. This historian reminds us not to easily believe baseless gossip or rumors. We should trust the facts that we have seen with our own eyes, heard with our own ears, and judged with our own thinking.

quote.ta: செயற்பால செய்யா तिरु, முயலாது முயଲਿऩ್, பயனில்லை.
quote.zh-TW: 該做之事，就應毫不猶豫地去做。
quote.en: What can be done, do without hesitation.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你確定一件事是對的、是該做的，就不要猶豫了，馬上去做！這位印度聖人告訴我們，猶豫不決、拖拖拉拉，會讓我們錯失良機。果斷的行動，是抓住成功機會的關鍵。
meaning.en: When you are sure that something is right and needs to be done, don't hesitate—do it immediately! This Indian sage tells us that hesitation and procrastination will cause us to miss good opportunities. Decisive action is the key to seizing the chance for success.

quote.el: Ἀδύνατον γὰρ μαθεῖν, ὃ δοκεῖ τις εἰδέναι.
quote.zh-TW: 一個人不可能學會他自以為已經知道的事。
quote.en: It is impossible for a person to learn what they think they already know.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你覺得自己的杯子是滿的，就不可能再倒進新的水了。學習也是一樣！如果你心裡覺得「這個我早就知道了」，你就聽不進新的知識了。這位老師提醒我們，要隨時把自己的心杯倒空，保持謙虛，這樣才能不斷地學習和進步。
meaning.en: If you think your cup is already full, you can't pour any new water into it. Learning is the same way! If you think to yourself, 'I already know this,' you won't be able to absorb new knowledge. This teacher reminds us to always empty our cup, stay humble, and only then can we continuously learn and grow.

quote.el: οὐδεὶς ἑκὼν ἐξαμαρτάνει.
quote.zh-TW: 沒有人是自願犯錯的。
quote.en: No one does wrong willingly.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話是蘇格拉底的核心思想之一。他認為，人之所以會做壞事，不是因為他們天生就壞，而是因為他們「不知道」什麼是真正的善。他們誤把壞事當成了好事。所以，教育和智慧，是引導人們走向善良的唯一方法。
meaning.en: This is one of Socrates' core ideas. He believed that people do bad things not because they are naturally evil, but because they 'do not know' what is truly good. They mistake bad things for good things. Therefore, education and wisdom are the only ways to guide people toward goodness.

quote.el: οὐκ ἄμεινον ἀνθρώποισι γίνεσθαι ὁκόσα θέλουσιν.
quote.zh-TW: 得到所有想要的東西，對人來說並非好事。
quote.en: It is not good for men to get all they wish.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果所有你想要的東西，都能立刻得到，你真的會比較快樂嗎？這位哲學家認為不一定。有時候，得不到的東西，才能讓我們學會努力、學會珍惜、學會等待。而且，慾望是沒有盡頭的，全部滿足反而可能帶來空虛。
meaning.en: If you could instantly get everything you ever wanted, would you really be happier? This philosopher didn't think so. Sometimes, not getting what we want teaches us how to work hard, how to cherish things, and how to wait. Besides, desires are endless, and fulfilling all of them might actually lead to emptiness.

quote.zh-TW: 弓張者、必病；刃申者、必折。
quote.en: A bow stretched to its limit will break; a blade sharpened to its limit will chip.

meaning.zh-TW: 一把弓如果拉得太滿，它很快就會壞掉。一把刀如果磨得太鋒利，它也很容易斷掉。這本古書用這個比喻告訴我們，凡事都不要做得太極端、太過火。「過猶不及」，保持適度和彈性，才能長久。
meaning.en: If a bow is pulled too taut, it will soon break. If a blade is sharpened too much, it will easily chip. This ancient book uses this metaphor to tell us that we should not do anything to the extreme or overdo it. 'Going too far is as bad as not going far enough.' Maintaining moderation and flexibility is the way to last long.

quote.zh-TW: 將你的學習當作固定的功課。
quote.en: Make your study a fixed practice.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位嚴格的老師建議，學習不能三天打魚、兩天曬網。要把學習變成像吃飯、睡覺一樣，每天固定要做的事。無論多忙，每天都撥出一點固定的時間來學習，養成習慣，這樣才能穩定地進步。
meaning.en: This strict teacher advised that learning cannot be a sporadic activity. You should make learning a fixed, daily practice, just like eating and sleeping. No matter how busy you are, set aside a little bit of fixed time each day to study. By making it a habit, you can ensure steady progress.

quote.el: διδόναι γὰρ αὐτὰ δίκην καὶ τίσιν ἀλλήλοις τῆς ἀδικίας κατὰ τὴν τοῦ χρόνου τάξιν.
quote.zh-TW: 萬物依循時間的安排，為其非正義之舉，接受懲罰，互相補償。
quote.en: For they pay penalty and retribution to each other for their injustice according to the assessment of Time.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位非常非常古老的哲學家，對世界有一種詩意的看法。他覺得世界上所有東西，都在一種「借」與「還」的平衡中。夏天向冬天借來了炎熱，冬天到了就要還回去。這是在告訴我們，整個宇宙都處在一種公平的、有秩序的循環之中。
meaning.en: This very, very ancient philosopher had a poetic view of the world. He felt that everything in the universe exists in a balance of 'borrowing' and 'returning.' Summer borrows heat from winter, and when winter comes, it must be paid back. This tells us that the entire cosmos operates in a fair and orderly cycle.

quote.zh-TW: 能主宰自己慾望的人，就能主宰世界。
quote.en: He who is a master of his desires is a master of the world.

meaning.zh-TW: 能夠控制自己，不被「好想要」的慾望牽著鼻子走的人，才是世界上最強大的人。因為他不會成為慾望的奴隸，他是自己內心真正的主人。能管好自己，比能管好任何其他東西都更厲害。
meaning.en: The person who can control themselves and not be led around by the nose by their 'I want it' desires is the most powerful person in the world. This is because they will not become a slave to their desires; they are the true master of their own heart. Being able to manage yourself is more impressive than being able to manage anything else.

quote.el: ὦ φίλοι, οὐδεὶς φίλος.
quote.zh-TW: 噢，朋友們，世無真朋友。
quote.en: O my friends, there is no friend.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來很奇怪又很傷心，對吧？但亞里斯多德不是說朋友不存在。他其實是在感嘆，一個「完美」的、能跟你心意完全相通的朋友，幾乎是不可能找到的。這句話提醒我們，要珍惜身邊不完美但很真實的朋友，不要用太高的標準去要求別人。
meaning.en: This quote sounds strange and sad, doesn't it? But Aristotle wasn't saying that friends don't exist. He was actually lamenting that a 'perfect' friend, one who understands you completely, is almost impossible to find. This quote reminds us to cherish the imperfect but real friends we have, and not to demand that others meet impossibly high standards.

quote.zh-TW: 為求真理而進行的對話，即為論辯 (vāda)。
quote.en: A dialogue undertaken for the purpose of ascertaining the truth is a good debate (vāda).

meaning.zh-TW: 跟別人討論事情，目的不是為了吵贏對方。這本關於邏輯的古書說，一場好的辯論，是為了和對方一起「找出真相」。大家把自己的想法拿出來，互相檢查，像偵探一樣合作，最後就能一起發現事情的真相。
meaning.en: The purpose of discussing things with others is not to win the argument. This ancient book on logic says that a good debate is one where both sides work together to 'find the truth.' Everyone puts their ideas on the table, examines them together, and cooperates like detectives to finally discover the truth of the matter together.

quote.el: ἐπεὶ οὖν ἡ παροῦσα πραγματεία οὐ θεωρίας ἕνεκά ἐστιν... ἀλλ' ἵν' ἀγαθοὶ γενώμεθα.
quote.zh-TW: 我們現在的研究不是為了理論…而是為了使我們成為好人。
quote.en: Our present study is not for the sake of theory... but in order that we may become good.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們為什麼要學習「品格」和「道德」？亞里斯多德說，目的不是為了讓我們知道「什麼是勇敢」，而是為了讓我們「成為」勇敢的人。學習哲學和品德，最重要的不是考試或懂得說，而是把它實踐在生活中，讓自己真正成為一個更好的人。
meaning.en: Why do we study 'character' and 'ethics'? Aristotle said the purpose is not so that we can know 'what courage is,' but so that we can 'become' courageous people. The most important thing in learning philosophy and virtue is not to pass tests or be able to talk about it, but to practice it in our lives and truly become better people.

quote.el: τὸ τῆς ῥητορικῆς τέχνης... ψυχαγωγία τις.
quote.zh-TW: 說話的藝術…是一種引導靈魂的技巧。
quote.en: The art of rhetoric... is a kind of soul-leading.

meaning.zh-TW: 「說話」不只是傳遞訊息，它更像一種魔法，可以直接影響、引導別人的內心和靈魂。柏拉圖認為，一個真正會說話的人，能夠引導聽眾的情緒和思想。這提醒我們，語言的力量非常強大，要謹慎、善良地使用它。
meaning.en: 'Speaking' is not just about conveying information; it's more like a kind of magic that can directly influence and guide other people's hearts and souls. Plato believed that a truly skilled speaker can guide the emotions and thoughts of their audience. This reminds us that the power of language is immense, and we must use it carefully and kindly.

quote.el: κύνες γὰρ καὶ βαΰζουσιν ὃν ἂν μὴ γινώσκωσι.
quote.zh-TW: 狗會對牠們不認識的人吠叫。
quote.en: Dogs bark at what they do not know.

meaning.zh-TW: 你有沒有發現，小狗常常對陌生人叫得特別兇？這位哲學家覺得，有些人也像這樣。當他們遇到自己不了解的新事物或新想法時，第一反應不是去了解，而是先反對、先批評。這提醒我們，在批評之前，要先試著去理解。
meaning.en: Have you noticed that puppies often bark most fiercely at strangers? This philosopher felt that some people are like that too. When they encounter new things or new ideas that they don't understand, their first reaction isn't to try to understand, but to object and criticize first. This reminds us that before we criticize, we should first try to understand.

quote.el: προσκολλῶ τῷ βελτίονι, κἂν πάντες ἄλλο λέγωσιν.
quote.zh-TW: 要依附於那靈性上更優越者，無論他人如何言行。
quote.en: Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior, regardless of what other people think or do.

meaning.zh-TW: 你要跟誰做朋友？你的榜樣是誰？這位斯多噶老師說，要去親近那些品格高尚、能讓你變得更好的人。不要管其他人怎麼想、怎麼做，要堅持你內心認為最好的標準和理想，並且緊緊跟隨它。不要因為別人而降低自己的標準。
meaning.en: Who should you be friends with? Who is your role model? This Stoic teacher said you should get close to people who have noble character and can make you a better person. Don't worry about what other people think or do; hold fast to the best standards and ideals you believe in, and follow them closely. Don't lower your standards just because of others.

quote.la: proprium humani ingenii est odisse quem laeseris.
quote.zh-TW: 憎恨你所傷害的人，是人類的天性。
quote.en: It is a principle of human nature to hate someone you have injured.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個很深刻的人性觀察。這位歷史學家發現，當我們傷害了別人之後，為了讓自己心裡好過一點，我們有時候反而會開始討厭那個被我們傷害的人。了解這一點，可以幫助我們反省自己：當我討厭一個人的時候，是不是因為我曾經對他做過不好的事呢？
meaning.en: This is a very deep observation about human nature. This historian discovered that after we have hurt someone, in order to make ourselves feel better, we sometimes start to hate the person we have injured. Understanding this can help us reflect on ourselves: when I dislike someone, is it because I have done something bad to them in the past?

quote.zh-TW: 法不阿貴，繩不撓曲。
quote.en: The law does not fawn on the noble, nor does the plumb line bend for the crooked.

meaning.zh-TW: 木工師傅用的墨線，不會因為木頭是彎的就自己跟著變彎。這位政治家說，法律也應該像這條墨線一樣。不管對方是多麼有錢有勢的人，法律都應該公平對待，不能偏心。這就是「法律之前，人人平等」的精神。
meaning.en: The ink line used by a carpenter will not bend just because the wood is crooked. This statesman said that the law should be just like this ink line. No matter how rich or powerful a person is, the law should treat everyone fairly and without favoritEism. This is the spirit of 'equality before the law.'

quote.he: כל שמעשיו מרובין מחכמתו, חכמתו מתקיימת. וכל שחכמתו מROבה ממעשיו, אין חכמתו מתקיימת.
quote.zh-TW: 行為多於智慧者，其智慧恆存；智慧多於行為者，其智慧不存。
quote.en: He whose deeds exceed his wisdom, his wisdom shall endure; but he whose wisdom exceeds his deeds, his wisdom shall not endure.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你做的好事，比你懂得的道理還多，那你的智慧就會越來越穩固。但如果你懂得很多道理，卻很少去做，那你的智慧很快就會消失。這位猶太智者告訴我們，真正的智慧，必須透過行動來滋養，否則它就會枯萎。
meaning.en: If your good deeds are more numerous than the wisdom you know, then your wisdom will become more and more stable. But if you know a lot of wisdom but rarely act on it, then your wisdom will quickly disappear. This Jewish sage tells us that true wisdom must be nourished by action, otherwise it will wither away.

quote.ar: الحزن هو ألم نفسي يأتي من فقدان ما نحب أو عدم الحصول على ما نرغب.
quote.zh-TW: 憂傷，是一種精神上的痛苦，來自於失去所愛或得不到所求。
quote.en: Sorrow is a spiritual pain that comes from losing what we love or failing to get what we desire.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們為什麼會感到難過呢？這位哲學家分析說，難過有兩種。第一種是因為我們失去了很喜歡的東西或人。第二種是因為我們很想要一個東西，卻得不到。他認為，如果我們能減少對這些身外之物的執著，我們的憂傷也就會跟著減少。
meaning.en: Why do we feel sad? This philosopher analyzed that there are two kinds of sadness. The first comes from losing something or someone we love very much. The second comes from really wanting something but not being able to get it. He believed that if we can reduce our attachment to these external things, our sorrow will also decrease.

quote.ta: அறிவினார் எல்லாம் உடையார் அறிவிலார் என்னுடைய ரேனும் இலர்.
quote.zh-TW: 有智慧者擁有一切，無智慧者一無所有。
quote.en: The wise who possess all things are yet nothing; the foolish who possess nothing are yet all.

meaning.zh-TW: 這位印度聖人認為，真正的財富是「智慧」。一個有智慧的人，就算什麼物質都沒有，他的內心也是豐盛的，等於擁有了全世界。相反地，一個沒有智慧的人，就算擁有很多財產，他的內心卻是貧乏的，等於什麼都沒有。
meaning.en: This Indian sage believed that true wealth is 'wisdom.' A person who has wisdom, even if they have no material possessions, is rich in spirit and thus possesses the whole world. On the other hand, a person without wisdom, even if they own a lot of property, is poor in spirit and thus has nothing at all.

quote.el: Εἰ θέλεις προκόπτειν, ὑπόμεινον ἀνόητος δοκεῖν καὶ ἠλίθιος.
quote.zh-TW: 如果你想要進步，就要甘於被認為是愚蠢和無知的。
quote.en: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

meaning.zh-TW: 在學習的路上，最怕的就是不懂裝懂。這位老師告訴我們，如果你真心想要進步，就要勇敢地承認「我不知道」，並且不怕被別人笑。只有當你願意放下身段，像個傻瓜一樣去問問題時，你才能學到最多、最快的東西。
meaning.en: On the path of learning, the worst thing you can do is pretend to know what you don't. This teacher tells us that if you truly want to improve, you must be brave enough to admit, 'I don't know,' and not be afraid of being laughed at. Only when you are willing to let go of your pride and ask questions like a fool can you learn the most, the fastest.

quote.zh-TW: 知足者富。
quote.en: He who knows contentment is rich.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話很短，但道理很深。老子認為，真正的富有，不是來自於你銀行裡有多少錢，而是來自於你的心。如果你懂得知足，對自己擁有的感到滿意和感謝，那你就是世界上最富有的人。因為你的心裡，永遠不會有「不夠」的感覺。
meaning.en: This sentence is very short, but its meaning is very deep. Laozi believed that true wealth does not come from how much money you have in the bank, but from your heart. If you know how to be content and feel satisfied and grateful for what you have, then you are the richest person in the world. This is because your heart will never feel 'not enough.'

quote.el: ψυχῆς ἐνέργεια.
quote.zh-TW: 心靈的能量，是生命的本質。
quote.en: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.

meaning.zh-TW: 是什麼讓我們活得有意義、有活力？亞里斯多德認為，答案是我們「心靈的能量」。也就是我們的思考、我們的熱情、我們的創造力。當我們積極地運用我們的頭腦和心靈去學習、去創造時，我們的生命就充滿了最根本的活力與光彩。
meaning.en: What is it that makes our lives meaningful and vibrant? Aristotle believed the answer is the 'energy of our mind.' That means our thinking, our passion, and our creativity. When we actively use our minds and hearts to learn and to create, our lives become filled with the most essential vitality and brilliance.

quote.el: ἡ γὰρ ἀρχὴ λέγεται μὲν ἥμισυ εἶναι παντός.
quote.zh-TW: 教育開啟的方向，將決定一個人未來的生命。
quote.en: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future life.

meaning.zh-TW: 小時候的教育，就像是為一棟大樓打下地基，也像是為一趟旅程設定好出發的方向。柏拉圖認為，一開始接受的教育，會深深地影響一個人的一生。所以，從小養成好的學習習慣和品格，是非常非常重要的。
meaning.en: Early childhood education is like laying the foundation for a tall building, or setting the direction for a long journey. Plato believed that the education one receives at the beginning will deeply influence their entire life. Therefore, it is very, very important to develop good learning habits and character from a young age.

quote.pi: सब्बपापस्स अकरणं, कुसलस्स उपसम्पदा, सचित्तपरियोदपनं, एतं बुद्धान सासनं।
quote.zh-TW: 不作一切惡，奉行一切善，淨化自己的心，這是諸佛的教導。
quote.en: To do no evil, to cultivate good, and to purify one's mind — this is the teaching of the Buddhas.

meaning.zh-TW: 佛陀所有的教導，可以用這三句話來總結。第一，不要做任何壞事。第二，要努力做各種好事。第三，要時常清理自己的內心，趕走不好的念頭。這就是通往智慧與平靜的完整地圖。
meaning.en: All of the Buddha's teachings can be summarized in these three sentences. First, do no evil deeds. Second, strive to do all kinds of good deeds. Third, constantly purify your own mind and drive away unwholesome thoughts. This is the complete map to wisdom and peace.

quote.la: multos timere debet, quem multi timent.
quote.zh-TW: 讓許多人害怕他的人，必然也要害怕許多人。
quote.en: He whom many fear, must fear many.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個讓所有人都很怕他的國王或領導，他自己心裡會不會也充滿了害怕呢？這位哲學家說，答案是肯定的。因為他會擔心別人來報復他。這告訴我們，用恐懼來統治別人，自己也無法得到真正的安寧。仁慈和尊重，才是更好的領導方式。
meaning.en: A king or leader who makes everyone afraid of him—do you think his own heart is also filled with fear? This philosopher said the answer is yes. Because he will constantly worry that others will take revenge on him. This tells us that if you rule others through fear, you yourself will never find true peace. Kindness and respect are the better ways to lead.

quote.ar: صناعة المنطق هي الأداة التي نميز بها بين الحق والباطل.
quote.zh-TW: 邏輯的藝術，是我們用以分辨真偽的工具。
quote.en: The art of logic is the tool by which we distinguish truth from falsehood.

meaning.zh-TW: 世界上有這麼多不同的說法，我們要怎麼知道哪個是真的、哪個是假的呢？這位哲學家說，我們有一個很厲害的工具，叫做「邏輯」。學習如何有邏輯地思考，就像是為我們的大腦裝上「謊言探測器」，能幫助我們做出正確的判斷。
meaning.en: There are so many different claims in the world, how can we know which ones are true and which are false? This philosopher said we have a very powerful tool called 'logic.' Learning how to think logically is like installing a 'lie detector' in our brains, which can help us make correct judgments.

quote.zh-TW: 予之為取，奪之為與。
quote.en: To give is to receive; to take away is to give away.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話充滿了辯證的智慧。它的意思是，當你願意「給予」人民好處時，你最終會「得到」他們的支持。相反地，如果你只想從人民身上「拿走」東西，你最終反而會「失去」他們。這告訴我們，付出和分享，才是得到最多回報的方法。
meaning.en: This quote is full of dialectical wisdom. It means that when you are willing to 'give' benefits to the people, you will ultimately 'receive' their support. Conversely, if you only want to 'take' things from the people, you will ultimately 'lose' them. This tells us that giving and sharing is the way to receive the greatest returns.

quote.el: ἵππου καλοῦ ὄντος, μὴ λέγειν ὅτι Ἐγὼ καλός εἰμι.
quote.zh-TW: 當馬是健美之時，莫說「我很健美」。
quote.en: When a horse is beautiful, do not say, 'I am beautiful.'

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你有一匹很漂亮的馬，你應該稱讚馬，而不是稱讚自己。這位哲學家提醒我們，不要把自己的價值，建立在你所擁有的東西上。你的價值來自於你自己的品格和智慧，而不是你的漂亮衣服、昂貴玩具或任何身外之物。
meaning.en: If you have a beautiful horse, you should praise the horse, not yourself. This philosopher reminds us not to base our own self-worth on the things we possess. Your value comes from your own character and wisdom, not from your nice clothes, expensive toys, or any external object.

quote.la: Non est ad astra mollis e terris via.
quote.zh-TW: 從地面通往星辰的道路，從不平坦。
quote.en: There is no easy way from the earth to the stars.

meaning.zh-TW: 想要達成偉大、像星星一樣閃亮的目標，那條路絕對不會是輕鬆好走的。這句充滿詩意的話告訴我們，所有了不起的成就，都需要付出艱苦的努力。不要害怕困難，因為那是通往成功的必經之路。
meaning.en: If you want to achieve great goals that shine like the stars, the road to get there will never be easy or smooth. This poetic quote tells us that all remarkable achievements require hard work and effort. Don't be afraid of difficulties, because they are a necessary part of the path to success.

quote.zh-TW: 井蛙不可以語於海者，拘於虛也。
quote.en: You cannot speak of the ocean to a frog in a well, for it is confined by its space.

meaning.zh-TW: 你沒辦法跟一隻只活在井裡的青蛙，描述大海有多麼遼闊，因為牠的眼界被小小的井口限制住了。莊子用這個比喻告訴我們，人的見識和胸襟，會被自己所處的環境限制。所以我們要努力學習、多去看看外面的世界，才不會變成一隻「井底之蛙」。
meaning.en: You can't describe the vastness of the ocean to a frog that has only ever lived in a well, because its view is limited by the small opening of the well. Zhuangzi used this metaphor to tell us that a person's knowledge and perspective can be limited by their environment. Therefore, we must study hard and explore the outside world so that we don't become a 'frog in a well.'

quote.zh-TW: 企者不立，跨者不行。
quote.en: He who stands on tiptoe is not steady. He who takes long strides does not walk far.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個人如果踮著腳尖站著，一定站不久。如果一個人跨著大步走路，也一定走不遠。老子用這兩個比喻告訴我們，做事情如果違反自然、太過刻意或急於求成，結果反而會不好。順其自然、一步一腳印，才是最好的方式。
meaning.en: A person who stands on their tiptoes cannot stand for long. A person who takes huge strides cannot walk far. Laozi used these two metaphors to tell us that if you do things in a way that is unnatural, too forced, or too rushed, the result will likely be bad. Following the natural course of things and taking one steady step at a time is the best way.

quote.el: μεγίστην ἡδονὴν... τὴν περὶ τὰ μαθήματα.
quote.zh-TW: 最大的快樂，是學習的快樂。
quote.en: The greatest pleasure is the pleasure of learning.

meaning.zh-TW: 世界上有各式各樣的快樂，像是吃美食、玩遊戲。但柏拉圖認為，有一種快樂比這些都更棒、更持久，那就是「學習的快樂」。當你搞懂一個很難的問題，學會一項新技能時，那種從內心發出的喜悅，是最高級的享受。
meaning.en: There are all kinds of pleasures in the world, like eating delicious food or playing games. But Plato believed there is one kind of pleasure that is better and more lasting than all the others: 'the pleasure of learning.' When you finally understand a difficult problem or master a new skill, the joy that comes from deep within your heart is the highest form of enjoyment.

quote.zh-TW: 你們自己必須努力，諸佛只是指路人。
quote.en: You yourself must make the effort. The Buddhas are only teachers who point the way.

meaning.zh-TW: 老師可以教你知識、為你指出方向，但真正要走路、要學習的人，是你自己。佛陀告訴我們，沒有人能替你努力。自己的進步，必須靠自己的雙手和頭腦去完成。要為自己的學習負起責任！
meaning.en: A teacher can teach you knowledge and point you in the right direction, but the person who actually has to walk the path and do the learning is you. The Buddha tells us that no one can make the effort for you. Your own progress must be achieved with your own hands and your own mind. You must take responsibility for your own learning!

quote.zh-TW: 大天而思之，孰與物畜而制之？
quote.en: Instead of glorifying Heaven and contemplating it, why not domesticate and regulate it?

meaning.zh-TW: 與其整天讚嘆大自然多麼偉大，然後被動地等它發生好事，為什麼我們不主動去研究它、管理它，讓它為我們所用呢？這位務實的哲學家，鼓勵我們要發揮人的主動性，去改造環境、解決問題，而不是消極地等待。
meaning.en: Instead of spending all day marveling at how great Nature is and passively waiting for good things to happen, why don't we proactively study it, manage it, and make it work for us? This practical philosopher encourages us to use our human initiative to transform our environment and solve problems, rather than waiting passively.

quote.el: ἔστω δὴ φόβος λύπη τις ἢ ταραχὴ ἐκ φαντασίας μέλλοντος κακοῦ.
quote.zh-TW: 所謂恐懼，是由於對未來某種毀滅性或痛苦之事的想像，所引起的痛苦或不安。
quote.en: Let fear be defined as a pain or disturbance due to a mental picture of some destructive or painful evil in the future.

meaning.zh-TW: 「害怕」這種感覺，是從哪裡來的呢？亞里斯多德分析說，它不是來自於事情本身，而是來自於我們腦袋裡，對於「未來可能會發生壞事」的「想像」。是我們自己的想像嚇到了自己。了解這一點，就能幫助我們去分辨，哪些害怕是合理的，哪些只是自己嚇自己。
meaning.en: Where does the feeling of 'fear' come from? Aristotle analyzed that it doesn't come from the thing itself, but from the 'imagination' in our minds about 'some bad thing that might happen in the future.' It is our own imagination that scares us. Understanding this can help us distinguish which fears are reasonable and which are just us scaring ourselves.

quote.zh-TW: 是以聖人不易舊，不法常，論世之事，因為之備。
quote.en: Therefore the sage does not try to follow the ways of the ancients or to establish any fixed standard for all time, but examines the affairs of the age and prepares his measures accordingly.

meaning.zh-TW: 聰明的人，不會死守著過去的老方法，也不會覺得有什麼規則是永遠不能改的。這位法家思想家說，真正有智慧的人，會仔細觀察「現在」的情況，然後根據現在的需要，來準備最好的方法。要因應時代的變化，隨時調整自己。
meaning.en: A smart person doesn't rigidly cling to the old ways of the past, nor do they believe that any rule can never be changed. This Legalist thinker said that a truly wise person carefully observes the 'present' situation and then prepares the best methods according to current needs. One must adapt to the changes of the times and adjust oneself accordingly.

quote.zh-TW: 貧而無怨難，富而無驕易。
quote.en: To be poor and not complain is difficult. To be rich and not be arrogant is easy.

meaning.zh-TW: 孔子觀察到，一個人在貧窮的時候，還能不抱怨，這是很困難、很了不起的修養。相比之下，在富有的時候，還能不驕傲，就比較容易做到。這句話讓我們思考，在不同的處境下，保持好的品格，所需要的努力是不一樣的。
meaning.en: Confucius observed that for a person to be poor and still not complain is a very difficult and remarkable kind of self-cultivation. In comparison, it is easier for a person to be rich and not be arrogant. This quote makes us think about how the effort required to maintain a good character is different in different situations.

quote.el: Οὐδὲν μέγα παραχρῆμα γίνεται.
quote.zh-TW: 沒有偉大的事物是突然間產生的。
quote.en: No great thing is created suddenly.

meaning.zh-TW: 一棵大樹不是一天長成的，一座宏偉的城堡也不是一天蓋好的。這位哲學家提醒我們，所有偉大、美好的事物，都需要時間和耐心的累積。不要期待馬上看到結果，要學會享受過程，一步一步、穩定地朝著目標前進。
meaning.en: A big tree does not grow in a single day, and a magnificent castle is not built in a day. This philosopher reminds us that all great and beautiful things require time and patient accumulation. Don't expect to see results immediately; learn to enjoy the process and move toward your goal step by step, steadily.

quote.zh-TW: 子非我，安知我不知魚之樂？
quote.en: You are not I, so how do you know that I do not know the joy of the fish?

meaning.zh-TW: 莊子看到魚在水裡快樂地游著，他的朋友卻說：「你又不是魚，怎麼知道魚很快樂？」莊子就這樣回答他。這句話提醒我們，我們永遠無法完全體會另一個生命的感受。所以，我們要對別人的感受保持一份尊重和謙虛，不要輕易地替別人下判斷。
meaning.en: Zhuangzi saw fish swimming happily in the water, but his friend said, 'You are not a fish, so how can you know that the fish are happy?' Zhuangzi replied with this question. This quote reminds us that we can never fully experience the feelings of another living being. Therefore, we should maintain respect and humility toward the feelings of others and not be quick to make judgments for them.

quote.zh-TW: 曲則全。
quote.en: To be bent is to become whole.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話充滿了 paradoxical 的智慧。意思是，有時候，懂得彎曲、懂得有彈性，才能讓自己保持完整。就像一棵柔軟的小草，在大風中彎下腰，反而不會被吹斷。而又高又直的大樹，卻可能會被吹倒。懂得適時的退讓和變通，是一種更高明的智慧。
meaning.en: This quote is full of paradoxical wisdom. It means that sometimes, knowing how to bend and be flexible is what allows you to remain whole. It's like a soft blade of grass that bends in a strong wind and therefore does not break, while a tall, straight tree might be blown down. Knowing when to yield and adapt is a higher form of wisdom.

quote.la: Calamitosus est animus futuri anxius.
quote.zh-TW: 一顆為未來焦慮的心，是痛苦不堪的。
quote.en: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你一直擔心明天會發生什麼壞事，那你今天就沒辦法好好地快樂了。這位斯多噶哲學家告訴我們，為還沒發生的未來過度焦慮，是在用想像中的痛苦來折磨現在的自己。要把專注力拉回到「現在」，好好地活在當下。
meaning.en: If you are constantly worried about what bad things might happen tomorrow, you won't be able to be happy today. This Stoic philosopher tells us that being overly anxious about the future, which hasn't happened yet, is torturing your present self with imaginary pain. You should pull your focus back to the 'present' and live well in the moment.

quote.zh-TW: 無友不如己者。
quote.en: Have no friends not equal to yourself.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話不是要我們瞧不起別人喔！孔子的意思是，要多和那些跟自己一樣，甚至比自己更優秀、品格更好的人交朋友。因為和好的朋友在一起，我們會互相學習、互相鼓勵，一起變得越來越棒。近朱者赤，近墨者黑，朋友對我們的影響很大。
meaning.en: This quote doesn't mean we should look down on others! What Confucius meant is that we should make friends with people who are as good as, or even better than, ourselves in character and virtue. This is because when we are with good friends, we learn from each other, encourage each other, and become better together. 'You are known by the company you keep,' and friends have a great influence on us.

quote.el: πότερον τὸ ὅσιον, ὅτι ὅσιόν ἐστιν, φιλεῖται ὑπὸ τῶν θεῶν, ἢ ὅτι φιλεῖται, ὅσιόν ἐστιν;
quote.zh-TW: 一件事是虔敬的，所以受到眾神的喜愛？還是因為受到眾神的喜愛，所以它才是虔敬的？
quote.en: Is the pious loved by the gods because it is pious, or is it pious because it is loved by the gods?

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個很有名、很像在繞口令的哲學問題！它在問：一件「對的」事情，是它本身就是對的，所以大家都喜歡它？還是因為大家都喜歡它，所以它才變成對的？這是在教我們思考，「好」與「壞」的標準，到底是來自於事物本身，還是來自於外界的看法。
meaning.en: This is a very famous philosophical question that sounds like a tongue twister! It's asking: Is something 'right' because it is inherently right, and that's why everyone likes it? Or does it become right only because everyone likes it? This is teaching us to think about whether the standards of 'good' and 'bad' come from the thing itself or from outside opinions.

quote.el: δι᾽ ἐλέου καὶ φόβου περαίνουσα τὴν τῶν τοιούτων παθημάτων κάθαρσιν.
quote.zh-TW: （悲劇）透過引發憐憫與恐懼，來達成此類情感的淨化。
quote.en: (Tragedy,) through pity and fear, accomplishes the catharsis of such emotions.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們看悲傷的電影或故事時，為什麼有時候會覺得心裡好像被洗乾淨了一樣？亞里斯多德說，這就是「淨化」的效果。透過在安全的情況下，感受故事角色的痛苦（憐憫）和害怕（恐懼），我們自己內心同樣的情緒，也跟著被抒發和清理了。藝術能幫助我們整理自己的情緒。
meaning.en: When we watch a sad movie or story, why do we sometimes feel as if our hearts have been cleansed? Aristotle said this is the effect of 'catharsis.' By experiencing the characters' suffering (pity) and fear in a safe environment, our own similar emotions are released and cleared away. Art can help us sort through our feelings.

quote.zh-TW: 心者，形之君也，而神明之主也。
quote.en: The mind is the ruler of the body and the master of the spirit.

meaning.zh-TW: 誰是我們身體和精神的國王呢？這位儒家哲學家說，是我們的「心智」。我們的心，指揮著我們的身體去行動，也掌管著我們的所有思想。所以，要好好地訓練和照顧我們的心，讓這位國王變得更聰明、更善良，這樣我們的言行舉止才會跟著變好。
meaning.en: Who is the king of our body and spirit? This Confucian philosopher said it is our 'mind.' Our mind directs our body to act and is in charge of all our thoughts. Therefore, we must train and take good care of our minds, so that this king can become wiser and kinder. When that happens, our words and actions will become better too.

quote.pi: अक्कोच्छि मं अवधि मं, अजिनि मं अहासि मे। ये च तं उपनय्हन्ति, वेरं तेसं न सम्मति॥
quote.zh-TW: 『他辱罵我，他毆打我，他戰勝我，他掠奪我。』心懷此念者，怨恨不平息。
quote.en: 'He abused me, he struck me, he overpowered me, he robbed me.' In those who harbor such thoughts, hatred is not appeased.

meaning.zh-TW: 如果你心裡一直想著「某某人欺負我」，一直唸著不放，那你心中的怨恨和生氣，就永遠不會消失。佛陀告訴我們，要學會「放下」。一直抓著過去不好的回憶不放，就像一直揹著一顆很重的石頭，只會讓自己越來越累。
meaning.en: If you keep thinking in your mind, 'So-and-so bullied me,' and you never let it go, then the hatred and anger in your heart will never disappear. The Buddha taught us that we must learn to 'let go.' Holding on to bad memories from the past is like carrying a heavy rock on your back; it will only make you more and more tired.

quote.zh-TW: 百聞不如一見。
quote.en: Hearing something a hundred times is not as good as seeing it once.

meaning.zh-TW: 聽別人說一百次「蘋果很好吃」，也不如你自己親口嚐一嚐。這句有名的成語，告訴我們「親身經驗」的重要性。很多事情，光是聽別人說是沒用的，你必須自己去看、去聽、去做，才能得到最真實、最深刻的了解。
meaning.en: Hearing someone tell you 'apples are delicious' a hundred times is not as good as tasting one for yourself. This famous proverb tells us the importance of 'personal experience.' For many things, just listening to others is not enough. You must see, hear, and do it yourself to gain the truest and deepest understanding.

quote.zh-TW: 過猶不及。
quote.en: To go too far is as bad as to fall short.

meaning.zh-TW: 做事情「超過」了，和「不夠」，其實是一樣不好的。孔子告訴我們，凡事都要追求「剛剛好」。不管是吃飯、讀書還是玩樂，都要懂得適可而止。保持平衡，才是最好的狀態。
meaning.en: Doing too much of something is just as bad as not doing enough. Confucius tells us that in all things, we should seek to be 'just right.' Whether it's eating, studying, or playing, we must know when to stop. Maintaining balance is the best state to be in.

quote.zh-TW: 既以為人己愈有，既以與人己愈多。
quote.en: The more he does for others, the more he has; the more he gives to others, the more he possesses.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話聽起來很神奇！老子說，你越是為別人付出，你自己反而會擁有更多。你越是把東西分享給別人，你自己反而會變得更富足。這是在教我們「分享」的魔法：付出不會讓我們變少，反而會讓我們的心靈和快樂，都變得更多。
meaning.en: This quote sounds magical! Laozi said that the more you do for others, the more you will have for yourself. The more you give to others, the more you will possess. This teaches us the magic of 'sharing': giving doesn't make us have less; on the contrary, it makes our spirits and our happiness grow even more.

quote.zh-TW: 人之生，氣之聚也。
quote.en: The life of man is a coming together of breath.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們是怎麼活著的呢？莊子用一個很簡單的比喻說，生命，就是「氣」的聚集。當氣聚在一起，我們就活著；當氣散開了，我們就離開了。他用這種方式告訴我們，生命是一個自然的過程，就像雲的聚集和消散一樣，不需要太過執著或害怕。
meaning.en: How are we alive? Zhuangzi used a very simple metaphor: life is a 'gathering of breath' (or vital energy). When this energy gathers, we are alive; when it scatters, we depart. He used this to tell us that life is a natural process, just like the gathering and scattering of clouds, and there is no need to be too attached to it or to fear it.

quote.la: Tamdiu discendum est, quamdiu vivas.
quote.zh-TW: 活到老，學到老。
quote.en: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.

meaning.zh-TW: 學習什麼時候可以停止呢？這位哲學家說：永遠不該停止！只要我們還活著，就應該一直保持學習的態度。世界一直在變，我們也一直在成長，所以「如何好好生活」這門課，是我們一輩子都要學習的功課。
meaning.en: When can we stop learning? This philosopher said: never! As long as we are alive, we should always maintain an attitude of learning. The world is always changing, and we are always growing, so the subject of 'how to live well' is a lesson we must study for our entire lives.

quote.el: τὸ τὰ αὑτοῦ πράττειν... δικαιοσύνη.
quote.zh-TW: 正義，就是做好自己的本分。
quote.en: Justice is doing one's own work.

meaning.zh-TW: 什麼是「正義」？柏拉圖給了一個很特別的答案。他認為，在一個團體裡，如果每個人都專心地、好好地做自己該做的事，不干涉別人，那整個團體就處於最和諧、最正義的狀態。所以，把自己份內的事做好，就是為團體貢獻了最大的正義。
meaning.en: What is 'justice'? Plato gave a very special answer. He believed that in a group, if everyone concentrates on doing their own job well and doesn't interfere with others, then the entire group will be in the most harmonious and just state. Therefore, doing your own part well is the greatest contribution you can make to the justice of the group.

quote.zh-TW: 健康是最佳的利得，知足是至上的財富。
quote.en: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth.

meaning.zh-TW: 世界上最好的禮物是什麼？是健康的身體。世界上最珍貴的財富是什麼？是懂得知足的心。佛陀用這句話告訴我們，不要去追求那些外在的、不實在的東西。把自己的身體照顧好，並且對生活常懷感恩和滿足，你就已經擁有了世界上最好的兩樣東西。
meaning.en: What is the best gift in the world? It is a healthy body. What is the most precious wealth in the world? It is a contented heart. The Buddha used this quote to tell us not to chase after external and unreal things. Take good care of your body, and always feel grateful and satisfied with your life, and you will already possess the two best things in the world.

quote.zh-TW: 實至而名歸焉。
quote.en: When the reality is there, the name will follow.

meaning.zh-TW: 當你真的把一件事情做得很好的時候，好的名聲自然就會跟著來。這位儒家哲學家告訴我們，不要急著去追求好聽的稱號或別人的稱讚。先把事情本身做好、做扎實，當你的「實力」到了，好的「名聲」自然就會是你的了。
meaning.en: When you have truly done something well, a good reputation will naturally come to you. This Confucian philosopher tells us not to be in a hurry to chase after nice-sounding titles or praise from others. Focus on doing the thing itself well and solidly. When your 'substance' is there, the good 'name' will naturally be yours.

quote.el: πράξεως μὲν οὖν ἀρχὴ προαίρεσις.
quote.zh-TW: 行動的開端，是選擇。
quote.en: The origin of action... is choice.

meaning.zh-TW: 我們做的每一件事情，它的起點是什麼呢？亞里斯多德說，是我們的「選擇」。在你決定要去做一件事之前，你的心裡其實已經做出了一個選擇。這提醒我們，要為自己的行為負責，因為每一個行動，都源自於我們自己的決定。
meaning.en: What is the starting point of every action we take? Aristotle said it is our 'choice.' Before you decide to do something, your mind has actually already made a choice. This reminds us to be responsible for our actions, because every action originates from our own decision.

quote.el: τὸν μὲν ἀγαθὸν οὐδὲν τῶν ἡδονῶν δουλεύειν, τὸν δὲ κακὸν πᾶσαις.
quote.zh-TW: 善者不為任何逸樂所奴役，惡者則為所有逸樂之奴隸。
quote.en: The good man is a slave to none of the pleasures, but the bad man is a slave to them all.

meaning.zh-TW: 一個有智慧的好人，是享樂的「主人」，他會享受快樂，但不會被快樂控制。而一個愚笨的人，卻會成為享樂的「奴隸」，被各種好玩的東西牽著鼻子走，無法自拔。這位哲學家提醒我們，要學會做自己情緒和慾望的主人。
meaning.en: A wise and good person is the 'master' of their pleasures; they enjoy pleasure but are not controlled by it. But a foolish person becomes a 'slave' to pleasure, being led around by all sorts of fun things, unable to break free. This philosopher reminds us that we must learn to be the master of our own emotions and desires.

quote.zh-TW: 知之易，用之難。
quote.en: To know is easy, but to use is difficult.

meaning.zh-TW: 知道一個道理，通常很簡單，聽老師說、看書，一下子就懂了。但要把這個道理，在生活中「用」出來，卻非常困難。例如，我們都知道「要誠實」，但要在所有情況下都做到誠實，就需要很大的勇氣和練習。知行合一，是我們一生的功課。
meaning.en: Knowing a principle is usually easy; you can understand it quickly by listening to a teacher or reading a book. But to 'apply' that principle in real life is very difficult. For example, we all know we 'should be honest,' but to actually be honest in all situations requires great courage and practice. Uniting knowledge and action is a lifelong task.

quote.zh-TW: 學而不思則罔，思而不學則殆。
quote.en: He who learns but does not think, is lost. He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.

meaning.zh-TW: 學習有兩個重要的翅膀：「學習」和「思考」，缺一不可。如果你只是一直接收新知識，卻不花時間去思考它的道理，你會感到迷惘。反過來，如果你只憑空想像，卻不去學習已有的知識，那就會很危險。要把學習和思考結合起來，才能飛得又高又穩。
meaning.en: Learning has two important wings: 'learning' and 'thinking,' and you need both. If you only absorb new information but don't take the time to think about its meaning, you will feel lost. On the other hand, if you only think and imagine without learning existing knowledge, that is very dangerous. You must combine learning and thinking to fly high and steady.

quote.zh-TW: 勝人者有力，自勝者強。
quote.en: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.

meaning.zh-TW: 能夠打敗別人，只能算是有力氣。但能夠戰勝自己的人，才是真正「強大」的。老子告訴我們，戰勝自己的弱點、控制自己的慾望，這種內在的力量，遠比贏過任何外在的對手，都更了不起、更有價值。
meaning.en: Being able to defeat others only means you have physical strength. But a person who can conquer themselves is truly 'mighty.' Laozi tells us that overcoming our own weaknesses and controlling our own desires—this inner strength is far more remarkable and valuable than defeating any external opponent.

quote.el: ἔστι γὰρ ἡ ἐλπὶς ἐγρηγορότος ἐνύπνιον.
quote.zh-TW: 希望是清醒者的夢。
quote.en: Hope is a waking dream.

meaning.zh-TW: 這是一個非常美的比喻！亞里斯多德說，「希望」就像是我們張著眼睛在做的夢。它讓我們在現實生活中，也能看見對未來的夢想和渴望。這份清醒的夢，給了我們前進的動力和方向。
meaning.en: This is a very beautiful metaphor! Aristotle said that 'hope' is like a dream we have while we are awake. It allows us, even in our real lives, to see our dreams and desires for the future. This waking dream gives us the motivation and direction to move forward.

quote.la: magna servitus est magna fortuna.
quote.zh-TW: 巨大的財富，是巨大的奴役。
quote.en: A great fortune is a great slavery.

meaning.zh-TW: 擁有巨大的財富，聽起來很棒，但這位斯多噶哲學家卻說，那可能是一種不自由。因為你會開始擔心失去它、需要花很多精力去管理它，反而變成了財富的奴隸。他提醒我們，簡單的生活，可能才是最自由、最輕鬆的。
meaning.en: Having a great fortune sounds wonderful, but this Stoic philosopher said it can be a form of slavery. This is because you start to worry about losing it and have to spend a lot of energy managing it, thus becoming a slave to your wealth. He reminds us that a simple life might actually be the freest and most relaxed one.

quote.zh-TW: 至人無己，神人無功，聖人無名。
quote.en: The perfect man has no self; the spiritual man has no merit; the sage has no name.

meaning.zh-TW: 莊子心中最厲害的三種人，是什麼樣子呢？他說，最完美的人，會忘記「自我」。最神妙的人，不會去想自己的「功勞」。最聖明的人，不會去追求自己的「名聲」。他們都達到了一種「無我」的境界，只是很自然地順應大道，這才是最高的智慧。
meaning.en: What are the three most amazing kinds of people in Zhuangzi's mind? He said the most perfect person forgets their 'self.' The most spiritual person doesn't think about their 'achievements.' And the wisest sage doesn't chase after their 'reputation.' They have all reached a state of 'selflessness,' simply and naturally following the great Way. That is the highest wisdom.

quote.el: Εἰ θέλεις γράφειν, γράφε.
quote.zh-TW: 如果你想寫作，就動筆寫。
quote.en: If you want to be a writer, write.

meaning.zh-TW: 這句話非常直接有力！它的意思是，不要只是「想」成為什麼樣的人，而是要直接「去做」那件事。如果你想成為畫家，就去畫。如果你想成為音樂家，就去練習。行動，是你成為理想中自己的唯一道路。
meaning.en: This quote is very direct and powerful! It means, don't just 'think' about what kind of person you want to be; you have to directly 'do' that thing. If you want to be a painter, then paint. If you want to be a musician, then practice. Action is the only road to becoming the person you want to be.

quote.el: παιδεία... ἀγαθοὺς ἄνδρας ἀποτελεῖν, ἀγαθοὶ δὲ γενόμενοι εὖ πράττουσιν.
quote.zh-TW: 教育能成就好人，而好人行事高尚。
quote.en: Education makes good men, and good men act nobly.

meaning.zh-TW: 教育的目的是什麼？柏拉圖說，教育最重要的目的，就是把我們培養成品格良好的人。而一個品格好的人，自然而然就會做出高尚、正確的行為。所以，好的教育，不只是教我們知識，更是教我們如何做一個好人。
meaning.en: What is the purpose of education? Plato said the most important purpose of education is to cultivate us into people of good character. And a person of good character will naturally do things that are noble and right. Therefore, a good education not only teaches us knowledge, but more importantly, it teaches us how to be a good person.

quote.pi: उट्ठानवतो सतिমতো, सुचिकम्मस्स निसम्मकारिनो। सञ्ञतस्स च धम्मजीविनो, अप्पमत्तस्स यसोभिवड्ढति॥
quote.zh-TW: 奮勉、正念、淨行、審慮、自制、正直、不放逸者，其譽必增。
quote.en: He who is energetic, mindful, pure in conduct, considerate, self-controlled, right-living, and vigilant—his fame ever increases.

meaning.zh-TW: 要怎麼獲得好的名聲呢？佛陀給了一張清單：要努力、要時常注意自己的念頭、行為要乾淨、做事要考慮周到、要能控制自己、要正直地生活、還要時時保持警覺。能做到這些好品格，好的名聲自然會跟著你。
meaning.en: How can one earn a good reputation? The Buddha provided a checklist: be diligent, always be mindful of your thoughts, be pure in your actions, be considerate in what you do, be self-controlled, live righteously, and always be vigilant. If you can practice these good qualities, a good reputation will naturally follow you.

quote.zh-TW: 主信臣，則國安。
quote.en: When the ruler trusts his ministers, the state is at peace.

meaning.zh-TW: 在一個團隊裡，領導者和成員之間，最重要的東西是什麼？這位法家思想家認為是「信任」。當領導者信任他的團隊成員，團隊成員也信任領導者時，這個團隊就能和諧安定，好好地運作。信任，是所有成功合作的基礎。
meaning.en: In a team, what is the most important thing between the leader and the members? This Legalist thinker believed it is 'trust.' When the leader trusts the team members, and the team members trust the leader, the team can be harmonious, stable, and function well. Trust is the foundation of all successful cooperation.
